title: PR AD - B2B Tech - Independent Agency
description:
Are you a B2B tech PR specialist looking for a new and exciting opportunity? If so, we could have just the role for you! A leading independent PR and digital communications agency has an opening for a PR Account Director within its growing team in London. This role will cover a diverse range of clients across the B2B tech spectrum. You will work closely with an expert team to develop, plan and manage the implementation of communications strategies, campaigns and media relations activity. You will help to lead the team across accounts and will oversee budgets and timelines to ensure activity is on track. You will be a key client contact and will be responsible for gaining an in-depth understanding of their business and objectives and providing strategic counsel when necessary.To be considered for this position you must have the following skills and experience:*PR agency experience at SAM/AD level*Excellent B2B tech PR credentials*Strong network of media and industry contacts*Sound commercial acumen For this and similar vacancies, please contact Gavin Watson on 020 7788 4343 PR Account Director, Account Director, PR Senior Account Manager, Senior Account Manager, PR Senior Account Director, Senior Account Director, B2B Tech, B2B Tech PR, B2B Technology PR, Tech PR, Technology PR, B2B PR, PR, Public Relations, London. PR Account Director, Account Director, PR Senior Account Manager, Senior Account Manager, PR Senior Account Director, Senior Account Director, B2B Tech, B2B Tech PR, B2B Technology PR, Tech PR, Technology PR, B2B PR, PR, Public Relations, London.
    


Contact: Gavin Watson
        

Reference: Totaljobs/14877

title: SEO Consultant - Hampshire - £35k
description:
A brand new opening has become available for an experienced SEO consultant to join an award-winning boutique search agency in Hampshire. The successful applicant will lead client SEO strategy, as well as contributing to wide-ranging areas of the business. A well-respected SEO and Content Marketing agency with an exciting portfolio of national and global brands offering a super career opportunity in a beautifully located agency with a completely non corporate environment. As a crucial member of the production team, the successful applicant will create and implement strategies to improve clients’ search visibility. They will also be expected to lead on their clients' technical auditing work and on-page optimisation.The role:-Working with clients to determine key challenges and opportunities-Carrying out competitor and customer benchmarking analysis-Technical audits using crawling tools-Keyword Research-Daily performance monitoring-SEO strategy-Link profile analysis-Data analysis-Using Google Analytics to a high level-Contribution to blog-Creating Performance reports-You will have a minimum of two years’ experience as a Technical SEO-You are able and eager to work independently -Offering support and advice to less experienced members of staff.-Experienced in digital marketing-A track-record of delivering results for clients.-A minimum of two year’s experience of doing technical SEO-A good understanding of HTML-Excellent Excel skills-Understanding of SEO best practices-Experience of multiple CMS and ecommerce platforms-Ability to learn quickly and on occasion without direction-Experienced with Screaming Frog SEO Spider, MajesticSEO & SearchMetrics-Ability to interpret complex data and create meaningful recommendations-Understanding of how to use and configure Analytics packages-Understanding of Schema and Semantic WebYou will be joining a small, award-winning team with a passion for combining technical and creative approaches to solve problems. You will relish the high amount of responsibility provided by the role, and will receive industry exposure, training and development.For full info contact Steve Lee – 07500 894 611



Contact: Steve Lee

title: Creative Writer - French Speaking
description:
Are you passionate about writing, and able to convey characters through your writing? Would you like to work for one of the largest, and most creative search engine providers in the world? And be based in their amazing London offices? Read on, apply, and you could be a part of the action!Our client have recently released a new electronic assistant (think the Amazon Echo, Apple's Siri, or the Microsoft Cortana), and a key part of this role will be writing exciting and engaging content for when people speak to the assistant!Role: Creative Writer Location: London, 6PS Building Duration: 6 Months Languages: French (fluency required as you will be writing for the French markets)Description: Have you ever written for a character for film, TV, video game, or comic book that can deliver a joke that can make a grandmother or teen smile? Are you the person at the party who wins the trivia contest because you can finish the fun film quote or recite obscure music lyrics? And, you can do all of this in English and another foreign language? If this sounds like you, the Doodle team may have a seat for you next to one of our talented team of characters who are creating some fun for the new electronic Assistant. The Assistant Personality team is dedicated to bringing a bit of fun and human touch to people interacting with the Assistant through chat, phones, TVs, watches, Home and other devices we haven't even thought of yet. As a Creative Writer, you'll be helping to adapt the Assistant persona for your region. You'll be writing dialogue and curating a wide range of content including jokes, quotes, fun facts, and games making sure it all feels natural for the market. Success will be measured both in terms of quantity (delivering a high volume of content) and quality (delivering culturally appropriate compelling content). Responsibilities -Creative writing and editing for dialogue, user interaction, and character development. -Maintaining style guide. Minimum Qualifications -5+ years as a Writer for a mass consumer audience. -Experience writing dialogue for plays/screenplays, fiction/interactive fiction, and/or comedy/entertainment. -Excellent organization and project management skills. -BA in Writing, or professional experience equivalent. Preferred Qualifications -Experience and interest in product & game design, design skills, & artificial intelligence. -Passion for pop-culture and current news. -Professional experience managing translation at scale.Click Apply Now! To get your CV in front of the hiring manager today!Randstad Business Support is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.


Contact: Katie Williams
        

Reference: Totaljobs/08702
        

Job ID: 74198414

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
A well-established accountancy firm is looking to appoint a Marketing Assistant to help with the delivery of its marketing and business development objectives. This role will assist in building the brand locally in line with firms brand guidelines, and in delivering marketing events and business development programmes to a high standard. Key areas of focus will include but not limited to:- Assist with the delivery of marketing campaigns to help drive leads to the business- Undertake market research to identify future business development opportunities- Manage the firm's events calendar, organise and attend events whether internal professionals or social functions or attendance at other networking events- Liaise with external agencies and suppliers (web developers, printers, advertisers, photographer, promotional companies etc.)- Maintain and develop the firms prospective client database management- Write and/or upload online content for website and social media i.e blogs, firm news etc and arrange for translations to be done in a timely manner.- Design and sending of client and prospect client marketing e-shots- Assist with the production of marketing materials and literature to include promotional items- Co-ordinate all client feedback. Analysing responses and reporting to management.- Arrange photo shoots for staff and PR purposes- Assist the Partners in analysing marketing and client data and writing monthly, quarterly and year end reportsRequirements of the Role:- Minimum 1 year experience within a professional services marketing role. - Personable, presentable and articulate- Effective project management skills- Sound understanding of marketing and business development principles- Exceptional written and verbal communication- Good understanding of IT packages: Word, Excel, Survey & E-Shot Management SystemsIf this sounds of interest please send your CV to apply now

title: Distribution Marketing Executive
description:
Vitality, Distribution Marketing Executive, London, Competitive salary + bonus + benefits Vitality is an award-winning, dynamic and vibrant financial services provider, with a ground breaking vision for the future. Where individuals are able to succeed and be rewarded and recognised for their contribution to our business.Our Distribution Marketing Executive will receive a competitive salary plus benefits including;- Bonus- A genuine long-term opportunity to grow and establish a long-term career- Our award winning private medical insurance- A comprehensive flexible benefits scheme- Stakeholder Pension Plan with employer contribution- Vitality Partners and RewardsAs our Distribution Marketing Executive you will responsible for helping to support and grow the intermediated and direct sales channels including Exclusive Associates. You will be responsible for the creation and management of sales marketing material and communications to these channels. This includes but is not limited to brochures, sales aids, video, presentations and digital content and distributing this content directly to the sales team and via our email platform.As our Distribution Marketing Executive you will be responsible for:- Work with sales team, technical marketing and broader distribution marketing team and Vitality Life- Create copy and brief design team- Manage items through sign off with key stakeholders- Distribute new and updated items to sales channels- Manage the upload of new items to digital channels- Manage trade advertising through the sign off process- Supply final artwork to publications- Work on content for monthly communication to our sales channels- Create and send communication using our email tool as required- Co-ordinate communications with the sales support team and technical marketing team- Work with the events team to ensure we have appropriate supporting material- Update all material in line with new benefits- Own and develop pages within the VitalityHealth Adviser site- Constantly question and review the online adviser user experience and make recommendations for improvement.- Promote digital servicing and quoting as the preferred routes for our sales channelsTo become our Distribution Marketing Executive, you will have the below skills and experience:Essential- 1 -2 years in a Marketing role- Innovate and defines new ways of doing things- Good understanding of digital channels- Good relationship skills- Ability to multi-task and prioritise activities and resources- Strong Copywriter- Digital Copywriting and experience using CMSDesirable- Worked within or closely with a sales function- Experience working with a membership based organisation- Experience within digital sales and servicing – preferably using Sitecore CMS and Wordpress- An understanding of the Vitality products and the wider health and protection market- Worked cross functionally and within the context of a larger marketing team- Working on large projects and working to tight deadlinesWorking for Vitality as an experienced Distribution Marketing Executive, you'll experience an exciting mix of creativity and innovation, within a framework of challenging objectives and a passion for delivering the best.Our people are chosen for their skills, knowledge, enthusiasm and attitude but above all, their belief that anything can be achieved.If you feel you have the skills and experience to become our Distribution Marketing Executive please click ‘apply’ today.

The successful Content Developer will work the agreed hours and reporting to the Director of Business Development, earn a salary of around £30,000, depending on experience. Part time and flexible hours will be considered. The successful Content Developer will be responsible for creating original content for our websites, social media outlets, newsletters, press releases, blogs, articles and advertising and marketing materials based on the requirements of the project and organisation. You core duties will include, but not be limited to: Developing content strategy aligned with short term and long term marketing targets, as well as creating its deliverablesCollaborate with marketing and design teams to plan and develop content, style and layoutCreating and publishing engaging contentEditing, proofreading and improving writers’ postsLiaising with content writers to ensure brand consistencyOptimise content according to SEOManaging content distribution to online channels and social media platforms to increase web trafficDeveloping an editorial calendar and ensuring all supporting teams re on boardEnsuring compliance with law (e.g. copyright and data protection)As a Content Developer, you will be a creative thinker, and have excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong attention to detail, with proofreading and editing skills, enabling you to develop clear and presentable content material using a lucid, simple, and easy to understand language. In addition, you will possess the following skills and experience: Ability to work both independently and with a teamDigital communication skillsConfident delivery under pressure and to tight deadlinesAnalytical skillsAttention to detailAbility to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyCreativity, resourcefulness in the use of original ideasHands on experience with MS Office and WordPressKnowledge of SEO and web traffic metricsFamiliarity with Social MediaExcellent English writing and verbal skillsProficiency with content management softwareGood organisational and time management skillsBSc degree in Journalism, Marketing, Media & communication, English or related/ relevant fields (advantageous but not essential)Proven work experience in content development role (advantageous but not essential)Good knowledge of HTML, Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Macromedia flash, MS- FrontPage (advantageous but not essential)Basic understanding of/about Islam (advantageous but not essentialArabic language (advantageous but not essential)If you are interested in the Content Developer role, based in Birmingham, please submit your CV along with a covering letter explaining why you believe you are suitable for the position, including any relevant experience or qualifications.

        International Marketing Manager, Ascot -Are you an experienced marketer with international experience? Do you have B2B and B2C marketing experience? If so, this could be the role for you! Joining an exceptionally well known business on the outskirts of Berkshire, this role requires you to have solid, all rounded, marketing experience, both digital and more traditional marketing routes. Similarly, this role requires someone to have previous team management experience. Reporting to the Head of Marketing, this role will see you managing a portfolio of high profile brands in a well-established team. Leading the marketing strategy, you will also be responsible for all marketing related activities. You will conduct regular analysis of competitor performance alongside relevant marketing developments and trends. Candidates applying for this role will ideally have strong B2B and B2C marketing management experience that includes some exposure to working within either healthcare, pharmaceutical or possibly products being sold into the healthcare segment.This is a fantastic position for an experience marketer ideally with at least 5 years' experience to join a well-established and constantly developing company. Due to the office location, this role is commutable to those living in Ascot, Guildford, Bracknell, Wokingham and part of south West London. title: eCommerce Executive
description:
Established, market leader.Pureplay retailer. Focus on optimisation and analytics.With a strong heritage in Portsmouth, this business has grown from an independent bricks and mortar retailer to a market leading eCommerce business. The eCommerce Executive role provides an opportunity to work in one of the most cutting-edge areas of eCommerce – key points of focus including optimisation, analytics, UX and testing. What you’ll be doingWorking as part of the eCommerce team, which sits in a larger marketing setup, you’ll report into the eCommerce Manager. The role will involve analysing customer behaviour on eCommerce sites across the business. First off, understanding where changes can be made to improve overall performance of the site, then working with the internal team to deliver these changes. Optimisation tools will include MVT and A/B testing, Google Analytics and customer feedback. This insight will act as the foundation for your recommendations, as well as testing developments to ensure a continual cycle of improvement (KPIs include bounce rate, conversion rate and online turnover). You’ll then work closely with the IT and UX teams, immersing yourself in the Agile process to track projects, rank tickets by order of importance, and ultimately ensure they are delivered on time. Additional areas of focus will include monitoring the tone of voice across sites, ensuring consistency on other platforms (mobile, tablet) and communicating changes internally throughout the business. What experience you’ll needIdeally experience working for an eCommerce business, either pureplay or multi-channel. Experience with Google Analytics, MVT and A/B testing, or similar tools. Candidates with a digital background will still be considered, as long as they possess a passion for eCommerce. Knowledge of user research and an analytical mindset. Excellent communication skills to work with stakeholders at a variety of levels. What you’ll get in return for your talentsSalary here is up to £24k depending on experience, further to additional benefits on request. Regular activities and social events are organised, so a great place to work in terms of culture and work life balance. What’s next? Send your CV to Joe, or get in touch to hear more about the role.
    
    

Contact: Joe Child
        

Reference: Totaljobs/7344

title: Product Manager
description:
JOB TITLE: Product ManagerDEPARTMENT: MarketingREPORTING TO: Marketing ManagerSALARY: Negotiable 33 days Holiday inc statutory, company pensionThis role might suit someone who has some Product Management experience gained in Placement year, or indeed someone with a year or two's experience in Product.This may also appeal with someone with a lot more experience who is looking for the right work/home life balance and wants a role where they can work independently.This is not a creative type Marketing role but a very range based role that may suit either a someone from buyer, category or Marketing background.OVERALL JOB PURPOSE The job holders key responsibilities include:-• the effective execution of product/brand plans,• identifying new product opportunities• optimising the entire product range to maximise manufacturing efficienciesMAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESManage the product lifecycle for the Branded range with consideration to associated Private Label ranges.To include:? Initial product creation for all Paper - Branded and then all Private label items also? Ongoing gap analysis and competitor benchmarking? Identification and evaluation of range rationalisation opportunities ? Management of the product discontinuation process? Identify and evaluate new product opportunities? Provide key support to Account management in our customers’ catalogue product selection process.? Ensure product is available to the market to agreed schedules.? Monitor and report on product performance. Review branded product profitability and ensure plans are in place to maximise this? Understand the environmental accreditations associated and ensure the credentials of the branded range are optimum for the market. Responsible for maintaining product environmental data.? Provide support to the Quality Manager in the auditing of manufacturing processes and product quality reporting? Manage and maintain all product specification data and continually monitor manufactured and sourced goods against this specification.? Manage the production of all product photography and maintain an image library, including product logos? Provide support to the sales and marketing team for all customer product enquiries.? Maintain all branded product data on appropriate systems and provide support for all customer data enquiries. Including barcodes.? Undertake category analysis on behalf of our key customers, working within their reporting framework to deliver key category proposals and recommendations.? Research competitors, benchmarking, gap analysis and also ensure the team have the latest market data and analysis availableSTAKEHOLDERS INTERNAL Reporting into, and working closely with, the Marketing Manager and Marketing Communications Executive.Supporting the Account Managers and the Customer Service team. Building strong relationships with the Production and Logistics teams.EXTERNAL Working with Design and creative agencies, packaging suppliers, other group manufacturing facilities and external suppliers.Provide product support to all key customers - wholesale, retail; and contract.CAPABILITIES AND COMPETENCIESEducated to degree level with previous experience in a B2B product management/marketing environment.A product champion, highly numerate and analytical with the ability to find insights from data and develop them into actions and recommendations. Sound financial and commercial acumen, capable of understanding the brand portfolio P&L and making commercially viable recommendations.Strong attention to detail, results focussed and gets things done.A confident presenter.Project management skills.Capable of working effectively across a number of projects simultaneously Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence well with customers and across all business functions.Highly proficient in MS Office suite.Exposure to a manufacturing environment ideally in office products, paper or stationery, or B2B distribution preferable.FRS strives to be an equal opportunities employer, and is committed to treating all applicants alike. FRS does not treat any individual on grounds of sex, age, colour, marital status, race, nationality or ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability or membership or non-membership of a trade union, less favourably than others. All vacancies advertised are open to all ages.

title: Senior Product Manager - London - £50k - £60k - DOE
description:
My client is a well known household brand based in Central London, looking for a Senior Product Manager to join their thriving digital marketing department. This is an exciting time to join as the brand are experiencing a great deal of growth in their already established digital department.You will have full ownership over the product roadmap and be responsible for managing all areas of of the product life cycle. You will work closely with dev and design teams, and along side Scrum teams to manage the delivery. You will manage product across web, mobile and apps for IOS and Android for a global market.To be considered for this role you will have a strong background working in a B2C product departments, B2B is a bonus. You will be equally as strong on web and on Mobile. You will have experience working in an international capacity and have a strong commercial approach with a solid technical skill set.To apply for this role contact Shakara Rose at Blu DigitalKEYWORDS: Product, Product Development, Roadmap, UX, UI, Design, Digital Marketing,

title: E-Commerce Executive
description:
Our client has grown rapidly over the past few years, and they strive towards a reputation for providing quality goods with customer service levels that are second to none. As a leading online retailer, they are looking to strengthen their team and this is a fantastic opportunity to join as an ECommerce Executive.  Within this role you will assist the Head of Digital Marketing in the implementation of the online traffic driving strategy for our website. Providing day to day analysis of all digital marketing channels, including Paid Search (PPC), Affiliates, Display Advertising and Search Engine Optimisation (SEO), you will continually review and optimise the activity, budgets and ultimately results. You will work closely with insight and analytics functions to develop a deep understanding of our customer base and continually evolve the plan to ensure the business are always attracting the right customer mix.  We are looking for highly motivated and creative individual with a proven track record in a digital marketing role, ideally within the online retail industry. You will have strong agency management skills and a solid understanding of digital channel management and optimisation. You will additionally have the ability to analyse data as well as an eye for detail to ensure briefs are accurate and signed off in a timely manner.  This is a fantastic opportunity for a marketing professional to drive the digital media forward and be an integral part of their team.
    


Contact: Jonathan Voss
        

Reference: Totaljobs/JV/11138A

title: Marketing Executive - COLLATERAL CREATION
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen within this growing Financial Services company for someone with marketing collateral experience within Financial Services. Excellent company to develop with, they have expanded the workforce by around 25% the last 2-3 years as product demand grows. You will organise the copy-writing, design, proofing, production and distribution of marketing materials for the company to include literature; direct mail; advertising; emails; newsletters; exhibition kit and promotional goods.The Company: Our client specialises in lending and retail savings, the office now numbering around 160-170 people, with a reputation for developing staff. The business has recently re-branded and so they are looking for consumer facing marketers to help drive their new customer acquisition strategy. Further expansion is planned and they are putting their digital marketing and analytics at the forefront of the business strategy.The Role: Within a team of 8, you will take on responsibility for driving all customer acquisition campaigns across Digital channels: PPC, SEO, DR Optimisation and Social. As Marketing Executive, you will play a fundamental role in supporting the Marketing Manager to manage and deliver the overall plan, as well as playing a lead role when it comes to creating marketing collateral and campaigns. Our client wants to see a passion for marketing and possession of broad channel knowledge, as well as having the confidence to make performance related recommendations. You will be responsible for:Organising the copy-writing, design, proofing, production and distribution of marketing materials - to include literature; direct mail; advertising; emails; newsletters; exhibition kit & promotional goodsSupport frequent and business critical product launches, withdrawals and refreshes across both mortgages and savings, updating literature and web content as relevant.Ensure that existing materials and content (web and off-line) are regularly reviewed and then updated or withdrawn as necessary.Write copy for both web and off-line, ensuring tone of voice guidelines are followed and all communications are clear, fair and not misleading to customers.Assist with the planning, implementation and monitoring of marketing campaigns that help cross/up sell to existing customers and drive warm, cost-efficient and quality prospects to the websites and New Business Team.Assist with the organisation of on-site and off site exhibitions, workshops and seminars, including promotion and logistics.Skills / Experience Required: Candidates must be able to create engaging marketing collateral (copy writing, proofing ad production) and generate results from their campaigns, ideally with a background in Financial Services. You should have experience of coordinating cross-channel marketing campaigns and be able to juggle multiple projects and prioritise effectively in an often fast-paced environment with competing pressures.Additional Information: The salary range for this role is £30,000 - £35,000 with pension, bonus and a variety of additional benefits.The Marketing Executive position is only one of many vacancies we are handling. ARC is a specialist within Financial Services recruitment and the Consultant handling this role has over 20 years experience in this field. Areas of expertise include pensions, sales support, employee benefits/group risk, compliance, flexible benefits, paraplanners, underwriting, customer services and IT related roles. We predominately focus on London and the Home Counties, although we have also been successful in offering national solutions and overseas. Check the website and feel free to call Darren Snell at any time.


Contact: Darren Snell
        

Reference: Totaljobs/arc405
        

Job ID: 74198533

title: Communications Manager
description:
Exciting contract role with a global pharma company! Are you a Senior Communications Manager with strong digital skills and experience in communicating a global finance/ERP roll-out?Job Purpose:To define the communication strategy and approach for the roll out of 3 new expense management mobile applications, in conjunction with changes to the global travel and expense policy. The approach is to be aligned with the existing ERP methodology and communications toolkit. This role will work in partnership with the aligned change and training managers as part of CERPS Business Change and Engagement Team.The ideal candidate is a proficient corporate change communication professional with a digital, creative mindset that can convey complex or technical concepts into easy to digest storytelling - with previous experience in T&E and SAP (or equivalent ERP) global roll-outs.Basic qualifications:* Experience gained in a corporate communication or matrixed environment* Experienced in managing communications for major change program and knowledgeable of change management tools and techniques with proven ability to lead complex projects* Effective in an environment with tight deadlines, finite resource and uncertainty. Ability to drive performance against timelines.* Excellent writing & editing skills i.e. conveys complex or technical concepts into easy to digest storytelling* Creative skills in graphic design (development of info-graphics, posters, banners and other communications collateral)* Strong Digital communication skills, including intranet & social media; ability to apply in communications* Ability to segment audiences and target the right message to the right person* Demonstrated ability to work in a self-structured, project-based environment* Experience in supporting leader communication and engagement through event planning and execution* Customer and patient focus - understanding relationship management and networking* Stakeholder engagement experience* Strong at relationship building, collaborative* Self-motivated, establishing clear activities/responsibilities and target outcomes, with proven ability to work collaboratively as a team member and independently.Preferred qualifications:* Strategic thinker* Works well at both strategic and tactical level* Expert net-workerKey Responsibilities:* Development and delivery of the communications approach (repeatable model) and plan taking into account existing ERP methodology and communications toolkit* Ensure communications, training and change plans are aligned by working closely with Business Change and Training teams. Understand the change, the impact to employees and leverage business change impact and readiness assessments to shape people centric key messages that land well* Deliver a communication toolkit that can be deployed in phases across multiple countries incl digital (social media, email, website, video, infographics) and non-digital channels (events, briefings)* Write, develop and maintain microsite (SharePoint)* Create and deliver personalized communication by audience type* Stakeholder engagement, audience mapping* Communication effectiveness tracking and reporting via qualitative (surveys) and quantitative (analytics) methods* Being responsible for the brand alignment of communication materials with brand (tone of voice, look and feel)* Build strong relationships and work collaboratively to ensure 'one team' ways of working and the sharing of communication best practiceClick Apply Now! To get your CV in front of the hiring manager today.Randstad Business Support is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.


Contact: Katie Williams
        

Reference: Totaljobs/0423
        

Job ID: 74197056

title: Insight Manager - Clientside
description:
The Company Our client is a professional body industry leader, within the financial services sector, looking to take on a Insight Manager to join their research and insight team for a 12 month fixed term contract. The company is based in central London, and boasts a professional and friendly working environment, with the opportunity for progression. They have an excellent benefits package and offer a competitive salary for the right candidate. The Role In this role, you will be part of the research team, working on a range of quantitative and qualitative projects within customer satisfaction and experience. Around 60% of the work is managed in- house and you will be responsible for project set-up, writing questionnaires, project management, analysis, reporting and presenting to internal stakeholders, across all both methodologies. You will support others in the team in creating solutions through Big Data. A key part of your role will be to engage teams within the business to utilise the research results to make strategic implementations. You will be required to manage external research agencies as well, ensuring that they have clear briefs and are able to deliver high quality work to budget and within the time frames. A key part of the role will be to build up strong internal relationships within the UK and internationally. The Candidate The ideal candidate will be educated to degree level and will have a solid research agency background, within quantitative and qualitative studies. Experience within financial services and clientside as well would be an advantage. You will have worked within customer satisfaction and experience/loyalty programmes, across ad hoc and tracking studies. You will be highly organised, and able to manage multiple projects at one time and able to build up rapport well with people on all levels. You will be someone that enjoys working in a team and in collaboration with people, striving to get the best results from your research and insight programmes.


Contact: Amy Kirby
        

Reference: Totaljobs/1014060

The core elements of the role will be the selection of target customers and the deployment of campaigns using a campaign management system to customers with OnStar equipped cars across all European countries. The campaign programme will be heavily integrated with the car brands’ CRM programme and will take a multi-channel approach.Other key responsibilities include:Support the business owner, Campaign Manager Lead, with OnStar Europe customer campaign management processes and systemsCampaigns to be delivered across a wide range of channels to include email, direct mail, SMS, outbound telephone, in-vehicle-voice-message, and mobile app pushLead the build of customer journeys in OnStar Europe’s campaign management toolWork closely with the CM Lead to build the rules and logic in the OnStar Europe database environment to define customer journeysSupport UAT for customer journeys, new campaign manager functionality and the evolution of the customer journey rulesDesign & implement day to day data quality management to ensure optimal delivery rates for campaigns, and to support reporting & analysis, working closely with OnStar IT, GMIT & car brands’ Customer Experience teamsWorking with the Campaign Management Lead andCustomer Insight Lead, to continually review performance of campaigns to identify areas for improvementMonitor campaigns to ensure they are communicating with customers correctly and as plannedSupport the CM Lead on liaising with key agencies for campaign management support activitiesEnsure strict application of customer data governance policies in all campaign management processes so that customer data and customer marketing preferences are safeguarded.Support research and resolution of customer escalations related to direct marketing treatments, including root cause analysis and any remedial actions required to avoid recurrences from a campaign operations perspectiveCo-ordination between multiple areas of the organisation and/or external agencies ensuring work is delivered on time; this could be anything from project work to signing-off translated textAble to interrogate data to ensure correct customer targeting. You will need to be able to work autonomously, identifying areas of concern and then running a root cause analysis to understand the impact of any issues, finally proposing a solution to issues identifiedSome European travel will be required from time to timeQualificationsWhat they expectA successful candidate for the CRM Campaign Specialist role should have the following:Must have experience of using advanced campaign management systems to run multi wave, multi-channel marketing campaigns.Significant experience with relational databases also requiredPrevious experience in database marketing in consumer service businesses including regular payment based subscription servicesExperience of campaign management across multiple country markets in Europe, involving different languagesExperience in direct marketing campaign management, particularly in campaign data selection, design, and productionAbility to communicate clearly and preciselyExceptional verbal and written English skillsAbility to understand and translate business/direct marketing strategy into technical and operational requirements, particularly database operationsKnowledge using SQL is an advantageWhat they offerCompetitive SalaryCompany pension schemeInclusion on the company car schemeCompany life Assurance scheme...and a lot more!They are looking forward to receiving your application as well as relevant supporting documents (cover letter, CV and certificates), including your salary requirement and period of notice.Please note that they only accept applications via their online platform.Our client is an equal opportunity employer.

title: E-Commerce Performance Marketing Specialist
description:
Converse - E-Commerce Performance Marketing Specialist Scope and ResponsibilitiesLeading with Digital, Converse is setting a bold strategic plan to enable and inspire consumer self-expression by positioning converse.com as the first and best source for authentic Converse products and experiences. Reporting directly to the Performance marketing manager of e-Commerce EMEA, the e-Commerce Performance Marketing specialist will be a key member of the team, responsible for driving quality traffic and revenue Online for one of the most iconic brands in the world. Your responsibilities will range from planning, implementing, analyzing, optimizing and overall managing all aspects of the Email program. You will work closely with Brand, Merchandising, and Site Experience teams to build a best-in-class Email program that drives customer engagement, loyalty and increases lifetime value. This opportunity requires the strategic expertise to grow the program as well as the entrepreneurial roll-up-your-sleeves initiative to execute it. Additionally, you’ll partner with our global teams to ensure that email programs are adapted and localized where appropriate. You will also support the projects around other performance marketing channels such as Paid Search, Natural Search, Remarketing and Affiliate Marketing and work towards achieving performance goals aligned with the Western Europe and Global Direct to Consumer (DTC) strategy and priorities. You will leverage analytical skills to ensure we are measuring our programs effectively and evolving them to be even better in the future. You will drive traffic and revenue, achieve targeted ROI and maintain positive KPI trends. Also work closely with Analytics team to turn data into actionable insights, to understand the consumer, improve marketing performance, and the overall business. You own and manage relationships with vendors and agencies to ensure they have the necessary campaign details and assets on-time in order to execute our campaigns optimally. QualificationsBachelor in Marketing, Advertising, eCommerce, Business or a related field.2+ years digital (performance) marketing experience, preferably with a premium eComm brand within an international environment (corporate or agency)Sound understanding/knowledge of Email marketing (required), Natural Search, Paid Search, Affiliates, Display, and loyalty programs. Ability to translate merchandising and brand efforts into meaningful email campaigns that produce resultsExperience with mobile and social media advertising including apps is a plusDemonstrate great commercial & industry acumenStrong analytics skills with the ability to identify the metrics that drive success, understand multiple data sources, drive conclusions and deliver meaningful, actionable strategic recommendations. Make decisions based on qualitative and quantitative data.Ability to effectively manage a 3rd party external agency.Excellent working knowledge of web analytics tools and the ability to consolidate and analyze data from multiple sources – experience in Omniture and Salesforce is a plusStrong communication skills: written & oral and ability to quickly build strong relationshipsAbility to work across cultures and geographies to support local digital needsAbility and desire to work at both the strategic and tactical levels.Outstanding team player and positive attitude, with a strong sense of ownership and accountabilitySelf-starter mentality and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment



Contact: Recruitment Team
        

Reference: Totaljobs/SRC05232017CECPMS
        

Job ID: 74210137

Senior Digital Content Manager - Germany€Competitive + Bonus + Package + RelocationI am keen to speak to Senior Content strategists with strong ecommerce credentials about a brand-new position with one of my key clients based in Germany.My client is a global brand, looking to build up their own digital capabilities as they embrace a D2C business model, moving away from their wholesale background. As a result of this transition, they are building their Digital experience team to ensure that customers can connect with the brand at each digital touchpoint through inspirational content.This is a role that has huge scope - you will define the end to end content strategy, governance and guidelines for the entire brand in Western Europe, and work with teams on a global level to share best practise and ideas to ultimately drive consumer sales.Day to day, the Senior Digital Content Manager will be responsible for:Creating a content strategy that drives digital story telling - you will work with teams to ensure that the right content is delivered in the right place at the right time - be that to compliment new product launches, sport events, fashion week etc.Defining Content Governance and guidelines - educate the business of content best practise.Act as the link between digital content and digital customer experience - advise the rest of the business of the best way to use content to drive engagement with customers.Lead the production of digital assets (copy and image) and work with various teams to create product assets and define what assets need to be created to display and drive products.This role would suit someone who has strong Content Management experience in an ecommerce environment, as well as vast experience defining content guidelines - you are passionate about content marketing, and digital storytelling through smart content, and you have the gravitas to create and implement content best practise guidelines at international level. You will be analytical and detail orientated and would not be fazed delivering large scale Content projects across multiple territories. You will be quick thinking and adept at solving problems. Most importantly, your stakeholder management skills will be second to none; this role will work with stakeholders across multiple territories and time zones, some who 'get digital' some who don't - as such, you will have to be confident to influence and build relationships with these teams to ensure results.It is important to note that this is not an editorial role and would not be right for candidates who are looking to remain hands on with content creation as there is a separate team who delivers copy for the brand. However, you will work incredibly close with Brand teams and business units to plan what content and digital assets are needed for Ecommerce channels, and then see these plans through to implementation.To find out more, please send your CV to Cat Symons - either directly, or via LinkedIN 


Contact: cat symons
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CSSDM

Your second year will start in Retail to gain insight into how stores operate.   You’ll then have the opportunity to spend 3 months in our offices in Australia, Malaysia or the Netherlands, working with the International team to grow the JD brand overseas. By the end of the two year’s you will have the chance to enrol on the Masters in Multichannel Retailing which we have collaborated on with Manchester Metropolitan University.   Once the programme is complete you will be ready to join the team on a permanent basis, using your expertise, drive and divergent thinking to lead the team into the future.    How to apply We’d like to really get to know you as soon as you apply so are asking all candidates to submit a short video of themselves. We want to know the information that’s not on your CV! Tell us about your interests and hobbies, what motivates you, why you think you’d be a good fit for this role and share with us your greatest achievement so far. The only rules are it has to be 2 minutes or less and you need to be as creative as possible Upload an unlisted video to YouTube and share the link with us on your CV. All CVs to be sent to; Deadline for Applications – End of June Programme Start Date – September 2017   Key Responsibilities   To learn and work as part of cross-functional departments on a rotational basis, with a multi-channel focus to develop your technical skills and business acumen. To deliver developments in key performance indicators in each functional area To learn and develop leadership capability through training, coaching and mentoring as well as live practice To be a key team member throughout the multi-channel operationKey Skills, Knowledge & Experience   Willing to learn from all levels of the organisation A passion for Retail Proactive and have the ability to work on your own or as part of a team Able to work internationally for extended periods of time Demonstrate excellent communication, influencing and partnering skills, able to develop and maintain relationships up to mid-senior management level Aspirations to be a leader Possess high levels of resilience and able to work within a fast paced and exciting environment Strong commercial acumen with the ability to analyse and interpret data Degree qualified with a minimum 2:1 classification in a related discipline Ideally be multi-lingual (including fluent English)    Excellent IT skills –MS Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, e-mail, Internet, Outlook and various databases         How to apply We’d like to really get to know you as soon as you apply so are asking all candidates to submit a short video of themselves. title: Consumer PR Opportunities - Senior Account Executive – Big Consumer Brands
description:
Outstanding Senior Account Executive opportunities with a highly creative and disruptive integrated consumer agency.  They are seeking bright and highly motivated Senior Account Executives, who loves integrating media relations with social media, celeb and influencer outreach for creative KPI smashing campaigns for awesome consumer brands.
Located in an uber cool London office, this agency has serious ambition!  Whether shaking up the hottest top shelf spirits on every mixologist’s hit-list, indulging the sweet tooth of the nation’s favourite confectionary or cranking up footfall for our most beloved high street stores; this firm deliver creative, innovative and engaging integrated campaigns that really hit the mark and produce fantastic client coverage.  There work has attracted an enviable roster of consumer clients including food & drink, retail and lifestyle, and list keeps growing. 

Supporting excellent AMs and an AD, these roles will suit candidates with an appetite for success, and a strong work ethic to consistently generate excellent coverage for an exciting roster of brands.  In addition to press office work there will also be opportunities to work on exciting integrated projects utilising innovative social media, partnering the most on trend influencers and crafting cool pop ups & experiential events.
Candidate attributes:

Excellent communication across all mediums
Awareness of integrated approaches and an interest in developing this knowledge
Confident; has an opinion and is confident enough to contribute
Fast paced approach; hands-on and practical and deadline driven
Super organised, excellent project management skills
Collaborative team player
Good mentor for junior staff

Successful candidates should have a real passion for consumer PR; displaying an interest in the media and a track record of generating coverage – off and online, ideally for large consumer brands.  Candidates will be smart and analytical, with a good academic background and the ability to confidently manage senior clients while delivering strategies that will add real value to their bottom line.  First class media relations, interpersonal and communication skills will be essential to build effective relationships with clients, the media and internally.  If you feel you demonstrate these qualities and want to work for an expanding, award winning agency, please send your CV for immediate consideration.
If this role is not quite right for you, but you think a friend would be interested, why not refer their details?  We offer £150 in Amazon vouchers when we place a new referral.

title: Senior Account Executive – Hospitality, Food & Drink Campaigns
description:
Fantastic Senior Account Executive offering excellent client ownership for a range of food, drink, hospitality and leisure brands.
Our client, a well established and highly respected agency, synonymous with the finer things in life is seeking an SAE to join their expanding team.  This firm partner an enviable client base from world famous luxury lifestyle brands to exciting challengers looking to disrupt the market with innovative new launches.   They are experts in their markets and deliver a range of cutting edge campaigns from media relations, events, and personal PR, to experiential & guerrilla marketing, stunts, and celebrity endorsement.
Working closely with experienced Account Directors and managing junior staff, this exceptional role will take ownership of an exciting range of food, drink, hospitality and leisure clients; working on engaging campaigns, managing busy press offices and working on major events and launches.  This will role be the lifeblood of the team, showing passion and interest in the world outside and helping to craft creative solutions for clients; to ensure excellent coverage across traditional and social media platforms.
Candidate Responsibilities:

Support the team to design and create award winning communications campaigns
Provide creative solutions for clients, coming up with innovative ideas across platforms and mediums to ensure  excellent coverage
Proactively generation news and feature placements across clients
Creating and executing innovative events and launches
Be the go-to person for clients and maintain daily contact with them ensuring timely delivery of all requests and regular meetings
Write engaging and original press releases
Manage and mentor junior staff and interns

This role is an exceptional opportunity to join a well established and respected agency and support its growth while delivering innovative campaigns for exciting food, drink, and hospitality and leisure brands. Candidates will be confident communicators with a proven track record of consistently securing excellent client coverage across traditional and social media platforms.  Candidates will display the ability to effectively manage multiple client relationships and mentor juniors across multiple work streams.  In return our client can offer a creative atmosphere while supporting your development at all stages.  If you feel you have the skills to fulfil the role, please send your CV for immediate consideration.

title: Product Manager - Business Imaging Print/Laser/Scan (EMEAR)
description:
Epson is a global imaging and innovation leader dedicated to exceeding the vision of customers worldwide through its compact, energy-saving, high-precision technologies. We offer an extensive array of award-winning products across the world ranging from printers and 3LCD projectors for business and the home, to electronic and crystal devices. Reporting to the Manager, Product Management, you will own the product planning stage of the product life-cycle working closely with Epson's head office in Japan. With a segmented approach, the Product Manager will build a comprehensive knowledge of the business print, laser and scan market place and customer values for both existing and new product segments in order to drive future product planning to grow the business. This role is based at our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead and will involve some European travel (2/3 days per month.) Key responsibilities: Ownership of the day to day product category and volume achievement of the designated productsGo-to expert for price/features of our own and key competitors' products. Ownership of the products' sales performance and the voice of the customerManage all aspects of the product lifecycle, including launch preparation, ensuring all documentation and assets are in place, stock management and end of life phase out, etcHave a good knowledge and understanding of key Epson technologies and those of competitors. In addition the Product Manager should have an understanding of key technologies in the IT market and what are the future tendenciesTrack the price/features/value propositions of key competitors with a segmented approach working with other stakeholders and customers as required. Use this information and technology developments as inputs to plan future product (s)In conjunction with Seiko Epson Corporation, from the product's differentiation identify the Customer Value (benefits) of the product to be launchedWorking with the Market Research team, use external and internal data sources to build the correct segmented market sizing and trend view for business and product planningWorking with teams and stakeholders across the business, gain an insight and understanding of the customer profile for the allocated products. The understanding will include the market segment and resulting 'customer value' to ensure a correct understanding of the customer requirementsAssist the Manager, Product Management to propose future Volume/Revenue/Profit plans based on knowledge of market and group of productsIn conjunction with Seiko Epson Corporation, from the product's differentiation identify the Customer Value (benefits) of the product to be launched Key skills and experience required to perform this role: Graduate level education in a technology or marketing backgroundProven Product Management experience ideally gained from the business imaging (print/laser/scan) product portfolio/IT sector with a technical focusGood communication skills and the ability to networkNumerate with attention to detailAnalytic and questioning manner with the ability to make sense of dataVery good Excel knowledge and general IT knowledge (PC and Mobile OS's, Network)Speaking more than one European language will be valued If you are seeking an opportunity to work for a market leading vendor, providing Product Management support across EMEAR we would love to hear from you. Epson makes products for a wide range of customers and we are committed to having a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary and with an outstanding suite of benefits. Colleagues based in our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead work in an excellent waterside location with close proximity to Apsley train station, onsite parking and a subsidised restaurant.

Retail Insights AnalystIsleworthUp to £35,000 per annumMy client is offering an outstanding opportunity to work within a fantastic global organisation as a Retail Insights Analyst. You will be joining a team who constantly look to evolve what they do by listening to and responding to customer and stakeholder needs. You will play a key part in the Insights team within a data led business, working for an established, fun and innovative brand!As the Retail Insights Analyst you will be super organised, with an analytical brain and comfortable with numbers/ big data. This is a 6 month contract initially, however it will be a very rewarding role that has the potential to go on to big things!The role will include:Taking ownership of retail data feeds to develop and deliver analysis and value added actionable insights Collating all streams of data from multiple sources, both internally and externally, to measure sales performance and the impact of targeted marketing activity Day to day management of retail data, requesting and collating EPOS sales and stock from retail partners, feeding into internal database systems Maintain and update all sales, spend and target tracking and forecasting tools daily with latest inputs Measure the brand's sales performance weekly, providing actionable insights on current trends Build view of competitor activity and performance.To be successful in this role you must be able to demonstrate experience analysing big data to provide actionable insights within the retail industry, and be familiar with database and data mining systems. You'll be a self-starter, motivated & tenacious. Be comfortable managing and prioritising your own workload with great communication skills and able to work under pressure within a fast-paced team.Expertise of Excel is essential and high attention to detail is a must! If you are looking for a fun, friendly and forward thinking environment please apply for immediate consideration.

title: Brand Campaign Manager
description:
We are currently supporting a leading Northern Powerhouse brand based in Leeds in their search for a Brand Campaign Manager. Digital Marketing Executive Location Cambridge, CambridgeshireDepartment MarketingEmployment Type Full Time/ PermanentMinimum Experience Experienced individual requiredSalary £24k - £30kOur client is an award-winning communications solution provider, supplying high quality, high speed and cost effective solutions. They are proud to be the largest exclusively business-to-business, end-to-end communications provider in the UK.Possessing their own OFCOM regulated core network which is unique for a company of it's size. It’s rugged, fast, secure and is built to support voice services as much as data services.Whilst striving to deliver outstanding client care, their goal is to create long-lasting, mutually beneficial partnerships with their customers. With a ‘family feel’ to the workplace culture which inspires innovation and rewards performance. The core values are excellence, integrity, responsibility and passion. A driven individual is required to join this fast paced and exciting Marketing team. Training will be provided where required, in order for the successful candidate to progress in the role. Purpose of the RoleThe successful candidate will play a pivotal role in a small, busy marketing team, supporting the business across several UK locations. Ensuring brand alignment on all collateral and mediums, using marketing skills to interact with a varied audience and using the entire marketing mix - no day will be the same! ResponsibilitiesEvent management, managing a range of different events and exhibitions, making bookings, supporting the sales team and collating feedback.PR activities, ensuring the brand is present in the local press and working with media agencies and external bodies. CRM database management, you will be the main administrator for the internal CRM database, setting up new users and proactively looking at ways to improve internal systems whilst supporting the sales team.Internal communications, writing engaging copy for a range of audiences including emails and internal newsletters.Producing marketing collateral for a complex range of products and services, writing case studies, product overviews etc.Managing the internal intranet, posting news items and ensuring documents are kept up-to-date.Assisting with material for the website, posting blogs and ensuring information is updated.Assisting with digital marketing, including social media channels and writing blogs.Campaign management, creating and sending email campaigns to clients and prospects.Managing several busy inboxes and responding to internal and external stakeholder queries.Working with external agencies and partners.Working collaboratively across teams.The key responsibilities and accountabilities highlighted in this job are indicative and may vary over time. Job holders are expected to undertake other duties and responsibilities relevant to the nature, level and scope of this role.Person SpecificationEducation/Qualifications/Training:CIM qualified and/or related degree. Experience:2 years’ experience in a B2B Marketing role, preferably in a commercial fast-paced environment.Experience working with a CRM database (ideally Goldmine CRM) as well as MS Office, especially Word, Excel, and Powerpoint.Experience of working in a telecoms, communications or technical industry would be desirable. Skills/Knowledge/Understanding:Ability to use Adobe Photoshop and InDesign.Excellent organisation and administration skills.Excellent customer service approach.Excellent attention to detail and accuracy, especially proof reading.Excellent listening skills and clear concise verbal and written skills.Personal Attributes:Creative and able to communicate ideas to colleagues at all levels.Calm, confident manner able to work effectively under pressure.Solution focused and flexible approach to problem-solving.Ability to work as part of a small team and to use their own initiative.Able to prioritise workload and manage regular interruptions to remain productive.The Company values diversity and is committed to equality of opportunity.If you do not hear from us within seven days, your application has not been successful on this occasion. We may however keep your details on file for any suitable future vacancies and contact you accordingly.James Recruitment is an employment consultancy and operates as an equal opportunities employer.''Recommend a Friend'' Due to the demand for high calibre professional candidates we have introduced a recommend a friend incentive scheme. This scheme will reward the introduction to James Recruitment of an individual, either directly or not directly. Should this individual find permanent employment through the use of our services and remain in that position for at least 3 months, we will thank you with a reward of £100 of retail vouchers. The scheme is open to both candidates and clients.

With the role offering so much home-working they will need someone who can work under their own steam, preferably with a combination of qual and quant and someone who can manage projects from start to finish.Candidates will need: - 5+ years experience, some of that within an agency environment. - Exposure to the full research project life cycle. - A client-centric attitude. - Excellent communication skills. - Enthusiasm and a desire to learn and succeed. - Commercial acumen. - Strong people and project management experience.If this sounds like the next role for you please get in touch with Matthew Finlay at Calibre Search or submit your CV in the usual fashion. Calibre Search promotes equality in the workplace and acts as both an employment agency and employment business.

Marketing Project Manager - contract, Newmarket - This leading organisation based in the heart of Suffolk are looking to recruit a Marketing Project Manager initially on a 9 month contractual basis. Ideally educated to degree level you will have at least 4 years Project management experience and be used to working in a fast paced, friendly, yet energetic team. With strong management experience, this role requires someone who is highly organised and has a solid understanding of both on and offline marketing. Reporting to and working closely with the Head of Marketing, this role will see you working on a number of business critical projects. This role is crucial to ensuring that all department campaigns, through both digital and traditional methods are being produced on time and to the set budget. Similarly, you will be required to have significant involvement in the company's marketing strategy, analysing current marketing activity and response rates and recommending improvements. This is an exciting role for the business, as a growing organisation, the company is going through an exciting period although initially a 9 month contract there is every potential that this role could be extended. This company are dedicated to success, and they'll provide the same dedication to ensuring that you succeed in your new role! If it's sounding good so far, take the time to submit an application. This is a company that can really take you places!This role would be most applicable to candidates travelling from areas of Suffolk and the wider region, including Bury St Edmunds, Hawstead, Thurston, Langham, Mildenhall, Barningham, Elveden, Thetford, Elmswell, Lakenheath and Newmarket.For registration purposes, please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. This company provides marketing and media solutions to many of the UK’s household brands. They provide integrated and targeted marketing strategies to a range of clients in retail, automotive, financial and more.
This Account Director role is a mix of account management of existing clients (both agencies and clients) plus some new business development.
You will build up long-term relationships with your clients and ensure they are marketing to their clients in the best way
You will liaise between clients and internal teams to ensure the successful delivery of marketing and media solutions across data driven marketing, advertising, digital and apps.

Strong account management skills at a senior level
Experience and understanding  of data within marketing

The ability to understand and present a range of complex marketing solutions  that meet clients’ needs
Sales skills – able to develop existing clients and win new business
The ability to present often complex marketing solutions to clients
Excellent relationships building skills

This is a lovely Account Director role with a salary of up to £50K + car allowance, + quarterly bonus, 27 days holiday and pension.
Based Hertfordshire with travel to clients – mainly in London and South East

Junior Account Director, Creative Agency, Soho London, £40k - £45k
What’s the Agency like for the Junior Account Director?  
One of the UK’s most creative agencies that vies for the Agency of the Year Award and gets a special mention in the Gunn Report – the global index of creative excellence in advertising.
Part of a worldwide network, their list of creative awards is a roll-call of the best work in the industry.  They regularly haul home the booty of metal and pencils from creative ceremonies.
Ultimately, this is the agency we all dream of joining.  It’s the one we aim at throughout our careers and from which competitors take their measure. They have shot a creative arrow across the bows of their competitors and stand high above the rank and file.  
No other agency comes close to their creative offering and dazzling achievements.  Their creative could stop a beating heart and the delivery is slick and polished.  
A lot of agencies can dish up good creative that smoulders but never catches fire this giant among titans has lit up the industry and their talent burns brightest.
This is a happy ship with contented Account Handlers who can indulge their career aspirations.
 
The Junior Account Director role
A sensational role for a creatively ambitious Junior Account Director who wants to manage a luxury UK based drinks account with a global reach.
The client is a family-owned business with a specially crafted portfolio of high end drinks that are indulged in across the world.  
In the international drinks world the vintages from this producer stand out as some of the most enduring and most highly-awarded brands ever bottled.  With a product this good it is down to the agency to ensure the creative bar is high to support such a premium brand.
London is the lead for brand development and creative origination and the Junior Account Director will be rubbing shoulders with super smart Planners and hot-headed Creatives.
This is a creatively sensational account for a cool, calm and collected Junior Account Director who can hold their own against a heavyweight client.
Pride and entrepreneurial flair will give the Junior Account Director the opportunity to handle wide and varied campaigns that include TV, digital and social.  In addition to above the line experience, the agency is looking for a Junior Account Director who is digitally savvy.
This is a popular choice of agency for Junior Account Directors whose ambition is not being stimulated in their current environment.  The agency is good at planning for the future and making sure the next generation of senior management is home grown and being moved up the agency ranks.  
The agency doesn’t have a cookie cutter mentality but Junior Account Directors who are a driving force on a big piece of business, future leaders and entrepreneurial tend to do well here.

Highlights of the Junior Account Director role:

Joining the UK’s most creative agency
Handling a highly creative drinks account
Using your above the line skills and digital exp
Having autonomy in a supportive environment
Raising your profile in the industry


Desirable Experience for the Junior Account Director role:

Above the line experience
Good agency experience
Digitally savvy
Great passion for creative
Sound strategic thinking


Why apply for this Junior Account Director role?
It’s all about getting the best for your career and this fabulous agency should top your list – they are No1 in the industry.
This is the perfect agency for a Junior Account Director who loves the sheer thrill of an amazing idea, perfectly captured and then alchemically executed.

Account Manager, Creative Agency, London, Soho £28k - £35k
What’s the Agency like for the Account Manager?
A key player on the advertising and digital scene, this ranks as one of the best creative agencies in the industry thanks to their ability to marry classical brand building with cutting edge digital thinking and to execute ideas in any channel. 
This is more than an above the agency or digital agency or social media agency: this is a modern integrated creative agency that is working hand in hand with some amazing brands.
They have an eclectic mix of talent and know how to get creative pulses racing by delivering work that people really care about.   They have tuned in to the fact that a fragmented media landscape means that people avoid what they don’t like yet amplify what they do.
In the age of conversation it is all about cut through and this agency produces some of the most engaging creative work in the industry; creating campaigns that people fall in love with.
Their creative work is spare and muscular and they manage to make brands fly that little bit higher.  As a result they have loyal infatuated clients across a terrific portfolio and a clear sense of direction.
New business is plentiful and they have landed several high profile accounts.
Culturally the agency has an open and respectful culture with a horizontal structure.  The social side plays an important role in agency life too: the Account Management team have an away-trip abroad every year, plus socialising around booze or cakes once a week in addition to key event surprises – watch out for Valentine’s Day!

The Account Manager role
The Account Manager will be handling a UK based lifestyle account that is with the whole network.  As a result the variety and breadth of briefs the Account Manager will be handling is immense.  
This is the type of account that has many projects running at the one time so the Account Manager has the opportunity to own projects and run with them.  The agency does a lot of lovely work for this client from brand ads to fun social media campaigns and exciting digital content.
This is a terrific piece of business on which the agency takes the brand lead.  The account is fully integrated so the Account Manager will be a key player handling a broad scope of marketing solutions including TV, film, print, digital content and social media.
This agency has a great relationship with the client and is a trusted business partner.  As a result there are rich creative pickings and the agency is trusted to be daring in its approach.  When this account sweeps up at the Awards Ceremonies and creates a buzz in the industry, you can pat yourself on the back for being there!
The agency is seeking an Account Manager who is a pro-active self-starter with a passion for brilliant work and the ability to spot and nurture great creative ideas whether they are on brief or a great additional idea.
In addition, the Account Manager will need to be able to work well with larger teams, staying on top of their game and be confident operating across all disciplines on busy accounts.
The Account Manager needs to have the desire to support the team around them and in particular taking responsibility for and encouraging the progression of junior members of the team.   The Account Manager will be reporting into a supportive Senior Account Director who believes in autonomy.
The role would suit an Account Manager with an entrepreneurial spirit as there is great opportunity to grow and shape the business.
Account handling at the agency is of a high calibre and they see themselves as creating an entrepreneurial environment for brilliant work to flourish in.
The role would suit an Account Manager who not only wants to handle great work, but also wants to get their career on track.  The agency is buttoned down when it comes to growing its talent in-house.  All the Account Managers have clear up to date objectives and progression plans.  
The agency has an excellent mentoring scheme and offers bespoke training programmes and one-to-one coaching in order to move people up to the next level.  
The type of Account Manager to thrive in this agency will be someone with the desire to influence great creative work and strategy with the drive to go the extra mile for the Client and take a collaborative approach.
 
Highlights of the Account Manager role:

Joining a top 10 highly innovative creative agency
Handling a fantastic UK led account
Blending above the line advertising with edgy digital
Working with the agency’s top creative team
Getting involved with brand strategy

 
Desirable Experience for the Account Manager role:

Good above the line advertising agency experience
Thorough grounding in digital and social media  
Knowledge of TV and Clearcast
Strong brand strategy
Eye for powerful creative

 
Why apply for this Account Manager role?
This agency smartly creates a provocative relationship between the brand and the consumer that kicks the competition out of the category.  If you are a firebrand with a passion for great work then this is a fantastic chance to get some creative awards under your belt.

In addition to this great Account Manager role we also have other exciting opportunities for you to look at on our website: www.spectrum360.co.uk

To apply for this fantastic Account Manager role click the “Apply now” button below.
