Major Players have an exciting opportunity for an Account Manager to work within a Digital and Direct agency based in Central London. The ideal candidate will have experience working across CRM, e-CRM, DM and Digital, Social and CMS Management and have been working within a creative agency for 3-4 years.The agency has a plethora of big clients and you will be working across 2-3 clients at a time.Clients include - Travel and Financial ServicesDoes this sound like you ?I'm curious about how companies go about promoting their brands and products. That's why I'm passionate about marketing. From the latest TV spot, through Twitter, right down to how customer loyalty schemes work; every channel fascinates me.But the evolution of marketing is reaching a giddy-speed. So I'm proud to say I remain a committed student of marketing. Reading the relevant press, books and blogs is critical to keeping me relevant and informed. This knowledge allows me to constantly question how our industry works and where it's going.I immerse myself in Client's business so I have a detailed, first-hand knowledge of what they do. I want know everything about their sector, how competitors are behaving and constantly track the latest goings on. To inform my proposals and projects, I experience their brands and products at every opportunity.To drive innovation, I share my thoughts and ideas with Clients all the time. Not only does this demonstrate my commitment and value to their business but also builds on the agencies reputation as having the brightest brains in the business. And I never forget that I'm a person too (consumer is such a soulless word). So I constantly use my own experiences to put effective marketing into a personal context. It explains why I question everything. This helps me understand what works. My curiosity is insatiable. And this relentless quest for knowledge means I can add value to everything I do. Never a shrinking wallflower, sharing objective and informed opinions comes naturally to me - whether I'm in a meeting or having a corridor chat.Quite simply, I like people. I know it's important to have a social relationship with both my Clients and colleagues. I'm happy to enjoy a drink (and good old gossip). I like to share my passions and I always take an interest in those enjoyed by others. I'm a high-energy person. So I bring this enthusiasm to my day-to-day work by getting involved in stuff that will help enrich Agency life. I'm the sort of person who jumps at chances (but still keeps my feet on the ground). I rarely say no and I'm good at managing multiple responsibilities. I love being part of a group that reflects what's important to me - ambitious, energetic and passionate. Thriving off those around me, I always want to make things better for the team. I prefer shared goals; success is about winning together. If so, then call me! Hannah - 0207 845 7243

title: PR Executive
description:
How does this Role support fulfilling Our Vision: The PR Executive will actively contribute to the overall achievement of the PR strategy for Ann Summers.
 
Summary of Key Activities:

Assist the PR Manager to deliver press campaigns for short lead, long lead and online press to support the launch of campaigns, product launches and strategic brand initiatives. This will include all aspects of delivery including initial concept, delivery and KPI/ROI evaluation.
Support the delivery of all PR activity with the design, development and distribution of e-shots, press releases, case studies, look books and surveys etc.
Day to day information management including monitoring and KPI tracking of brand coverage, compilation of weekly PR updates and PR coverage reports and sharing to the wider business.
Drive regular press meetings with Fashion Assistants, Stylists, influencers, industry and trade contacts to ensure the press contacts database remains relevant and active.
Under instruction from the PR Manager, execute all PR events – this will include but is not limited to: researching venues and sourcing catering, distributing invitations, briefing supporting marketing collateral, liaising with B&M and VM to prepare samples and props, daily coordination on the day.
Ownership of PR samples, including organising the sample cupboard, logging and take ownership of sample call-ins, overseeing courier bookings and logistics and ensuring samples are returned from publications etc.
Manage the Ann Summers PR Twitter account and reach out to journalists with interesting news piece ideas.
Work in partnership with the Social Media Executive to coordinate the blogger outreach programme, including researching influential bloggers and building coverage-valuable relationships.
Support with the management of the department budget, ensuring the budget report is continually up to date and all activity within budget.
Develop an enviable corporate image for Ann Summers within the ‘erotic’ market.
Represent the brand to external partners (press, media agencies) and confident enough to attend media briefings and press meetings with the PR Manager or independently.

 
The ideal candidate will:

Experience working at either a PR agency/in-house PR department.

 


Have worked in the Retail sector, preferably Fashion.
Have a black book of fashion press contacts and experience managing press appointments.
Have solid experience selling-in features as well as product placement.
Understand the importance of influencers for PR and Social – the ideal candidate will have examples of how they’ve outreached to influencers or have a black book of influential contacts.
Be instinctively creative in their writing, ideas and presentation style – the ideal candidate will write a blog with excellent journalistic skills.
Be insanely organised to support event and sample management.
Be a natural hard working team player, willing to work outside of ‘normal’ hours as and when required.

title: SEO Manager
description:
If you're ready for the next stage in your digital career and you're looking to work in a thriving agency environment amongst some of the top digital talent in the country outside of London, please keep reading about this SEO Manager role.The CompanyImagine yourself within the media 'arm' of a glossy creative agency, with a reputation that exceeds them and clients worth bragging about across the automotive, finance, property, travel, retail and charity sectors. Then imagine you are more than just a 'cog in the works', but instead a very instrumental and valued part of a very cohesive digital team where your talents will be easily exposed, recognised and rewarded. This thriving team is headed up by a fun and charismatic MD who is committed to the growth and development of the media team.The RoleDue to rapid growth within the digital team, this funky and vibrant agency is looking for a Technical SEO Manager to manage and deliver SEO campaigns for a variety of valued clients. You will ideally be a self motivated, motivated, and organised individual with a genuine passion and interest for SEO.You'll be covering all aspects of SEO including audits, consultancy and on-going SEO retainers and website migrations, so you'll need to be confident in technical SEO (crawl error management, duplicate content management, indexation issue resolution, etc.) as well as having the ability to manage and deliver link-building campaigns.As Technical SEO Manager, your main responsibilities will include:Producing SEO proposals and PowerPoint presentations for New BusinessCreating SEO reports for existing clientsAnalysing campaigns and dataOptimising campaignsPro-actively making recommendations to clients The CandidateAs we're talking about a creative and modern agency, it would be great if you've got something about you - what we like to refer to as 'a bit sparky' - after all, you will be required to present SEO proposals to clients! title: Marketing Executive - Product Marketing team
description:
We’re looking for a confident and experienced marketer to join our specialist team, which is part of the wider StepStone UK Marketing Team, supporting 11 distinctive, well-established brands.The Product Marketing team are responsible for creating and communicating powerful stories about our products and services that position us as a market-leader, to win new business and retain existing clients.Reporting to the Head of Product Marketing, you will be the first to learn about exciting new product developments and enable us to successfully take products to market by working with multiple teams across our business as a ‘go-to’ person for updates, troubleshooting and insights.This role requires strong interpersonal skills with a willingness and ability to engage with people at all levels. You’ll also be a copywriting genius with the ability to grasp and translate new technologies into simple, benefit-led value propositions that our sales teams love and our customers can easily understand.If you are looking for a new challenge where you’ll get truly get stuck in and lead projects from conception to completion, then we’d love to hear from you. We’re a small but busy team and for the right candidate there’s a lot of opportunity to grow and get involved in some exciting projects!Your responsibilities will include:Working with Product Owners and UX Research teams to learn about product developments, customer insight and keeping up-to-date on releases. Working with Product Owners to maintain an up-to-date product marketing roadmap.Supporting the Head of Product Marketing in developing and planning timely product updates for internal comms with teams across the business. Working with Traffic teams to understand and translate our strategy into sales stories. Being the central point of contact for internal product queries and troubleshooting. Organisation and scheduling of internal product-related events.Gathering product performance and sales data. Crafting benefit fuelled product messaging that's consumed, repurposed and tailored by internal teams. Working with Product Owners and Analytics to ensure content accuracy.Ensuring consistency across product marketing messages disseminated across the business by Product Specialists, Sales Operations, Sales Teams, Customer Services, UX Team and Brand teams.Owning and maintaining WordPress website product content.Are you our ideal candidate? We’re looking for:3 years + marketing experience, ideally gained within a B2B technology/online/digital/recruitment business. A strong copywriter, preferably with experience in tech related copywriting.Impeccable attention to detail - all content issued by you is guaranteed to be 100% error free!Experience and confidence in successfully working with cross-functional stakeholders across multiple office locations. A high level of proficiency in WordPress and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Flexibility and autonomy with strong prioritisation skills to juggle a varied, conflicting workload.Strong written, verbal and presentation skills. About us;Established since 1996, StepStone Group is one of the largest online job board businesses in the world. We employ over 2200 people and operate across 21 countries and are owned by Axel Springer Digital Classifieds, the worlds most established and successful media group.StepStone own two businesses in the UK; the Totaljobs Group & Jobsite. Between us we employ circa 800 employees across 11 online brands operating as StepStone UK.As employers we value talent, integrity, innovation and results whilst respecting our employee’s work-life balance, freedom and appetite for challenge and recognition.Our environment;We have big ambition and our employees do too.You’ll join a team of passionate and talented colleagues within a fast paced, fun, friendly, supportive and collaborative environment.Our Values;Integrity - Being uncompromising and consistent in our commitment to integrity;Results - Driving spectacular results for everyone – happy employees, happy customers, happy candidates and happy shareholders;People - Building a company with teams where talent can thrive and flourish.The package;Attractive basic salary;37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday;29 days holiday plus bank holidays;Group Pension Scheme;Life Cover;Childcare Voucher Scheme;Gym Discount;Eye Tests & contributions towards new glasses.After passing probation;Cycle to Work Scheme;Amazon voucher birthday gift.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
An outstanding opportunity for an ambitious Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager / eCommerce Marketing Manager to take responsibility of the Digital / Online Marketing and eCommerce platforms for this leading UK businessBASIC: £50,000-£60,000ADDITIONAL BENEFITS: Pension SchemeLOCATION: The role is based between Watford, Hemel Hempstead, Aylesbury, High WycombeCOMPANY PROFILE - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing ManagerWe are an award winning multi-channel retail business experiencing an exciting period of growth we are totally committed to attaining ‘best in class’ status for our online business. We want to strengthen our team with a new Senior Digital / Online / eCommerce Marketing Manager looking to develop their career in an autonomous environment where entrepreneurial spirit is rewarded.RESPONSIBILITIES - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* Develop and implement a strategy to deliver sustained revenue and margin growth.* Manage on-going development of the ecommerce platform and online marketing platform.* Develop first class online marketing communications and product ranges.* Ensure that our online business delivers a best in class customer experience, in line with forward thinking online trends.* Proactively manage relationships with key suppliers and partners.* Build relationships with all other departments ensuring the full integration and optimisation of online/ecommerce opportunities across all channels within the business.WHY THIS ROLE - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* We are a leader in our field with a long heritage and a strong reputation for innovation, quality and customer service.* We feel there is a genuine opportunity for us to develop our online business into a best in class offering to match our offline status.* This is a rare chance to make something your own, a high profile role in a fast growing company.* You will find a management team that is deeply committed to this project and ready to provide the support and significant investment necessary to achieve these targets.* We are a well-run financially stable business; this is the platform for an exciting period of growth planned for the coming years.REQUIREMENTS - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* A proven track record delivering ecommerce growth in a fast moving B2C environment.* Experience of devising, implementing and driving successful ecommerce strategies.* Management of an online / ecommerce team.* The commercial ability and a desire to’ take ownership’ you will relish the chance to build an ecommerce business.* A skilled communicator and leader, able to build close relationships with all other departments of our business.* Hands on experience that includes SEM, affiliate programmes, PPC, SEO, CRM and DM.It is highly likely you will have worked in any of the following roles and/or markets, and worked with the following products and/or services: Head of Ecommerce, Head of Online, Ecommerce Manager, Online Marketing Manager, Digital Marketing Manager.Please note that the postcodes used for this vacancy are for searching purposes only, they may not refer exactly to where the role is based.INTERESTED? title: Community Manager/SAE - Tech Team - Global Agency
description:
A global communications agency is looking for an experienced Community Manager/Senior Account Executive with excellent social media credentials to join its technology practice in London. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an ambitious and growing team and to work on a diverse range of client programmes for major tech brands. You will be involved on a range of client programmes and will work closely with the team to create engaging social media content for consumer audiences. You will be tasked with populating and handling content calendars and will help to prepare recommended responses to consumer enquiries. You will also be required to liaise directly with clients on assigned accounts. title: Sales & Marketing Capability Controller (FMCG)
description:
A fantastic opportunity to join a major, fast-paced FMCG business with a fun, driven culture, top brands and exciting campaigns, in a senior commercial capability position developing and implementing the sales and marketing capability strategy.Reporting into the Head of Business Operations, this position is the sole senior capability role so needs someone self starting who can drive the agenda and take ownership, ideally also someone with the potential to progress into the commercial leadership team, which would be the next step. Ideally you'll have commercial capability experience from a blue chip organisation, but you might be an FMCG Marketing Manager (ideally with some sales experience) or in a Senior National Account Manager/National Account Controller position at an FMCG business with an interest in a move to capability, or you might come from a relevant capability agency background.You'll need to be able to build teams, have vision, lead change, develop people, have a level of self-awareness and empathy, and importantly have commercial acumen. Experience in training and development would be ideal, but not essential.A genuinely great, progressive and growing business to work for - driven and highly accountable, but equally fun loving and go to efforts to create a great environment to be in. This is rare opportunity to join at a senior level and impact and influence the business in an important, high visibility position.For the right candidate this could also possibly be a part time role (minimum four days per week).*Due to the high volume of applications we receive we cannot always respond to everyone. You will hear from us in 2-3 days if your application has been successful.

title: Product Marketing Executive
description:
We’re looking for a confident and experienced marketer to join our specialist team, which is part of the wider StepStone UK Marketing Team, supporting 11 distinctive, well-established brands.The Product Marketing team are responsible for creating and communicating powerful stories about our products and services that position us as a market-leader, to win new business and retain existing clients.Reporting to the Head of Product Marketing, you will be the first to learn about exciting new product developments and enable us to successfully take products to market by working with multiple teams across our business as a ‘go-to’ person for updates, troubleshooting and insights.This role requires strong interpersonal skills with a willingness and ability to engage with people at all levels. You’ll also be a copywriting genius with the ability to grasp and translate new technologies into simple, benefit-led value propositions that our sales teams love and our customers can easily understand.If you are looking for a new challenge where you’ll get truly get stuck in and lead projects from conception to completion, then we’d love to hear from you. We’re a small but busy team and for the right candidate there’s a lot of opportunity to grow and get involved in some exciting projects!Your responsibilities will include:Working with Product Owners and UX Research teams to learn about product developments, customer insight and keeping up-to-date on releases. Working with Product Owners to maintain an up-to-date product marketing roadmap.Supporting the Head of Product Marketing in developing and planning timely product updates for internal comms with teams across the business. Working with Traffic teams to understand and translate our strategy into sales stories. Being the central point of contact for internal product queries and troubleshooting. Organisation and scheduling of internal product-related events.Gathering product performance and sales data. Crafting benefit fuelled product messaging that's consumed, repurposed and tailored by internal teams. Working with Product Owners and Analytics to ensure content accuracy.Ensuring consistency across product marketing messages disseminated across the business by Product Specialists, Sales Operations, Sales Teams, Customer Services, UX Team and Brand teams.Owning and maintaining WordPress website product content.Are you our ideal candidate? We’re looking for:3 years + marketing experience, ideally gained within a B2B technology/online/digital/recruitment business. A strong copywriter, preferably with experience in tech related copywriting.Impeccable attention to detail - all content issued by you is guaranteed to be 100% error free!Experience and confidence in successfully working with cross-functional stakeholders across multiple office locations. A high level of proficiency in WordPress and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Flexibility and autonomy with strong prioritisation skills to juggle a varied, conflicting workload.Strong written, verbal and presentation skills. About us;Established since 1996, StepStone Group is one of the largest online job board businesses in the world. We employ over 2200 people and operate across 21 countries and are owned by Axel Springer Digital Classifieds, the worlds most established and successful media group.StepStone own two businesses in the UK; the Totaljobs Group & Jobsite. Between us we employ circa 800 employees across 11 online brands operating as StepStone UK.As employers we value talent, integrity, innovation and results whilst respecting our employee’s work-life balance, freedom and appetite for challenge and recognition.Our environment;We have big ambition and our employees do too.You’ll join a team of passionate and talented colleagues within a fast paced, fun, friendly, supportive and collaborative environment.Our Values;Integrity - Being uncompromising and consistent in our commitment to integrity;Results - Driving spectacular results for everyone – happy employees, happy customers, happy candidates and happy shareholders;People - Building a company with teams where talent can thrive and flourish.The package;Attractive basic salary;37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday;29 days holiday plus bank holidays;Group Pension Scheme;Life Cover;Childcare Voucher Scheme;Gym Discount;Eye Tests & contributions towards new glasses.After passing probation;Cycle to Work Scheme;Amazon voucher birthday gift.


Contact: Tony Hornbuckle
        

Reference: Totaljobs/943

	Marketing Manager

Permanent


Posted 24 days ago


























Marketing Manager Central Bristol £40,000 - £45,000Juice are very excited to offer this fantastic opportunity with an award winning, recognised insurance company based in Central Bristol. This is a super opportunity to join the business during an exciting period of growth. You will be responsible the ownership of the entire marketing function, working closely with the Business Development Director. This opportunity will see you overseeing a wide variety of tasks from team leadership to developing and managing the organisations’ on-line presence and digital marketing.The core purpose of this role will be to define the organisations’ marketing strategy in alignment with the overall strategy, building and strengthen and cultivating the brand both internally and externally.You willoversee and write copy for new products, PR & marketing campaigns and effectively manage the external Agency resource as a key part of the communications and brand strategy.Key responsibilities are:To shape and lead the Marketing function and support senior management in the delivery of sales and marketing objectives Plan and manage an effective communications calendar that co-ordinates and integrates all channel activities, responds to business and customer needs, drives cost efficiencies and adopts a customer friendly contact strategy.Review and write copy for new product development, PR and marketing campaigns being aware of the FCA’s requirements for financial promotions.Oversee and manage business as usual customer communications.Provide specialist marketing input to communication campaigns.Review Brand guidelines so that they are adhered to in all internal and external communications Liaise with other function areas of the business to ensure sign off on all financial promotions and relevant communications.Provide project management support to senior management teamProvide hands-on marketing and communication advice and expertise to all areas of the business as required.Build and maintain relationships with agencies, suppliers and internal specialist functions.Write copy where appropriate.Provide full commercial and marketing support to the Head of Sales and Marketing.Build and manage the on-line presence and digital marketing.·Undertake ad hoc work when necessary.As the ideal candidate, you will play a pivotal role in raising the organisations profile, generating new business and assisting with the delivery of all Sales and Marketing targets. You will have the ability to consistently deliver the brand message through all media including internal and external communication. You enjoy working in a fast paced environment and bare excellent organisation skills with the ability to multi task and priorities workloads and meet deadlines to a high standard. Previous managerial and marketing experience with relevant qualification also essential.If this sounds like the ideal opportunity and you would like to hear more, please contact Kate Davis at Juice recruitment today!

title: Account Manager
description:
Successful and dynamic agency to call home.Genuine career progression opportunities.Exciting client base.This busy advertising and design agency based in the heart of Bristol are searching for a talented Account Manager to join their lovely team. You might be an ambitious Account Executive with a few years’ experience under your belt, or an established Account Manager looking for a new agency to call home, either way this could be the role you’ve been waiting for! What you’ll be doing You’ll work closely with a lovely mix of clients, from global brands to local retailers, delivering on a range of projects across creative and digital. You’ll drive work through the agency, creating briefs and managing projects across design, advertising and digital, working closely with designers and helping to co-ordinate web and social based projects with the digital team. It’ll be down to you to ensure everything runs as smoothly as possible and is delivered on time and on budget, to the highest possible standard.What experience you’ll needFirst rate communication and client management skills.Marketing/design/advertising agency experience.Commercial acumen with the ability to grow accounts.Natural rapport building ability.Proven experience in end to end campaign management.Keen attention to detail.What you’ll get in return for your talents You can expect a salary up to around £28k, as well as the opportunity to become part of a reputable agency that really nurture their staff and are really going places. title: Account Manager
description:
One of Edinburgh's most successful marketing agencies is looking an experienced Account Manager to join its award-winning team.As the Account Manager, your duties will be to:• Deliver high levels of client satisfaction on assigned projects.• Ensure the effective and efficient delivery of assigned projects through a partnership with other members of your team.• Input into the development of Account Executives.• Support for Agency’s creative ethos – actively seeking to make award-winning, highly effective campaigns.• Write inspiring creative briefs.• Effectively manage creative development through the creative team, into studio and production.• Investigate added value opportunities for client accounts.In return, the Account Manager will receive a salary of £23,000 - £27,000 per annum plus many benefits.This is a rare opportunity to join one of Edinburgh's elite agency's offering genuine career progression. Please apply to today to find out more.The first stage of the application process is to apply online.Candidate Source Ltd is an Advertising Agency working on behalf of an Employment Agency. By applying for this position you are giving us permission to pass your CV and covering letter to a third party in relation to this specific vacancy. A full copy of our privacy policy can be viewed on our website.
    
    

Contact: Amy Eaton
        

Reference: Totaljobs/4065

title: Front End Web Developer
description:
A fantastic, newly created role based in Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire has opened within a rapidly growing award-winning digital agency for an experienced Front End Developer. Client DetailsThe Outstanding Website Company offers clients a wide variety of digital marketing and web design outputs, all completely bespoke across a variety of industries including: education, automotive, aviation, housing, equine, waste management and food (to name a few), all at B2B and B2C levels. The office is based within Liscombe Park Media Village, located in beautiful countryside surroundings and with on-site leisure centre facilities. DescriptionWorking in close partnership with the agency’s Lead Designer and Lead Front End Developer, the successful candidate will have strong experience of working to tight timeframes whilst possessing a great eye for building beautifully created websites that perform well.Skills:·Good working knowledge of CSS3 and HTML5.·Experience of working with modern Javascript, modular CSS highly advantageous.·Knowledge of templating engines and responsive emails very desirable. ·Advanced knowledge of Adobe Suite.·Understanding of interactive design and responsive design principles.·Understanding of UI and UX design is preferred.·Experience working with Content Management Systems.Candidate Criteria: ·A strong eye for design with the ability to produce pixel-perfect layouts.·Effectively multi-task and take responsibility for organizing and prioritising your workload. ·The ability to work to tight deadlines, deal with pressure and change.·Personable and approachable, with good communication skills.·Able to solve team issues by using initiative and being proactive.·Very good attention to detail ensuring quality output is met.·Fluent English is a must, no applicants from outside of the UK.·No recruiters. If this role sounds like a great fit and you are looking for your next challenge please send your CV and portfolio to register your interest.


Contact: Jamie Arnold
        

Reference: Totaljobs

	Marketing Manager

Competitive salary and benefits










Permanent


Posted 24 days ago


























        Marketing Manager, Newport Pagnell - Are you an experienced Marketing Manager with a passion for consumer brands? Looking for an exciting new challenge within an exciting, industry-leading business? Then this could be the opportunity you've been waiting for!Our award-winning client is looking for a driven and ambitious Marketing Manager to join their lively team in Buckinghamshire. With several years' experience working with large consumer brands, you will be well-equipped to deal with all the challenges this role entails. Having gained experience across the full marketing mix, you will be confident creating a comprehensive and cohesive marketing strategy to drive the business within the UK market and increase brand share. Experience of marketing tangible goods directly to the consumer is essential in this role, and knowledge of B2B brand partnerships would be beneficial. As Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for the marketing strategy across a number of platforms and touch points; from PR and social media to television advertising and direct marketing. Using your strategic and commercial insights, you will tailor and craft strategic campaigns to drive demand amongst target demographics. You will be responsible for managing key product lines, ensuring positioning, pricing and performance are in line with the wider market, consumer expectations and company objectives. This role also supports the sales team and you will be expected to drive growth by developing key point of sale materials, including marketing collateral, and generating innovative promotional offers to appeal to consumers. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Marketing Manager to take the next step in their career within a highly-respected, international consumer business. Due to the location of their offices, this role could be of interest to those living in Milton Keynes, Northampton, Bletchley, Newport Pagnell, Banbury, Bedford, St Neots, Luton, Dunstable, Leighton Buzzard, Aylesbury, Hitchin, Banbury, Buckingham and Bicester. For registration purposes, please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.



Contact: Recruitment Team
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CHWMM

title: Senior Marketing Campaign Executive
description:
Fantastic opportunity for a Senior Marketing Campaign Executive to join this recognised retailer that has established itself as a highly successful home brand.The Senior Marketing Campaign Executive will be responsible for exploring how they can test and trial new messaging across various marketing channels (offline and online) which will have definitive returns. A creative eye and the ability to multi-task is essential to work within this fast-paced environment.Key responsibilities:Develop and propose the implementation of initiatives to launch new products and campaignsSupport production of media-based and digital based campaigns and accompanying creative elementsOwn channel marketing planning and approval processManage budget and ensure resources are allocated efficiently Coordinate relevant teams to support activation of campaign activityManage business and agency partners working collaboratively with Marketing counterpartsDevise, develop and project manage strategic projects and business initiativesMarket research to establish a genuine interest into their industry and establish competitor analysis.The Senior Marketing Campaign Executive will have:A marketing related degree or Graduate calibre with 3 years experience in direct marketingExperience in managing and implementing fully integrated campaigns across a multi-media landscapeProject management skillsThe salary range for this role is £27,000 to £30,000 per annum.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:

title: Account Manager - Freelance Contract - Direct Marketing Agency
description:
Exciting short term contract.Amazing not-for-profit clients to work with.Competitive day rate (up to £250).This is a lovely short term Senior Account Manager contract within a leading direct marketing agency in Bristol.What you’ll be doing After a short handover period you’ll swiftly get up to speed to keep everything running like clockwork whilst the current incumbent is away. You’ll of course have the support of the wider team, the talented designers and client services team and you’ll work seamlessly alongside all, leading client relationships, creating briefs, managing budgets and seeing any live projects running to schedule, whilst of course keeping clients up to date and happy along the way. What experience you’ll need It’s essential you have proven marketing agency account handling experience.You’ll have experience working as Account Executive, Account Manager or Senior Account Manager and you will be immediately available to start.Ideall, you’ll have direct marketing experience; if not print experience in an integrated agency would work.Any exposure to charity brands would be amazing however it is not essential if your roots are strongly in DM and agency life. What you’ll get in return for your talents You can expect a competitive day rate based on experience, up to £250 dependant on experience,and a friendly team who will no doubt make you feel right at home from day one. What’s next? They’re keen to get someone in place by mid-June, so please get in touch with Fran at ADLIB to found out more.

title: Head of E-Commerce
description:
A luxury, UK founded Ecommerce brand who are rapidly scaling their team as part of their ambitious global growth plans and are now seeking a Head of E-Commerce based in London to join its team. As the Head of Ecommerce Trading, you will be responsible for driving business growth and revenue performance by owning forecast and reporting processes, seasonal strategies, marketing spend allocation and discount spend. This role reports directly into the CMO and will be responsible for leading a small of trade analysts. The role requires a proactive, long term trading strategy to ensure growth targets are met as the business expands internationally into new territories.Other key responsibilities includeManage the deployment of marketing budget between new / repeat customersLong-term planning of the promotional, event and seasonal calendarOwn the production of the revenue forecast and phasingPlanning homepage and banner featuresDirect line management 3x trade analystsCoordinate between different business areas (buying and merchandise) to ensure all marketing activities are in line with core commercial prioritiesSomething about you;Ideally you will have experience in a trade planning, digital marketing role within a digital first, ecommerce business with a natural project management mind-set and the ability to bring functions together to deliver across a shared objective.A strong commercial awareness and analytical mind-setExcellent communication skillsAbility to quickly read and grasp performance reportsIntermediate/advanced experience with google analyticsCapable of combining attention to detail with long term / big picture strategyThis is a unique opportunity for someone to shape the future growth of an exciting digital brand, with a rebrand and funding imminent in the coming months, the successful candidate will have the full backing to make a significant impact on the brand and the industry.The first stage of the application process is to apply online.Candidate Source Ltd is an Advertising Agency working on behalf of an Employment Agency. By applying for this position you are giving us permission to pass your CV and covering letter to a third party in relation to this specific vacancy. A full copy of our privacy policy can be viewed on our website.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
An outstanding opportunity for an ambitious Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager / eCommerce Marketing Manager to take responsibility of the Digital / Online Marketing and eCommerce platforms for this leading UK businessBASIC: £50,000-£60,000ADDITIONAL BENEFITS: Pension SchemeLOCATION: The role is based between Watford, Hemel Hempstead, Aylesbury, High WycombeCOMPANY PROFILE - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing ManagerWe are an award winning multi-channel retail business experiencing an exciting period of growth we are totally committed to attaining ‘best in class’ status for our online business. We want to strengthen our team with a new Senior Digital / Online / eCommerce Marketing Manager looking to develop their career in an autonomous environment where entrepreneurial spirit is rewarded.RESPONSIBILITIES - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* Develop and implement a strategy to deliver sustained revenue and margin growth.* Manage on-going development of the ecommerce platform and online marketing platform.* Develop first class online marketing communications and product ranges.* Ensure that our online business delivers a best in class customer experience, in line with forward thinking online trends.* Proactively manage relationships with key suppliers and partners.* Build relationships with all other departments ensuring the full integration and optimisation of online/ecommerce opportunities across all channels within the business.WHY THIS ROLE - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* We are a leader in our field with a long heritage and a strong reputation for innovation, quality and customer service.* We feel there is a genuine opportunity for us to develop our online business into a best in class offering to match our offline status.* This is a rare chance to make something your own, a high profile role in a fast growing company.* You will find a management team that is deeply committed to this project and ready to provide the support and significant investment necessary to achieve these targets.* We are a well-run financially stable business; this is the platform for an exciting period of growth planned for the coming years.REQUIREMENTS - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* A proven track record delivering ecommerce growth in a fast moving B2C environment.* Experience of devising, implementing and driving successful ecommerce strategies.* Management of an online / ecommerce team.* The commercial ability and a desire to’ take ownership’ you will relish the chance to build an ecommerce business.* A skilled communicator and leader, able to build close relationships with all other departments of our business.* Hands on experience that includes SEM, affiliate programmes, PPC, SEO, CRM and DM.It is highly likely you will have worked in any of the following roles and/or markets, and worked with the following products and/or services: Head of Ecommerce, Head of Online, Ecommerce Manager, Online Marketing Manager, Digital Marketing Manager.Please note that the postcodes used for this vacancy are for searching purposes only, they may not refer exactly to where the role is based.INTERESTED? Please email our retained consultant Philip Monkman quoting Digital Marketing Manager and reference PM1705-58 DDI: +44 (0)1604 683308 Wallace Hind Selection. The Old Vicarage. Duston. Northants. NN5 6JB. England. Tel: +44 (0)1604 758857 For more vacancies please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, visit our website or find our consultant on LinkedIn


Contact: Phil Monkman

        Elevation Marketing are currently recruiting a Marketing Assistant for a growing technology business based in the West Yorkshire area. title: Content Marketing Executive
description:
We are looking for a talented, creative and dynamic Content Marketing Executive to work for and established and well-known brand based in central Bristol. The experience we need.The successful Content Marketing Executive will ideally…- Come from a content marketing background- Have good knowledge of social media- Video content creation would be beneficial- Be a real creative- Be a strong communicatorThe role.This really is a role where no day will be the same. title: PR Senior AM/Account Director
description:
A lovely little agency that does big things is looking for someone to join at SAM/AD level in their stunning Cheshire offices. Working with a range of small – medium sized clients from a vast range of sectors including; property & housebuilding, IT, retail and more, they have developed a strong client base and are in the process of bringing on more impressive clients.Operating as a full service agency, they focus on PR and have a close knit team that knows how to get the job done whilst ensuring a strong work/life balance. Job Description:Working as part of the client services team you will be the right-hand wo/man of the MD and hold down the fort during busy periods.You will work on a variety of PR-led campaigns and build excellent relationships with the solid client base.As a leader in the agency you will be hands on in your approach and develop excellent proposals and presentations, develop the business and deliver integrated campaigns including; social media, press writing, events, crisis management and more. What We're Looking For:The agency is in a remote location, so driving is essential as public transport is limited. You must be able to demonstrate excellent writing skills and a proven ability to succeed in a PR/Communications heavy marketing agency. To Apply:If you think this role would suit you, please apply via the link below, or call Charlotte Lamb on 0161 804 0160 for a confidential discussion about the position.We respond to all CVs so you will hear back from us within the next couple of days.About Us:Network Marketing specialises in Marketing, Digital and Creative recruitment across the UK with offices in Leeds, London and Manchester.Network Marketing is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

title: Senior Insight Analyst
description:
Job Description SummaryWe are looking for a talented Insight Analyst to join the Insight team. This role will include advanced analytics such as customer segmentation, profiling and predictive modelling in order to provide easily understood and actionable insight to the businessThe successful candidate will be responsible for creating meaningful analysis using client, transactional and market data. This role will be responsible for developing an array of reports and presentations that will support the business' understanding of its clients and drive strategic decision making.Key ResponsibilitiesExtracting, manipulating and executing in depth analysis on large data setsDefining and developing SQL queries to provide data extractsInvestigating and interpreting complex unstructured data and translating that into value driven insightDeveloping and implementing appropriate dashboards and reportsEvaluate and identify key client trendsCarrying out data modelling utilising tools such as SAS, SQL, and Excel to create propensity, regression, CHAID, clustering models to help understand customer behaviours and build scenarios Building client segment models and profiles to enable the business to identify new high value business and those at risk of churningCommunicate complex data and methodologies clearly and effectively to internal and external stakeholdersResponding to business queries promptly and delivering meaningful dataExperience and Skills:Degree level educated within a highly numerate disciplineA strong knowledge of SAS/SQL scripting language for data manipulation and extractionDeep experience with of Business Intelligence Tools and concepts (SAS, Tableau, OLAP, Reporting and Data Analytics)Experienced user of TableauExperienced user of SAS and data modelling; prior data analytics and optimisation experience, specifically focusing on segmentation, regression or clusteringGood database/data warehouse knowledge4+ years of experience of working in a data/business intelligence functionWhat You Need to Succeed:Excellent analytical and numeracy skillsSelf-motivation and commitment to deadlinesApproach problems with curiosity and open mindednessAbility to work across multiple projects and balance workload effectivelyExcellent communication skills and experience engaging with internal stakeholdersGenuine passion for Business Intelligence and new and emerging solutions and trendsClosing date: Sunday 25th June?

Category Manager - MarketingLocation: Dorset (Commutable location from Poole, Bournemouth, Wareham, Dorchester, Christchurch, New Milton, Southampton)Salary: £50,000 - £55,000 per annumJob OverviewTo act as a strategic advisor by leading and managing the Category for sourcing and on-going supplier relationship management to meet the needs of the company, ensuring goods and services are delivered on time in a safe, effective and efficient way, whilst utilising internal and external expertise to meet the brief. To lead the development, implementation and execution of the Procurement and Supply Category Strategy across the company to minimise the total cost, whilst maintaining quality and a safety first culture.Key Responsibilities* Work with the customers to understand the future needs.* Implement the execution of the strategy to reduce risk, total life cost and improve quality/ service standards to agreed metrics.* Create and implement category strategies that delivery clear plans and ensure financial targets are met through a project management approach.* Use sound commercial reasoning and influence to ensure that availability is maximised across categories and delivered in a safe, effective and efficient manner through the negotiation and agreement of the most appropriate commercial approach.* Analyse/interpret trends, markets, and organisational requirements to influence stakeholders through the effective presentation of data and key metrics.* Implement operational performance and supplier management programmes by driving improvement in category relationships with the strategic suppliers in the market.* Manage a large portfolio of different suppliers/brands and developing appropriate strategies for each.* Accountability for product set up in the catalogue, ensuring all details are accurate.* Mentor and develop staff across the company in the news ways of working and approach to category management.* To become involved in other ad hoc tasks as required.Qualifications requiredEssential - BTec NVQ 4, or CIPS professional qualification, or an equivalent Business or Supply Chain degree, or equivalent qualification/experience.Experience requiredAbility to analyse data and make recommendations based on evidence.A thorough understanding of procurement strategy development and SME.Strong people management, influencing and negotiation skills, with the ability to manage and persuade at all levels of the company.Problem solving skills and a commitment to continuous improvement.Due to the high volume of applications we receive it is not always possible to respond to unsuccessful applicants. Therefore if we have not responded to your application within five days please note that on this occasion your application has not been successfulAmbridge Harris is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Ambridge Harris will not discriminate on unlawful grounds.

Marketing AssistantFull Time - Permanent PositionTACT is the largest fostering and adoption charity of its kind in the UK. Formed in 1993, we now have over 500 carers, who look after over 600 children and young people. Our reputation and growth can be attributed to our strength in providing strong, resilient long-term placements. As a charity, not a shareholder-led profit-making business, we achieve this by investing all of our surplus income into service, staff, carer, and children's development.This is an ideal opportunity for those interested in working within the charity sector and looking to gain valuable marketing experience. We are seeking a self-motivated, enthusiastic team player to join the UK’s largest fostering and adoption charity at an exciting stage of its development.We are looking for someone with a passion for helping the lives of children and young people and to also bring new innovative and creative ideas to the Business Development Unit. You will work closely with the manager to support the day-to-day running of the Marketing functions such as monitoring and updating social media, marketing campaigns, website updates, newsletter production and supporting with the creation of marketing materials.The successful applicant will have:A relevant degree in Marketing or equivalentExperience in marketing and recruitment (desirable)An understanding of the use of online media options in recruitmentThe ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing, flexibly according to different audiences, and with confidence and sensitivity.Please see the job description and persona specification for detailed information on the role and the expectations of applicants.A standard disclosure is required of the successful applicant and is requested for you by TACT.Please note that this role sits within the TACT Business Development Unit (BDU) who are currently based at the TACT West Midlands office in West Bromwich. They will shortly be relocating to new premises no more than 5 miles from this location where the successful candidate will be based.Closing: Midnight on Tuesday 20th June 2017Interviews: Monday 3rd July 2017 at TACT West Midlands (West Bromwich, B70 6QG)

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
An outstanding opportunity for an ambitious Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager / eCommerce Marketing Manager to take responsibility of the Digital / Online Marketing and eCommerce platforms for this leading UK businessBASIC: £50,000-£60,000ADDITIONAL BENEFITS: Pension SchemeLOCATION: The role is based between Watford, Hemel Hempstead, Aylesbury, High WycombeCOMPANY PROFILE - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing ManagerWe are an award winning multi-channel retail business experiencing an exciting period of growth we are totally committed to attaining ‘best in class’ status for our online business. We want to strengthen our team with a new Senior Digital / Online / eCommerce Marketing Manager looking to develop their career in an autonomous environment where entrepreneurial spirit is rewarded.RESPONSIBILITIES - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* Develop and implement a strategy to deliver sustained revenue and margin growth.* Manage on-going development of the ecommerce platform and online marketing platform.* Develop first class online marketing communications and product ranges.* Ensure that our online business delivers a best in class customer experience, in line with forward thinking online trends.* Proactively manage relationships with key suppliers and partners.* Build relationships with all other departments ensuring the full integration and optimisation of online/ecommerce opportunities across all channels within the business.WHY THIS ROLE - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* We are a leader in our field with a long heritage and a strong reputation for innovation, quality and customer service.* We feel there is a genuine opportunity for us to develop our online business into a best in class offering to match our offline status.* This is a rare chance to make something your own, a high profile role in a fast growing company.* You will find a management team that is deeply committed to this project and ready to provide the support and significant investment necessary to achieve these targets.* We are a well-run financially stable business; this is the platform for an exciting period of growth planned for the coming years.REQUIREMENTS - Digital Marketing Manager / Online Marketing Manager* A proven track record delivering ecommerce growth in a fast moving B2C environment.* Experience of devising, implementing and driving successful ecommerce strategies.* Management of an online / ecommerce team.* The commercial ability and a desire to’ take ownership’ you will relish the chance to build an ecommerce business.* A skilled communicator and leader, able to build close relationships with all other departments of our business.* Hands on experience that includes SEM, affiliate programmes, PPC, SEO, CRM and DM.It is highly likely you will have worked in any of the following roles and/or markets, and worked with the following products and/or services: Head of Ecommerce, Head of Online, Ecommerce Manager, Online Marketing Manager, Digital Marketing Manager.Please note that the postcodes used for this vacancy are for searching purposes only, they may not refer exactly to where the role is based.INTERESTED? Please email our retained consultant Philip Monkman quoting Digital Marketing Manager and reference PM1705-58 DDI: +44 (0)1604 683308 Wallace Hind Selection. The Old Vicarage. Duston. Northants. NN5 6JB. England. Tel: +44 (0)1604 758857 For more vacancies please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, visit our website or find our consultant on LinkedIn

title: Digital marketing executive
description:
Job Title: Digital marketing executiveDo you have Digital Marketing experience? Do you have editing and writing skills across carious digital platforms? This is a fantastic opportunity to join an award winning company.Job Overview: The role of a Digital Marketing Executive will involve you overseeing the online marketing strategy of the company. You will plan and execute digital (including email) marketing campaigns and design, maintain and supply content for the organisation's website(s).In addition, you will engage with the public through social media and ensure good visitor flow to digital sites. The Digital marketing executive role will see you analysing and reporting on visitor data and devise new ways to market products. You will frequently work for retailers with an online presence, financial institutions, charities and publishers.Key Responsibilities: Develop and manage digital marketing campaigns.Oversee a social media strategy.Manage and maintain the organisation's website(s).Write and optimise content for the website and social networking accounts such as Facebook and Twitter.Track and analyse website traffic flow and provide regular internal reports.Continually work on the Search Engine Optimization of the website(s).Edit and post videos, podcasts and audio content to online sites.Create online banner adverts and oversee pay per click (PPC) ad management.Attend product launches and networking events.Key skills:Editing and writing skills: You need to devise and edit content for various digital platforms.Writing blog posts may well be an integral part of the job.A working knowledge and understanding of Adobe Photoshop.Speaking skills: These will mainly be deployed internally. You will need to be able to explain coherently to others, who may not be familiar with the medium, how digital technologies work and what their marketing application is.Video editing skills: Website and social media content will not just be text but frequently visual as well.Web development skills: A digital marketing executive is not a software developer, but you will need sound knowledge of HTML/JavaScript, strong knowledge of search engine optimization and advanced Word and PowerPoint skills.ACS are recruiting for a Digital marketing executive If you feel that you have the skills and experience required in this advertisement to be a Digital marketing executive please submit your CV including an outline of your experience as a Digital marketing executive It is always a good idea to include a covering letter outlining your experience as Digital marketing executive with your application as this will enhance your chances of selection and improve your prospects of landing the Digital marketing executive role you desire.

title: 3D Project Manager
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Project Manager to join a busy Production team within one of the leading Sales Promotion/Retail Shopper Marketing design agencies in the country. Our client is a leading, retail agency in Northampton and has lovely modern premises based very close to the M1. We are looking for a proven Project Manager with specific responsibility and experience delivering 3D projects, with a focus on retail and global travel retail. Definition for the scope of 3D is any permanent POS and permanent retail disciplines. And so we will need someone with this positively popping out of their CV!The RoleKey areas of responsibility will be the management and day-to-day running of multiple projects, liaising with internal departments and suppliers, with specific responsibility for 3D projects mainly focusing on POS, retail and global travel retail. This could vary from a high volume low budget unit, permanent shop in shop fixture, to a promotional space in an airport and so previous and relevant experience is essential.The Project Manager will pro-actively work with Business Development and Account Management and liaise with internal and external contacts to produce a technical specification for the job that is practical, achievable, that answers the brief and is commercially viableYou'll generate project schedules and budgets in a clear and concise format as set out by the CompanyBe able to instil confidence within your 'internal' clients by professionally and commercially managing the development of all projects, whilst displaying practical working knowledge of all production requirementsAbout YouWe are looking for a Project Manager who has gained at least 2 years' experience in a similar industry and who has worked across POS. You will need a structured approach to work; highly organised, comfortable with managing multiple projects and juggling many balls.Areas of knowledge and experience will include, but not be restricted to: mild steel fabrication, plastic fabrication /forming and assembly, injection moulding, timber processing and assembly techniques, along with experience of QC, fire regulations and logistics.The ideal candidate, will already have gained experience in a similar role and be able to demonstrate good communication skills. It truly is a great place to work and has a great vibe and culture.If you'd like to know more, please get in touch as soon as you can or apply with your CV today!

title: Digital Media Field Sales - Market Leader
description:
An unrivalled Sales Position has arisen for an experienced Sales Executive. We can offer a fantastic opportunity and package for the right candidate. Our Website does not reflect everything we do as we keep a lot of our information confidential. If you have experience in Advertising/Media, B2B or Direct Sales this would be a great benefit but not essential. You will be working in partnership with the Local Authority in your own local area. You will have access and partnership details of all the Main Contractors and Suppliers whom are generating revenue and income in the Local Area. For over 27 years we have been the UK's Market Leader in media and marketing initiatives for EVERY Local Authority across the whole of the UK with outstanding success! Our highly experienced management team will provide training and support. Many of our Sales Executives of whom you would be working with achieve well in excess of this. If you would like to know more we would be extremely interested in speaking with you (in strict confidence) as soon as possible.

title: Business Development Executive
description:
We’re working with a leading commercial London law firm to source a BD exec to sit within their four-strong marketing and BD team. In a varied full mix role, you’ll gain responsibility for all aspects of the marketing and BD process, from defining the go to market approach for your specific sector groups, through to managing campaigns and executing plans in relation to client management initiatives. One of the key elements to this role will be regularly chairing and running sessions with fee earners to plan and deliver on BD projects. The firm has a good mix of HNW and private client work alongside both public and private sector businesses, and ambitious plans to target new clients which this role will be at the heart of. This role will suit someone with a few years’ experience in professional services marketing and BD and be looking for a broad and challenging role with great visibility given the lean nature of the team. However because of the volume of applications, we are sometimes unable to respond to individual candidates. If we have not contacted you within three working days your application has been unsuccessful and your details have not been retained. Please apply for any other position that you may see in the future. Career Legal is a Recruitment Agency and is advertising this permanent vacancy on behalf of one of its Clients. Thank you

title: Social Media Apprentice - 04228
description:
It's time to rasie a toast! Baltic Training Services and Halewood Wines and Spirits are excited to be recruiting for an apprentice Marketing Assistant to join their existing team at their site in Liverpool. Halewood Wines and Spirits are a UK based company who are proud to be bringing Liverpool back to the map by working with large retailers such as Tesco's, Morrison's , Sainsbury's and Aldi!About Apprenticeships "The more you read, the more you will know, the more you learn the further you will go." Apprenticeships are built around this principle. A Digital apprenticeship is a full time commitment which will fully immerse you into the world of tech, giving real workplace experience and expert training that you simply can't get from reading a book. We do things differently when it comes to apprenticeship. Since moving our training and delivery model online, we have seen real results and our apprentices are thriving! Our learner success rates are over 10% higher than the national average. Over 80% of learners say their career prospects have improved due to their apprenticeship. That's because an apprenticeship offers at least one year in the industry, picking up the practical working knowledge and skills that employers are looking for. Duties You will be working alongside existing staff and be mentored and trained to carry out the following duties:Creating and posting content on employers website.Updating the company's social media platforms accordingly.Growing your knowledge of the companies brand and services throughout this apprenticeship.Looking into marketing trends and reporting back to line manager as required. Training to be provided:Level 3 Advanced Apprenticeship in Social Media and Digital MarketingLevel 2 Functional Skills (English, maths and ICT)Skills and qualifications required:Able to demonstrate initiativeExperience using Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Fireworks or IllustratorOrganised, friendly and approachableGood communication and admin skillsExperience in Marketing tools such as Google AdWords and SEOEnthusiastic and professional attitudeExcellent telephone mannerExcellent written English skillsPreferably 5 GCSEs (A-C) or equivalent/predictedPassion for IT and Social Media and Digital MarketingThe future is bright Upon completion of the 12 month programme, there are real progression opportunities available. Along with your employer, you may decide to progress onto our level 4 programme and take your training even further. Salary, hours and benefits £200 per weekFull time (40 hours per week) 8.30AM - 5.00PM28 days annual leave (including bank holidays)Location and travel This role is located in the Huyton area of Liverpool very close to the Huyton business park and is easily accessible from Liverpool city Centre with a number of bus's such as the 14 and 898 and other surrounding areas such as St Helens. There is also an onsite car park for those who drive. About Baltic Training Baltic Training are the only apprentice and training provider that offer a completely tech-focused, tech driven training solution. We know there are dynamic, eager, young people out there. Young people who love this fast moving world, just as much as we do. They just need to transform that passion into the skills that employers need.So that's exactly what we help them to do. If this sounds like the role for you, get in touch! When we receive your application, the talent scout for your area will be in touch to guide you through the next stage of the application process.Good luck and we hope to hear from you soon!

Lead Generation Research Executive / New Company Market Researcher that has excellent business researching, internet searching capabilities, organisational, time-management and telephone / telemarketing skills is required for an innovative Company based in Bury, Greater Manchester, Lancashire, North West England.SALARY: £19,000 - £22,000 per annum + Benefits ** Excellent Career Development Opportunities **IS THIS YOU?This job would suit someone that can use their initiative, internet searching capabilities and telemarketing skills to carry out a range of focussed market research activities on target businesses / prospects for the Marketing and Sales Teams to follow up on.If you have a confident telephone manner with a good ability to search the internet for business information following a set strategy and focus then we would like to hear from you!KEY SKILLS: Ideal candidates will have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You will also have a confident and professional telephone manner with excellent business information researching skills using a wide range of tools including the internet.If you come from a telemarketing environment and want a more interesting and varied job than just making non-stop phone calls all day whilst working from a script, then this job could be ideal!JOB OVERVIEWWe have a fantastic new job opportunity for a Lead Generation Research Executive / New Company Market Researcher that has excellent business researching, internet searching capabilities, organisational, time-management and telephone / telemarketing / teleresearch skills.Working as the Lead Generation Research Executive / New Company Market Researcher you will be responsible for carrying out a range of tasks to compile a target list of companies for the Sales and Marketing Teams to follow up on. This will involve a focussed approach and strategy which will include prospecting, telemarketing, searching for key business information and contacts / decision makers using the internet and qualifying and generating new warm sales leads to support the Sales Managers.As the Lead Generation Research Executive / New Company Market Researcher you will need excellent telephone and market research skills with good internet searching capabilities and the ability to build rapport quickly with prospects or gatekeepers to gather the information required.ACCOUNTABILITIES:Reporting to the Group Marketing Manager, research and generate key business information and qualified sales leads from marketing generated activities, targeted cold prospecting campaigns, events and exhibitions, prospect lists or other sourcesFollow up with Sales Teams to ensure that leads are of an acceptable standard and converting into opportunitiesTo assist in finding and proposing new market segments to pursue for campaign targetingParticipation with Sales & Marketing Teams at team meetings, pipeline reviews, company meetings etc.Contribute to the designs for campaign messagingRecording and reporting competitor and market information As a successful candidate you will have a great opportunity to join this well-established Company that can offer excellent career development opportunities.APPLY TODAYIf this job looks like your ideal position then please send in your CV as soon as possible for our Recruitment Team to review.DUTIESYour duties and responsibilities as the Telesales Executive / Telemarketing Lead Generator:Research new business leads and key contact / decision maker lists via telephone and mass communication such as web, email and social media to identify appropriate buyers within targeted marketsFollow up on leads and conduct research to identify potential prospectsWork with the Sales Managers to develop and grow the sales pipeline to consistently meet revenue goals Manage data for new and prospective clients in Salesforce CRM, ensuring all communications are logged, information is accurate and any required documents are attachedPrepare and analyse lead pipeline reports and dashboardsIDEAL CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTSExperience in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field Previous telemarketing and/or inside sales prospecting experienceAbility to meet and exceed targets for lead generation quantity and qualityExcellent customer service skills Excellent written, telephone and verbal communication skillsProficient in MS Office products (MS Excel, MS Word, MS Outlook, MS PowerPoint)Experience with Salesforce or another CRM software package preferredAble to develop a good level of product, customer and market knowledgePersistent in achieving targets with a flexible and creative approachHOW TO APPLYTo be considered for this job vacancy, please submit your CV to our Recruitment Team who will review your details. CV’s of Job Applicants meeting this requirement will be submitted to our Client for consideration. By submitting your job application to us you are hereby giving us your express consent to submit your details to our Client for this purpose.PLEASE NOTE: CVs MUST be attached to your email job application in Microsoft Word or PDF format for our systems to process your application correctly, rather than your CV copied and pasted into the body of the email.Full-Time, Permanent Jobs, Careers and Vacancies in Bury, Greater Manchester, Lancashire, North West England AWD online operates as an employment agencyawdonline | http://www.awdo.co.uk | http://jobs.awdo.co.uk


Contact: CV Response Team
        

Reference: Totaljobs/AWDO-P3419

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Our client is looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Manager with exceptional leadership skills and commercial awareness to join a market leading E-commerce company.As part of a rapidly expanding business you will be responsible for all online customer acquisition with full ownership of the end to end online customer journey. This is a highly rewarding role with full visibility on the impact you'll have on business performance and constant opportunities to grow your existing skills and experience in line with the business growth.Reporting directly to the Group Managing Director, the right candidate will be responsible for both setting the online Marketing direction and managing new and existing third parties to implement changes, as well as working closely with the offline sales team to build a seamless customer experience.Working with our in house Designer to monitor customer engagement, you'll be responsible for drawing actionable insight from the daily data you collect in order to drive growth and boost conversion. You'll need to be extremely confident in pulling clean data directly from Google Analytics and using it to identify key trends and influencers and using that insight to drive future strategic decisions.Requirements- Experience building and implementing high performing online Marketing strategies- Managing budgets of £300,000 p/a and above- Ability to build and monitor weekly/ monthly dashboards of key business performance metrics- E-commerce experience managing sales sourced from web store, Amazon, EBay , email and Affiliates- Proven experience driving new customer acquisition initiatives from inception to test completion- Someone obsessively commercial in their approach- Ability to work effectively with a number of different departments and negotiate supplier contracts- An SEO and performance marketing expert with a strong history of success- Data driven and compelled by presenting clean and accurate performance data to all levels of the business- Strong written and verbal communication skills with knowledge of different methods for presenting digital strategy to gain buy in from other departments- A solid understanding of all marketing and advertising fundamentals- A proven people managerNice to have- Experience in customer profiling- Experience defining and presenting user journeys to Senior ManagementPlease submit your application or call the specialist consultant in Abacus Recruitment on 028 9031 3157 for a confidential career discussion or explore other jobs in Belfast, Northern Ireland, Dublin or London.With 100 years' experience in our team, Abacus is one of NI's most established recruitment brands. We can advise on jobs, CVs, interviews and salaries across permanent, contract and temporary employment.If you know someone who wants to move a career to NI, then tell them about www.abacus.jobs/belfastforlife or follow @AbacusJobs

title: Marketing / PR Account Manager / Senior
description:
An award-winning PR & Marketing agency is seeking an Account Manager or Senior Account Manager to join their Brighton offices. An incredible opportunity to take on a high responsibility client services role for a great agency looking after incredible B2B clients. A smart career step for an experienced marketing or communications Account Manager.The experience we need.The Account Manager needs to be a commercially minded, seriously smart and experienced professional who can drive growth, innovation and excellence. The key qualities we’re looking for:- A business enthusiast with ideally 3 to 6 years B2B PR and / or marketing experience ideally from an agency- A creative brainbox and engaging copywriter- An unflappable operator that can juggle deadlines and mucks in to get the job done- A curious individual that contributes to the collective knowledge of the team- An ambitious nature and eagerness to develop new skills and grow within our exciting company- A kind person that can preserve the special culture of the businessThe role.- Team management- Client admin and management- Media and influencer relations- High-level copywriting- Supplier coordination- Crisis communications- Ideas and strategy- New business responsibilityThe company.The Account Manager or Senior Account Manager will join a multi-award winning B2B marketing communications consultancy.
