title: Head Of Search - London - £60k
description:
My client is London's longest established specialist search engine and social media marketing agency and are now seeking an ambitious and talented search professional, with a strong background in performance media, to head up thier Search Marketing function. The Performance Media team manage PPC, Paid Social and Programmatic Display campaigns for clients, and work very closely with the Organic team. The Organic Search team manage SEO, Content Marketing, Influencer Marketing, Digital PR and Social Media campaigns. They also offer Web Analytics consultancy and Conversion Rate Optimisation as services, and have developed their own blogger network. You will be providing leadership for the teams in managing a range of very different search marketing projects across clients in multiple sectors. Current clients range from Travel, dating, fashion, charity and many others. Requirements:  -An infectious passion for all aspects of both Search Marketing and the wider digital -Strong background in performance marketing, particularly PPC -A team player and leader, with proven team management -A passion for coaching and developing team members -Ambitious, motivated and keen to keep learning and developing -Intelligent, energetic, bright, innovative with a can-do approach -Consultative – you will need to build relationships internally and externally-Evidence of thought leadership in the search marketing space-A well-developed public profile (public speaking, blogs, opinion pieces, etc.) The role: -Day to day runnign of PPC, Paid Social, Programmatic Display and Retargeting functions -Achieve agreed profitability / client yield / client growth targets-Ensure that the Performance Media and Organic Search teams closely collaborate-Provide inspirational leadership to Account Managers and Account Execs -Lead by example -Recruit, train, manage, mentor and motivate team -Ensure that knowledge of industry developments and best practice is shared -Work closely with HR to ensure that all team members have measurable targets -Conduct regular performance reviews, and team meetings, with all team members -Review existing operational processes-Explore opportunities to improve performance and produce a development plan -Ensure that all clients have the appropriate levels of contact and account management-Ensure that targets, forecasts, roadmaps and development objectives are set for all clients-Develop strong relationships with search engine, social and technology suppliersEnsure that -Develop network and provide new business opportunities -Regularly contribute blog articles, white papers etc.    Benefits -Work with a small team of friendly and fun search professionals -High degree of autonomy in role -Attractive salary and pension-Performance and growth related bonus-25 days’ holiday per annum, rising to 26 after two years -£500 Contribution to personal development / gym membership -Free drinks / beers every Friday-Collaborative, friendly and non-political office environment-Based in the heart of the best part of London     



Contact: Steve Lee
        

Reference: Totaljobs/SL38401

raise the profile of the brand through the development and activation of creative PR campaigns.Key ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the planning, research and delivery of creative PR campaigns and stunts that help to broaden horse racing's appeal.Proactively identify promotional opportunities and deliver on these under the guidance of the PR Manager, with a particular focus on online, consumer coverage.Work as part of a multi-disciplinary team to develop and sell in creative shareable content, including video and other digital assets, and ensure the greatest possible reach for initiatives.Produce editorial copy as required including, but not limited to press releases and packs, newsletters and shareable online content which can be syndicated to the media.Film, edit and produce quirky video content for use by the media and across our channelsDevelop relationships with key media including influential bloggers, journalists, online influencers, as well as industry title: Digital Field Sales Consultant
description:
As a Field Sales Consultant you will be responsible for selling stunning bespoke websites, Google PPC, social media, online stores and the UK's leading online directory, Yell.com. We are looking for a high performing Field Sales Consultant to join our team in Weston Super Mare focusing on managing existing accounts and generating new business. Media Sales experience is advantageous but not essential as full product training will be given. The opportunity * Best in market 8 week 'Field Sales Induction Programme' with excellent sales training * A career with one of the UK's leading digital media companies * Excellent salary and benefits package (£30,000 basic, £48,000 uncapped OTE, £6,200 company car or car Allowance, Life Assurance & Pension) * Great career opportunities with on-going training & recognition (managers recruited internally) * New joiners earning up to £80,000 per annum The person * Puts the customer at the heart of the sale * Goal orientated and entrepreneurial * Takes ownership and proposes solutions * Socially confident with excellent presentation skills * Demonstrates success in their sales career to date * Wants to work in digital marketing * Holds a full Driving Licence with a maximum of 6 points The company For over 50 years Yell has been at the forefront of advertising and marketing for UK based SME's. You're probably already aware of some of our leading products such as Yell.com, the Yell mobile app and our mobile optimised websites. We are also one of a select number of Google AdWords Premier SME partners in the UK, so our Field Sales Consultants are experts in developing an effective online presence for each of our customers, helping them find and connect with consumers. Our values; Knowledge,Relationships, Integrity, Passion & Results really matter and how we work is just as important as what we do. title: Junior Product Manager (Graduate Trainee)
description:
Today, our client is one of the leading suppliers of construction products and systems in Europe. They have top-ranking positions across most of their product ranges and markets and in the UK have ambitious growth targets.Their ambition is to unlock the potential in their products, the building systems they create, and also, at the heart of it all, their people. Whatever job you do with them, you’ll be part of something more as you’ll be helping to shape the way people build and live.What the job involves… Reporting to the Product Manager, the Junior Product Manager will develop the product portfolio within the company. ·Support the product management team in all aspects of innovation from gathering market insights, investigating attractive market segments, exploring their strategic search fields and developing unique, value adding solutions for our customers. Leading to direct responsibility for a product portfolio.·Existing Product Development (EPD). Supporting the implementation of EPD plans including managing range extensions and product upgrades. Ensuring adherence to the Innovation Process.·Maintain and develop product packaging ensuring compliance with all necessary standards including health & safety requirements.·Maintaining, adding and removing products as necessary, monitoring sales and profitability and making necessary actions to stimulate demand·Monitor competitor activity, communicate relevant information to the business to support strategy development and portfolio planning·Be responsible for monitoring product profitability and communicating action plans to the sales and marketing teams. Maintain and update internal databases in support of key stakeholders and customer information requests.·Be responsible for monthly reporting, trend analysis and identifying issues & corrective actions at an early stage. Creation of dashboards including Innovation performance.·Functional support to product managers and other internal stakeholders as required·Always promote Health & Safety in the workplace, displaying excellent personal safety and challenging others when unsafe behaviour is observed What they are looking for…Essential ·Bachelor’s Degree in a marketing or technical discipline (2:2 or above)·Outgoing, resilient and inquisitive personality with drive and ambition·Competent in the use of Microsoft Office package (especially Excel)·Skills in Numeracy, literacy & communication·Drivers LicenceDesired·Degrees that include; Product/Industrial design, Construction·Chartered Institute of Marketing·Knowledge of construction and/or building markets·Office based commercial experience·Foreign language (French or other European language)This is a Blue Octopus Recruitment Ltd vacancy who are operating as an employment agency. title: Marketing Executive (B2C)
description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a Marketing professional to develop their career, working for a fast paced and growing business. HomeLet are one of Lincoln’s biggest employers and the UK’s largest tenant referencing and specialist insurance company. With over 350 staff members we're based in our purpose built, stylish head office in the heart of historic Lincoln.Here's a little bit more about the role:The Marketing Executive (B2C) will report to the Marketing and E-commerce Manager to develop strategies, and to manage the execution and creation of marketing activity to meet commercial targetsAnalyse campaign data across all channels to recommend and implement adjustments that optimise marketing activityManage a range of customer surveys and analyse the information generated within the businessesProvide the business with an external view of the market, and changes within the competitor landscapeEnsure the brand ethos and philosophy remain central to the themes of all external communication, ensuring that content and messages are developed with the personality and tone of voice for the HomeLet brandThe role will focus on the businesses expanding direct to consumer tenants and landlords insurance offering. Key Accountabilities:Manage the marketing activity for HomeLet’s B2C insurance products through our key distribution channels to drive commercial targetsWork closely with the Management Information team to develop our understanding of the target market and optimise marketing activity by improving segmentation and messaging.Manage the delivery and reporting for the businesses customer satisfaction and insight surveysMonthly review of internally generated rental market data, and production of all assets related to the HomeLet Rental IndexWork closely with the Marketing Manager to deliver and manage PR for the HomeLet and Barbon brandsSupport the development of strategies and present ideas which match customer requirements and aim to maximise profitsPerson specification:An experienced marketing professional with experience in planning, developing, executing and optimising marketing campaignsExperience working with customer data to identify marketing opportunities and working with and managing external suppliersThe ideal candidate will possess the following:Excellent communication skills and attention to detailStrong analytical and numeracy skillsAbility to work under own initiative and be driven to achieveAccuracy in all written and data based reportingGood organisation and planning skillsCreative and innovate approach to marketingAbility to generate compelling content and messaging that’s relevant to the target audiencePlease note that all applicants must live in the UK and be eligible to work in the UK.No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we will gladly accept applications from persons of any age for this role.

description:

title: Trade Marketing Manager - Amazing Somerset Brand
description:
Historic brand with impressive future plans.Fast paced and fun environment.A chance to play a pivotal part in promoting the brand in national markets.This is an amazingly unique opportunity for a creative and passionate Trade Marketing Manager to join a successful heritage brand based in an idyllic rural Somerset Location. What you’ll be doingYou will be reporting into the Sales Director and part of the wider Sales and Marketing team. The main purpose of the role will be to promote the brand within the national trade and wholesale markets along with building brand awareness to the end consumer. title: PR Executive
description:
Your new company  I am working exclusively with Sony Europe, a multinational corporation whose diversified business includes consumer and professional electronics, gaming, entertainment, and financial services. You will be working within Sony to support the UK PR Manager across all PR functions. Due to a high workload, the job of PR Executive is available on an initial 12 month contract.  Your new role  As a UK PR Executive, you will be supporting the PR Manager across all PR functions including the day-to-day running of the UK Press office and PR campaigns. You will support various business areas across Digital Imaging, TV and Video & Sound. Due to the large workload there's a possibility of taking on responsibility for one of these categories exclusively. You will develop written materials such as press releases, plans and copy calls and build an understanding of consumer insights and target audiences. You will be required to take a leading role in reporting of both Press Office & PR campaigns & help organise the press trips & events. You will also be working closely with agencies and take on administrative tasks where necessary.  What you'll need to succeed  You will have either studied or have experience within PR that could include either agency or in-house. You will have to fully commit and have a level of flexibility as this role involves occasional travel to London & overseas and you will be prepared to become available if any issues, crises or any breaking news arises. You will need strong planning & organisational skills and will quickly learn how to prioritise your busy schedule. You will demonstrate excellent verbal and written skills and be a confident speaker who can handle high pressure situations like dealing with the press.   What you'll get in return  You will receive a rate of ��22,000 - £25,000 per year, depending on experience. As a UK PR Executive on an initial one year contract, this will be a great opportunity to gain valuable experience in a fast paced diversified business.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

Public Relations Manager About Jelf and BluefinJelf and Bluefin are two award winning insurance brokers and consultancies that support businesses and individuals with expert services and advice on matters relating to insurance, employee benefits and risk management. Jelf was formed in 1989 by Chris Jelf and in December 2015 became part of Marsh & McLennan Companies (MMC), a global leader in risk, strategy and people employing 60,000 people around the world. In January 2017 Jelf was joined by Bluefin group, which also became part of MMC, bringing together two leading community brokers and client advisory businesses.Jelf and Bluefin combined have a strong local presence which enables our advisers to provide outstanding levels of service. The combined business works out of 80 offices across England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland, employing almost 3,000 people. The Role:We are looking for a new Public Relations Manager to develop and implement a regional and specialist PR strategy for the combined Jelf and Bluefin business - the SME focussed subsidiaries of Marsh UK. The right candidate will be responsible for driving the PR strategy, ensuring it aligns with wider integrated sales and marketing campaigns and activity.The role will be directly involved in helping to shape and drive forward thinking communications strategy at a crucial and exciting time for the business, working with a wide variety of colleagues and stakeholders.Key Responsibilities:Build brand awareness and increase the profile of the Jelf Bluefin business.Develop engaging PR plans and strategy for all areas of the business.Provide ownership for press relationships in regional areas for Jelf Bluefin and wider Marsh where appropriate.Coordinate and create engaging content for external communications, across various channels.Develop and grow effective relationships with third parties.Maintain ongoing awareness of industry and business trends that are relevant to the business and its clients, especially in the SME arena.Work with the wider MMC media relations and communications teams, to ensure a joined up view of media activity and the correct adoption of processes and procedures.Required ExperienceStrong experience within a Public/Media Relations role.A background within a B2B environment (ideally within the insurance or financial services sector but not essential), or a relevant journalistic background with a strong business understanding.Knowledge of how PR can be integrated into marketing and sales campaigns.Excellent ability to develop and grow relationships both internally and with external parties.Strong hands-on skillset and the ability to produce and edit high quality content, for a range of audiences.Highly organised with strong attention to detail.Ability to work proactively and autonomously, bringing a creative approach to PR strategy.To apply, please use the 'Apply Online' link below.For any further queries regarding the role, please contact

title: Marketing Manager / Marketing Coordinator - Pet Products
description:
Job Title: Product Marketing ManagerLocation: Blackburn (with some EU & International travel)Salary: £28,000 to £32,000 dependent on experienceJob Type: Full Time, PermanentOur Client:This is a fantastic opportunity for a talented and ambitious individual to join one of the fastest growing brands within its sector.The company is a leading branded and own label pet food manufacturer based in Blackburn. Manufacturing and distributing brands such as; Webbox, Davies, Goodwyns, Oceanic, TastyBone, and Vitakraft through all the major UK grocery channels and also specialist pet trade channels.As part of the continued development and growth of the marketing department, they are now looking to appoint a Product Marketing Manager, reporting directly to the Head of Marketing. Key Responsibilities:As Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for the outbound marketing activities for your products. You will craft the messaging and positioning for products. You'll conceive and develop innovative marketing programs that drive demand. Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into benefits is crucial. In your role as a Product Manager you will develop new products in line with market trends and customer demand working closely alongside the production and technical NPD teams. The successful candidate will have strong communication skills, be able to build enduring relationships and be responsible for delivering profitability targets for many aspects of the company's hugely successful retail portfolio.The role is generally office based with occasional travel to consumer shows/exhibitions as and when required.Key Requirements:A confident and articulate communicator.A highly numerate and intelligent individual.A solid understanding of product management and the NPD process.Strong commercial understanding.An outgoing and friendly personality.Good organisation and planning capabilities.A track record of building commercial relationships.Willingness to be part of a wider marketing team, supporting marketing team colleagues in line with business demands.A professional approach.Ability to think clearly and calmly when faced with issues or problems.Ability to cope well with the demands of a rapidly growing company.Excellent work and customer care ethos.Willingness to go the extra mile.Self-motivated with an entrepreneurial style.Full UK and clean driving licence.Eligibility to work and live in the UK.To apply for this role please click APPLY to submit your CV and covering letterCandidates with the relevant experience or job titles of; Marketing Specialist, Marketing Manager, Product Marketing Manager, Marketing Coordinator, Senior Marketing Officer, Marketing Lead, Senior Marketing Coordinator, Marketing Strategist, Marketing Analyst, Digital Marketing Manager, Senior Marketing Consultant may also be considered for this role.

title: Marketing Officer
description:
A local Council based in Swindon are seeking a Marketing Officer. The successful candidate will work 37 hours per week, Monday to Friday predominantly based at the STEAM Museum but could potentially require you to work at the Lydiard Park office. This position is offering a salary of £11.35 per hour. Benefits include free parking and working within an exciting part of the Organisation.The successful candidate will provide high quality marketing support to the Museum & Heritage Services that will help to meet corporate objectives, increase the attendances and income at museums and visitor attractions, and achieve optimum levels of customer satisfaction, enjoyment and retention.Responsibilities of the Public Protection Officer:Assist with the design, development and delivery of marketing plans and information networks using digital and audio media as appropriate to ensure products and services are marketed effectively, and identify opportunities to use new technology to improve customer channelsDesign and produce internal and external printed materials, brochures, leaflets, posters and banners for the museums and heritage attractions for all general and specific publicationsBuild databases of customer information, schools, event hirers and tour operators to maximise direct marketing opportunitiesCreate and maintain social media outlets and feeds for museums and heritage attractions, and monitor usage. Analyse, report and make recommendations on online traffic.Raise the profile of heritage attractions in the media and increase public awareness through timely and creative press releases, news stories and case studies, and the effective placement of advertisements and listings in relevant external publicationsKnowledge and Experience:Proven marketing experience within the leisure, arts, tourism or heritage sectorAbility to create, build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external colleagues, customers and suppliersExcellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to produce high quality, creative and effective marketing materialIT skills in a range of programmes and Social MediaUnderstanding e-marketing and trends in technology and new mediaIf you want to be part of a team that makes a difference to people's lives, and feel you have the relevant experience we would love for you to apply for this role.To apply, please upload your CV directly to this advertisement.

Marketing Coordinator – Wokingham, BerkshirePermanent - 40 hours per weekUp to £14 per hour (DOE)ABOUT DENTALIGN ORTHODONTICSYou may already have heard of Dentalign, but just in case let’s give you a little background about us first. Over the past 30 years we have developed into a leading orthodontic group in the UK, offering quality NHS and private orthodontic care. Dentalign is part of Oasis Dental Care, a leading provider of NHS & Private dental care across the UK & Ireland. Oasis proudly cares for over 3 million patients, and now has over 400 practices across the UK and ROI.You may also have heard our exciting news that we have recently joined the Bupa family! There has never been a better time to join Oasis as we work together with Bupa to help people live longer, healthier, happier lives.THE ROLEThis is an exciting new role in which you will create and manage long-lasting commercial partnerships between Dentalign and local schools, businesses, and dental practices. In this role you will:Drive practice income by contacting local business and referring practices to create new commercial partnerships and referral agreementsPlan and manage events including presentations, educational programmes, and open evenings at local partner schools or businesses and trade shows/eventsPlan and organise networking events for local referring practices to promote Dentalign and encourage new or increased referralsGenerate new business leads through cold calling, and creating and distributing online and print marketingMaintain and expand existing partnership relationships as a main point of contactHelp the Practice Manager and clinical team deliver exceptional patient care and customer service, ensuring a smooth patient journeyABOUT YOUPersonable and positive with natural drive and determinationA proven background in sales, marketing, or events (ideally in a clinical/healthcare setting)Excellent communication and organisational skills, able to communicate effectively with people from all walks of lifeWHY CHOOSE DENTALIGNA competitive starting salaryProgression and development opportunitiesContributory pension schemeModern surgeries and dental software systemWelcoming and committed teamCompetitive staff benefits including discounts in over 7000 retailersSalary sacrifice and childcare vouchersPlease apply by sending your CV and salary expectations to the Employed Recruitment Team.We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all who fit the requirements of the role. If you need any reasonable adjustments as part of our recruitment process just let us know.Due to the high level of interest in our roles, we are only able to contact short-listed candidates. Good luck!

title: Marketing Manager
description:
JOB REF: J028910JOB TITLE: Marketing ManagerSALARY: up to £35,000LOCATION: BradfordAn exceptional opportunity to join a well-established and extremely successful Yorkshire based manufacturing business. Having developed and grown over many years in to a flourishing, innovative, family-led business, the company are now looking for a Marketing Manager to join the business and bring fresh talent and creativity to the team. The successful candidate will be creative, inspiring and will thrive in a dynamic environment. This is a varied and far reaching role with responsibility for a range of brands and incorporating all elements within the marketing mix.Key responsibilities will be:• Brand development and implementation of the overall marketing and communications strategy• Developing and implementing marketing campaigns• Developing innovative social media and PR strategies • Managing marketing and campaign budgets• Analysing and measuring campaign success• Ensuring maximum levels of customer engagement is achieved• Hands-on execution and management of weekly and quarterly e-mail campaigns• Producing marketing materials and literature in line with brand proposition• Responsible for overall company PR including writing press releases• Plan and implement product launches, working alongside brand managers and other teams• Overseeing the tradeshow calendar and managing events• Ensuring all leads are maximised effectively, working closely with the sales team to improve lead generation rates• Writing web content and ensuring website marketing is effective and developing in line with business needsUtilising the full range of marketing channels in line with company strategy and wider business plans. The successful candidate will be have experience working across the entire marketing mix and will relish the opportunity to work in an innovative and progressing business. You will be a genuine team player who embraces a challenge and wants to prove yourself in a varied and rewarding position.If you are able to demonstrate to above skills and would like to apply please send your CV.Due to the volume of applications we receive if you have not heard from the managing consultant within 1 week please assume you have not been short listed. title: Product Manager - EcoTank Printers (Western Europe)
description:
Epson is a global imaging and innovation leader dedicated to exceeding the vision of customers worldwide through its compact, energy-saving, high-precision technologies. We offer an extensive array of award-winning products across the world ranging from printers and 3LCD projectors for business and the home, to electronic and crystal devices.We are searching for a Product Manager to be responsible for our EcoTank printer range. Reporting to the Product Manager for Consumer Hardware, the successful candidate will be the 'product champion' for this range, liaising with sales teams, marketing and customers and being responsible for all aspects of the product lifecycle. The Product Manager is the key point of contact for all other departments for product expertise and market understanding and is responsible for managing the balance between volume forecast and price positioning to maximise category performance.This role is based in our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead, Herts.Key responsibilities:Manage all aspects of the product lifecycle, analysing market trends, delivering forecast accuracy, price and promotion management, and identifying critical factors for the successfully establish a new product categoryBe the 'Product Champion', 'evangelist' and 'go-to' person for sales teams, partners and customers on all product related questions/queries regarding products and associated programmes / markets / technologiesLiaise closely with the Japanese headquarter product team and European marketing and communication team to development a Customer Value Proposition (CVP) that fully match market, channel and customer requirementsDevelop and maintain a strong understanding of the key competitors, complementary vendors, end users and channel partners who influence the marketGather information from sales teams and directly from customers / channel on market trends and competitor information (new products / price positioning / promotional offers etc)Provide structured feedback through precise analysis to the major stakeholders, ensuring that market situation, trends and opportunities are fully understoodLiaise with and support local business and product management teams across Europe to ensure full and correct implementation of the business strategy for the category and the overall consumer hardware business unitSupport local sales and marketing colleagues at customer events / Journalist presentations / exhibitions etc, to ensure that products are presented / demonstrated at their bestKey skills and experience required to perform this role: Applications are welcomed from Product Managers currently operating in the IT Hardware or Consumer Electronics industry or a related industry:Product management background preferably within a related industry ideally with experience of launching new productsEnthusiasm for technology and an inquisitive mindCommercially aware of channel / end user dynamics, with ability to support a sales oriented organisationGood communication and presentation skills and the ability to networkAble to work independently yet in agreement with management directionUnderstanding of the market sector, and appreciation of major channel and end users influencersOutstanding data analysis capabilities (sell in, sell out, forecast, price management)Very good Excel knowledge and general IT knowledgeAbility to assess and assimilate multiple information sourcesExperience operating in a matrix organisation with central functions If you are seeking an opportunity to work for a market leading vendor, helping to shape the future of our EcoTank printer proposition, we would love to hear from you! Epson makes products for a wide range of customers and we are committed to having a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary and with an outstanding suite of benefits. Colleagues based in our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead work in an excellent waterside location with close proximity to Apsley train station, onsite parking and a subsidised restaurant.


Contact: Epson Europe BV
        

Reference: Totaljobs/UK00561
        

Job ID: 74380135

title: PR Strategy Director
description:
We're delighted to be working on this exclusive opportunity to search for a right hand wo/man to the current Head of agency in Manchester. This is your opportunity to join one of the hottest agencies in the UK and one which is taking Manchester by storm! The agency is part of a very well established group in the UK and landed in Manchester in 2016. Already they have ruffled feathers and have the established agency giants in Manchester quaking in their boots! Based in the heart of the business district amongst some of the trendiest bars and restaurants in town, you will be inspired coming to work everyday to join the most exciting PR agency there is right now!!This company works with International clients across a range of sectors. They are open to the sector that you have previous experience in; it could be across B2B or B2C, although working on corporate accounts is an advantage! The key to this brief is personality.We're looking for someone to take the weight off the current head honcho in the agency – this will free them up to grow the business but will lean on you for key business decisions. Inspiring and helping to grow the team is essential while creating killer PR strategies for their big name clients but also not scared of chipping in and getting stuck in writing stunning content!Job Description:?	Creating killer strategy and ensuring delivery of ground-breaking integrated PR and Communication campaigns which are aligned with business objectives and deliver tangible results?	Inspiring the super talented team?	Providing clients and C-suite personnel with advice and consultancy?	Being a great deputy, sounding board to the Head of agencyThe ideal candidate will have:?	Proven agency experience for a number of years ?	An excellent track record of successfully managing portfolio of high profile accounts?	An entrepreneurial get-up-and-go spirit, with an excellent team ethic?	Strong experience in proactively sourcing new business leads?	Demonstrable ability to handle big budgets and demanding clientsWhat We're Looking For:Ideally, we'd be looking for an experienced Account Director or someone just on the cusp of promotion!. As mentioned, personality is KEY. Big egos need not apply; this agency is all about TEAM, working together, no politics and having a fun time doing it!To Apply:If you think this role would suit you, please apply via the link below or call Charlotte Lamb on 0161 804 0160 for a confidential discussion about the position.We respond to all CVs so you will hear back from us within the next couple of days.About Us:Network Marketing specialises in Marketing, Digital and Creative recruitment across the UK with offices in Leeds, London and Manchester.Network Marketing is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

        Communications Specialist, Bedford - A Bedford-based deliverer of specialist communication campaigns are on the look-out for a Communications Specialist to create materials that will engage the company's world-class clientele. Working alongside global brands, you'll produce creative campaigns that raise awareness for their employees about the steps they can take to improve their everyday security.With a finger on the pulse when it comes to communications, you'll adapt your approach to each channel you work with to create refreshing client content. Demonstrating your talent by turning dry policy into engaging prose, you'll prioritise your time and maintain effective relationships with clients.As an individual, you'll be keen to always work to the highest standards, and you'll love to create content which influences others positively.In return for your enthusiasm and hard-working ethics, you'll be trained and given every opportunity to develop. You'll need to have worked previously in a client-facing position and have a good understanding of the workings of internal communications and how they can be used to effect change within a company!This likeminded group of professionals have helped numerous organisations become more secure, and they need your experience to help them be a source of advice and expertise. Sounding good so far? Take the time to apply!This role would be most applicable to candidates travelling from areas of Bedford and the wider region, including, St Neots, Milton Keynes, Cranfield, Biggleswade, and Woburn. For registration purposes, please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn to hear about all our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days, please assume that your application has not been successful.

title: Product co-ordinator
description:
Product Co-ordinator,Salary: up to £25KPerm rolePrinces RisboroughReporting to a Product Manager, the Product Co-ordinator will assist in maintaining as fit-for-purpose existing education products, including helping with the maintenance of the assessment infrastructure required to deliver those qualifications and services.The role holder may also be involved in supporting the development of new qualification products and the transition of these to business as usual.The role holder will have responsibility for maintaining question banks, producing assessment material ready for review and sign off, producing up to date data and statistics on the performance of assessment materials, assisting in the training of associates, including arranging training sessions and producing notes and actions from meetings.The successful individual will have experience of analysing and presenting data, experience of recording notes and actions from meetings, have excellent administrative and IT skills, be able to communicate with a variety of stakeholders and have experience of working with dispersed teams.They will have a knowledge and familiarity with professional body roles as well as an understanding of assessment processes and standardisation.Other key skills include effective negotiation, well developed planning and organisation and working as part of a team.This is a new position within our organisation which offers an excellent and exciting opportunity. If you feel you have the skills, experience and passion we are looking for, we look forward to hearing from you.FRS strives to be an equal opportunities employer, and is committed to treating all applicants alike. FRS does not treat any individual on grounds of sex, age, colour, marital status, race, nationality or ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability or membership or non-membership of a trade union, less favourably than others. All vacancies advertised are open to all ages.

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
My client, an award winning B2B organisation who have only being going from strength to strength over the past couple of years are now on the lookout for a Marketing Analyst to join their expanding marketing team. This is an exciting time to join such a highly reputable company that are really going places. If you're looking to work for an ambitious, forward thinking and sociable bunch of people then look no further! Please read on for more detail.Job Description:As the Marketing Analyst, supporting the wider marketing department you will be responsible for using both qualitative and quantitative research methods to assist the organisation in making informed decisions through the evaluation of data. Key duties will involve identifying and defining opportunities within both existing and new markets to become the go to marketing analyst for research and market insights. Responsibilities will include carrying out competitor analysis, looking at market trends, understanding key competitor's products and helping to advise the company on gaining competitive advantage. What We're Looking For:To be considered for this position you must have a couple years' experience in a marketing research role with proven experience in both qualitative and quantitative research methods. You must have a strong attention to detail, be commercially astute, have experience with CRM systems and have knowledge of SQL. This is a crucial role for the company so if you tick all the boxes above then please send me your details. To Apply:If you think this role would suit you, please apply via the link below or call Louisa Guy on 0113 2469605 for a confidential discussion about the position.We respond to all CVs so you will hear back from us within the next couple of days.About Us:Network Marketing specialises in Marketing, Digital and Creative recruitment across the UK with offices in Leeds, London and Manchester. Network Marketing is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age

        Assistant Marketing ManagerSpring Technology is currently working in partnership with a market leading company to recruit an Assistant Marketing Manager in Northamptonshire!The CompanyYou will be working for a truly market leading organisation who are recognised as one of Britain's Top Employers. There is fantastic career progression available across the Group which includes many leading, well-known brands as well as a network of over 30,000 colleagues.The RoleCan you see the possibilities of working on a market-leading portfolio? If the answer is yes then this role could be for you!The role is to delivery specific marketing plans and internal/external communications across the company, maximising sales opportunities and customer retention through customer relationship marketing activity.In this role you will:*Creation of innovative marketing campaigns and promotions using B2B techniques to drive category growth and market share.*Creation and delivery of promotional literature in conjunction with the commercial team*Responsibility for the delivery of price guides, maintenance of products listed based on range reviews from the commercial team*Management of CRM marketing communications such as lapsed/lapsing, cross sell/upsell using e-marketing (typically these will be monthly campaigns) ensuring successful delivery*Maintaining website content with the latest prices and products while engaging with the marketing team to ensure overall web strategy is delivered*Marketing agency liaison: Design, e-marketing, website & PR*Database management: Oversee and manage the customer database to enable accurate, regular marketing communications*Manage the administration, development and organisation of any Trade Shows or events*Ad-hoc marketing; Delivery of ad-hoc marketing including creation of leaflets, product packaging and sales day events*Providing support to the Sales team in developing customer focused activity.Requirements*Previous experience in a similar role*Have a commercial outlook to the world of marketing *Experience of e-commerce marketing *Experience of B2B marketing techniques as well as producing catalogues, working with analytics and Microsoft Excel application.*You will be highly engaging, have influencing and negotiation skills and able to demonstrate your drive, enthusiasm and continuous improvement outlook. *Possess good attention to detail, be able to use initiative and be a self-starter.Interested?Apply now for my immediate consideration!Spring Technology is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.Spring Technology is an Equal Opportunities employer; ,

Head of Ecommerce, £85k to £95k - Global Beauty Brand! Central LondonMy leading, global beauty client are currently looking for a senior head of ecommerce to join their team in Central London due to very exciting changes in the business.As the head of ecommerce you will be strategically managing all of the ecommerce activities across brand websites and channels for two brands within the group to deliver best in class customer experience whilst achieving ambitious KPIs. You will be a self-starter with a pro active approach, a great leader with strong management and communication skills and be happy with change management. You should also have experience working with customer segmentation and personalization.To apply for this role get in touch with Beckie Eaves at Blu Digital Recruitment.#digital #headofecommerce #ecommerce #beauty #senior #digitalmarketing #cosmetics

title: Studio Manager
description:
Studio Manager
	








Manchester (M1), 






£30000 - £35000 per annum










Permanent


Posted 24 days ago


























Studio Manager - Manchester - £30-35kHighly successful retailer, based in Manchester, is looking for an experienced and super-organised Studio Manager to join their marketing services team.Reporting into the Operations Director, you will be responsible for managing the studio resource to deliver a high standard of output across all brand and retail marketing campaigns. You will ensure that the studio's resource is rigorously planned and that projects are on-track to be delivered correctly, on brand and to deadline. You will be the single point of contact for the team, for all incoming briefs, ensuring they are fit for purpose and planned into the studio, based on resource availability and the team's strengths/skills. You will work closely with print production and compliance, to ensure the quality control of all outputs from the team, while motivating the team and demonstrating a high standard of leadership skills. You will create workflows and road maps for campaigns and projects, while compiling and maintaining daily/weekly/monthly schedules and forecast plans, in accordance with the campaign calendar and retail requirements.To be considered for this role, you must meet the following requirements:At least 5 years' experience in a similar role as a studio or traffic manager within a creativeagency environmentA proven ability to manage the workload of teams and plan resource effectively.Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.Strong leadership qualities and skills.Demonstrable experience implementing new processes or systems within a creative team.Experience managing both print and digital projects across multiple platforms to delivery.Extensive operational experience including time and performance management.Excellent understanding of the creative process and timelines for delivery.Ability to understand a brief, define the key elements and timing, highlight, manage andmitigate risk.Experience using database applications to plan and track workflow.Exceptional Apple Mac skills, especially in In-Design, Photoshop, Illustrator & AcrobatExcellent design, visualization, re-touching skills, with an attention to detail, preferably gained in the creative or reprographics and print industries.An excellent communicator and team player, who can also work unsupervised with a flexible approach to workloads and the ability to manage and prioritise their own workload to achieve team goals and deadlines.Able to work under pressure and respond to tight deadlines without compromising the creative quality or accuracy of the brief.This is an excellent opportunity to join a very talented studio and to really make a difference to the organisation and output of the team. You will have plenty of support from the Operations Director, although you must be able to hit the ground running and work autonomously.


Contact: Gareth Wright
        

Reference: Totaljobs/LBB2017341

title: Project Manager Digital Communications - German Speaking
description:
Role: Digital Communications Project Manager (German Speaking)Contract: 6 monthsStart:ASAPDay rate: £200 - £300 We're looking for a midweight project manager with a digital background. Experience with corporate websites and investor relations/corporate communications space would preferred. You can demonstrate a track record in managing delivery of the best strategy, creative and technical execution for your clients, motivating teams to bring projects together.If you'd like the opportunity to develop your career working with passionate, talented people on award-winning digital communications projects, then this will be right for youWhat you'll be doing as a Project Manager, your involvement will traverse the full project lifecycle, from initiation to completion, whilst acting as the focal point behind the client partnership to deliver great solutions. You will plan, lead and deliver both single or multiple stream projects seamlessly to an agreed scope of the project.In additional to the above, you will be responsible for the delivery leadership of at least one strategic account, as the hub between the client, technical and creative teams to defining the best approach for delivering work across the account. You will be involved in a fast moving and creative environment. Working alongside a collaborative team of designers, account managers, strategists and remote development teams, your responsibilities will be:Responsibilities*Interacting with the project teams and clients, building key relationships, managing client expectations, ensuring high client satisfaction*Fostering clear and effective communication and any escalations across your projects*Ensuring accurate planning, resource and work allocations and reporting*Managing all project risks (creative, cost-related, technical or operational) and quality of all aspects of project delivery *Keeping a keen eye on your projects' financial indicators and resultsRequirements*Solution orientated, understanding that our clients' problems are our problems too*A 'can do' attitude and a genuine passion for digital, with solid experience of project managing complex technical and Web-build projects *A confident and energetic personality, with excellent communication, presenting and interpersonal skills (negotiation, mediation, facilitation)*Acute attention to detail and the ability to cut through the noise and hone in on the key objectives*An excellent grasp of numbers and different commercial models, scoping work correctly *Expert in project management techniques and tools, with ability to mentor junior team members*Knowledge of a wide range of methodologies and technologies, and technical aspects of Web Development

description:

This busy advertising and design agency based in the heart of Bristol are searching for a talented Account Manager to join their lovely team. You might be an ambitious Account Executive with a few years’ experience under your belt, or an established Account Manager looking for a new agency to call home, either way this could be the role you’ve been waiting for! What you’ll be doing You’ll work closely with a lovely mix of clients, from global brands to local retailers, delivering on a range of projects across creative and digital. Head of E-Commerce & Trading, Peterborough - A well-known consumer brand in the consumer ecommerce sector that has an instantly recognisable brand name is seeking a candidate to take on a Head of Ecommerce position. The ideal candidate will have extensive top level P&L experience for a large consumer website, as well as extensive team management exposure. Candidates without 4/5 years' top level ecommerce/trading experience from a consumer website need not apply.The purpose of the role is to guide the effective commercial trading of the website to improve margins and performance, whilst growing and developing the team. Areas of focus are merchandising, trading, conversion, user experience and analytics .Your past experience must come from a large consumer organisation in leisure, FMCG, travel, fashion etc.. And you must have experience of managing websites with turnovers over £20m per annum and teams of over 5. This is an excellent opportunity to work for a globally recognised organisation that is a market leader in its field and has an outstanding reputation. Due to the location of the office, this role could be of interest to those living in Peterborough, Huntingdon, St Neots, Wisbech, Stamford, Spalding, Northborough as well as parts of Northamptonshire. Marketing Manager, Newport Pagnell - Are you an experienced Marketing Manager with a passion for consumer brands? Looking for an exciting new challenge within an exciting, industry-leading business? Then this could be the opportunity you've been waiting for!Our award-winning client is looking for a driven and ambitious Marketing Manager to join their lively team in Buckinghamshire. With several years' experience working with large consumer brands, you will be well-equipped to deal with all the challenges this role entails. Having gained experience across the full marketing mix, you will be confident creating a comprehensive and cohesive marketing strategy to drive the business within the UK market and increase brand share. Experience of marketing tangible goods directly to the consumer is essential in this role, and knowledge of B2B brand partnerships would be beneficial. As Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for the marketing strategy across a number of platforms and touch points; from PR and social media to television advertising and direct marketing. Using your strategic and commercial insights, you will tailor and craft strategic campaigns to drive demand amongst target demographics. You will be responsible for managing key product lines, ensuring positioning, pricing and performance are in line with the wider market, consumer expectations and company objectives. This role also supports the sales team and you will be expected to drive growth by developing key point of sale materials, including marketing collateral, and generating innovative promotional offers to appeal to consumers. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Marketing Manager to take the next step in their career within a highly-respected, international consumer business. Due to the location of their offices, this role could be of interest to those living in Milton Keynes, Northampton, Bletchley, Newport Pagnell, Banbury, Bedford, St Neots, Luton, Dunstable, Leighton Buzzard, Aylesbury, Hitchin, Banbury, Buckingham and Bicester. title: Temp Head of Media (Children's Books)
description:
A leading book published based in central London is looking for an interim Head of Media to lead an deliver media strategy for brands within their children’s portfolio. This is an interim role for 3-6 weeks with possible extensions while the publisher recruits for the role on a permanent basis.
Key duties:

Secure innovative, targeted and creative media coverage for brands/ authors across children’s book list
Create Media plans
Optimising cultural calendar opportunities and topical news to promote relevant children’s books titles
Development of innovative publicity tools that fully reflect the identity of the book/brand
Generate and foster review and feature coverage across all media
Management of journalist relationship and key children’s influencers
Coordination of regular media presentations
Present publicity strategy and campaigns to internal and external stakeholders including authors, agents and licensors

Experience / skills required:

Proven work experience working in a publicity department and/or PR company within consumer brands
Relationship established with media contact
Understanding of licensing industry and related publicity
Capable of creative and innovative  publicity campaigns
Experience within children’s publishing or children’s brands is desirable

For further information, please apply online or email a CV and salary expectations to 
Atwood Tate embraces diversity and seeks to promote the benefits of diversity in all of our business activities and to develop a business culture that reflects that belief.  We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief.
Due to the volume of applications we receive we are often only able to contact successful applicants.  If you haven't heard from us within 7 days you have probably been unsuccessful on this occasion but we will keep your CV on file for any future relevant opportunities.
Atwood Tate acts as an Employment Agency in relation to permanent and contract vacancies and an Employment Business for interim and temporary recruitment.

title: Senior Insight Analyst Unique Client
description:
Our clients are possibly the most exciting new Retail Banking clients in the UK at this moment. This role is working for their Unsecured team. This role reports into the Senior Analytics Manager, and is responsible for valuation and performance reporting to inform regular reviews on customers. In addition the role will support the Senior Analytics Manager in performing commercial analysis across the dozen different portfolios managed, to drive commercial strategy. Required candidate will require solid commercial, analytical and data marketing skills, in particular:?Proven experience in an analytical and commercial environment. ?Experience of data extraction in SQL or SAS. SAS will be required for the job but can be learnt in situ as long as candidate has SQL and some basic programming experience. ?Strong Excel modelling experience.?Experience of financial product valuation methodologies, preferably credit card (but will consider savings and loans). ?Commercial acumen, ability to align customer solutions to commercial and strategic goals?Knowledge of and ability to work within a regulated credit environment This really is an excellent opportunity with a fantastic company, with excellent benefits and growth prospects. If you’re interested, or purely wish to learn more - feel free to call or mail Dan from PeopleGenius – details on our own website.£32-48k Base + 10 % Bonus, Life Insurance, Medical and Excellent Pension SchemeKeywords: Insight Analyst, Senior Insight Analyst, Marketing Analyst, Senior Marketing Analyst, SAS, SQL, Analyst, Market Insight Analyst, FS Insight, Retail Insight, Cards Insight, Campaign Analyst, Marketing Analyst, Senior Marketing Analyst, Decision Science Analyst, Decision Science, Direct Marketing, Campaign Manager, Campaign Analyst, Senior Campaign Analyst, Insight, Insight Analyst, Senior Insight Analyst, Insight Manager, Head of InsightCommutable Locations: Leeds, Manchester, Wakefield, Bradford, West Yorkshire, Yorkshire, South Yorkshire, Dewsbury, Halifax.

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
I'm currently working with a multi-award winning content agency who create visual stories through the use of good data. The role is for a senior project manager to join their growing team. This agency is the preferred choice for many big brands/clients, as specialists in their sector, this agency produces some exceptional work which can include can include microsites, apps, watch apps, interactive installations, social stickers, video animation, quiz, reports and virtual reality. The role; - Engage and motivate the team, clients, internal stakeholders and third parties.- Manage the full lifecycle of projects including planning and project governance.- Work alongside the Senior account manager on financial management from cost estimation to budget management.- Work alongside the Senior account manager to develop and scope agile project proposals.- Be clear in progress reporting both internally and with the client.- Protect the team, the agency and the client through clear scope management – including change management.- Listen, conduct regular retrospective reviews to assess how well the project or campaign was delivered. Your experience; - Experience working across a number of briefs and have a good understanding of the following disciplines – strategy, technology, creative and design. (Data a plus.)- An understanding of your strengths and weaknesses and a desire to work with the Senior account manager to progress the agency and your career.- Comfortable in communicating with senior clients, managing expectations around budgets, risks and issues while being mindful of the goals and objectives.- Strong meeting facilitation and presentation skills- Experience in Project Management methodologies, Agile / Scrum, PRINCE 2 experience desired.- Ability to implement and govern strong programme processes to manage scope, quality, timeline   and budget including early detection of risk and budget variance.- Team player with excellent written and verbal communication skills including strong negotiation skills- Structured and clear thinker: ability to prioritise a demanding workload. This agency has a fantastically embraced, diverse culture. Anyone joining this agency would be welcomed by friendly faces and open arms. You will have the opportunity to make a real impact and progress your career further by applying yourself in this collaborative small agency. This agency also offer a some awesome benefits including a £200 pounds gift voucher to spend on something that you are passionate about when joining! If all the above sounds of interest, please apply now!

Marketing Manager, Downham Market - A growing consumer brand are looking for an experienced Marketing Manager to join their team in Norfolk. Self-motivated and enthusiastic, the Marketing Manager will have previously managed a team, be business-minded and have outstanding communication skills. Passionate about the industry and striving to be the best, the Marketing Manager will be a strategic thinker and have excellent vision to drive the company into an exciting new era. Happy to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, the Marketing Manager will ideally be degree educated, and be driven, adaptable and highly organised, as well as comfortable liaising with a variety of stakeholders. Responsible for creating, implementing and running online and offline campaigns, you will develop an innovative marketing strategy and understand the importance of building brand equity, ensuring its presence in everything you do. Taking pride in representing the company, you will be commercially-minded owning a budget, and liaise with both colleagues and agencies to create exciting campaigns and engaging content. Digitally-minded, you will understand the importance of social media, and be the go-to for your team for guidance and inspiration. This is a varied and all-encompassing role that sees the experience Marketing Manager able to really make an impression with a fantastic company, that truly values its employees and is always looking forward. Due to the location of this office, this role is commutable from Ely, Peterborough, Kings Lynn, Cambridge, Norwich, Grantham, Boston, Bury St Edmunds, Huntingdon, March, Chatteris, Newmarket and Stamford. For registration purposes, please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. SEO Manager, Potters Bar - An established and recognised consumer brand are looking for an experienced SEO Manager to join their team in Potters Bar. With ideally 3+ years' experience in an SEO role, the SEO Manager will have a proven background in consumer E-Commerce, and be well-versed in paid search optimisation. With outstanding SEO knowledge, you will comfortable pitching your ideas to senior stakeholders, and able to work and think confidently and independently, as well as with other departments. With impeccable analytical skills, the SEO Manager will have used a variety of analytical tools, and be happy working with a variety of stakeholders to improve your work. Owning the SEO activity for the business, you will not only build the SEO strategy, but implement as well as analyse the results of it, aiming to consistently improve your performance. Creating exciting and engaging content to maximise your conversion figures, you will understand varying campaigns throughout the year, and have a firm grip on both the changeable market and your competitors, to constantly have the competitive edge. Working cross-functionally, you will be technically minded to bolster and capitalise on varying SEO operations, and regularly explore new avenues and methods to further improve the company's performance. This is a thoroughly hands-on opportunity that offers the seasoned SEO expert the chance to truly put their mark on an exciting and changeable business. Due to the location of this Potters Bar office, this role is commutable from Chelmsford, Reading, Enfield, High Wycombe, Harlow, Bishops Stortford, Hatfield, Hertford, Woking, Maidenhead, Luton, Stevenage, Milton Keynes, Cheshunt, Barnet and Watford. description:
A successful health and beauty cosmetic company based in Watford need YOU for their Marketing Administrator!The Marketing department is the central function within the company and provides information and support across the whole business.SCOPE OF JOB:-ADMINISTRATION OF BRANDS-COPY CHECKING-COMMUNICATION-PRODUCT KNOWLEDGE/INFORMATION-MARKET KNOWLEDGE & COMPETITOR INFORMATION-BRAND REPORTS/ANALYSIS-BRAND PRESENTATION AND DOCUMENTATION-BUDGET AND INVOICE MANAGEMENT -DATABASE MANAGEMENT-SUPPORT MARKETING ACTIVITES-3RD PARTY MANAGEMENT AND LIASING WITH DERMAL PRODUCT KNOWLEDGE/INFORMATION-Develop an understanding of all relevant brands; their modes of action, key active ingredients and key competitor categories. -Maintain online brand files, updating and filing of brand information and competitor advertising.If you are an individual with:-A marketing degree-Excellent communication skills-Strong organisation skills-Computer literate with strong Microsoft skills, especially in Excel Then we need to hear from you!Your Admin duties:-Assist Marketing department with preparation of presentations as required-Management of budgets and invoice reconciliation -Provide cover for Customer Service during Holiday and periods of sickness-Copy checking - essential eye for detail - at various stages and circulating with relevant personnel.-Assist BM with month end reports and Monthly Business Review-Assist BM with management of Trade PR; liaising with publications and booking insertions.-Assist BM with development of POS-Co-ordination of materials and stock for HV exhibitions-Liaison with Trade Marketing Executive in relation to media activity, media updates and trade promotion activity requirements, i.e. copy, logos, artwork, updating promotional calendars etc.-Co-ordination with Warehouse and Sales Admin, re: incoming marketing materials, ensuring relevant personnel are aware of quantities, codes and delivery dates.-Liaison with PR agencies to arrange delivery of product samples.-Raising purchase requisitions, to be counter-signed by BM for each job-Ad-hoc field visits with Territory Managers to develop understanding of independent pharmacy sector/needs.-Attendance at occasional Field Meetings to develop relationships with Field Sales Team.-Co-ordination of the trade PR (raising purchase reqs, sending approved press releases and pack shots to trade contacts, tying up invoices and purchase reqs)Are you up for the challenge?Hours are Monday-Friday 9-5. description:

A leading Medical Communications agency is currently recruiting for a Project Director position within its growing team in London. This role will focus on the development of client communication programmes for educational and promotional campaigns.  You will work closely with the project management team and medical writers to deliver high quality materials and will be responsible for all written outputs ensuring they are scientifically accurate and adhere to industry compliance and Code of Practice requirements. title: PR AD - Energy & Industrials - Global Agency
description:
We are looking for an established PR Account Director for a fantastic opportunity within a global communications agency. This role will be based in London and will sit within a growing team that specialises in energy & industrials. You will have the opportunity to work on major client accounts covering renewable and traditional energy, power and utilities, transport, logistics and industrial tech.  You will play an integral role within this fast-paced team, helping to lead the team across accounts, managing client relationships, and contributing to the development of multi-stakeholder campaigns. You will be involved in developing and reviewing written materials and will work closely with the team to identify news angles and develop stories that generate high quality, on-brand coverage for clients.  To be considered for this position you must have a mix of consumer and corporate communications experience gained from working in an agency and have experience working with high profile clients in the energy, industrials, transport, logistics and/or manufacturing industries. In addition, you must have a strong news sense and solid social media knowledge and experience.  For this and similar vacancies, please contact Suzanna Hesketh on 020 7788 4343 or email suzanna@fresh-connect.co.uk       PR Account Director, Account Director, PR Senior Account Manager, Senior Account Manager, PR Senior Account Director, Senior Account Director, Energy & Industrials PR, Energy PR, Industrials PR, Corporate Communications, Corporate Comms, Corporate PR, Consumer PR, PR, Public Relations, London. title: Sub-Editor
description:
We’re looking for an enthusiastic sub-editor with a keen eye for detail.What will a day in the office look like?Our sub-editors spend the majority of their day editing a variety of original, informative and engaging deals to appear on Wowcher and LivingSocial UK & Ireland. They've got a keen eye for detail, predominantly checking for spelling, punctuation and grammar errors, as well as essential facts and figures, including prices and discounts. They also consider whether the deal is marketed in the best way for our target audience and make the necessary amendments to fit our strict brand guidelines. We work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment that is ideal for an individual who thrives under pressure. Our close-knit team supports each other and always goes the extra mile to achieve the highest standards across all content on the site.Our editors also write occasional deals and blog posts, plus regularly schedule deals to appear on the site and in emails for our combined subscriber base of over ten million. Main responsibilities:Ensuring deals that appear on the site read well, are grammatically accurate and factually correctProofreading daily adverts for nationwide papers and several regional papersSourcing images and editing them using PhotoshopScheduling deals to go live on the site and preparing email sends for our subscriber baseAd hoc editing of marketing and social media content Subbing and occasionally writing blog posts on a variety of beauty and lifestyle focused topicsWorking closely with the Senior Production Executives to ensure all content on the site adheres to in-house style guidelines, ASA standards and the brandWho is the ideal candidate?This is the perfect role for a graduate or junior editor who enjoys working as part of a team and is good at problem solving. The ideal candidate would have:Previous experience as editor for a lifestyle or beauty focused brandA fast and efficient working mindset with keen attention to detailBasic image editing experience using PhotoshopStrong communication and problem solving skillsThe ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet strict daily deadlinesAn unyielding desire to achieve a high standard across all work that is producedKnowledge of SEO would be an advantage

Communications Content Writer Croner - Hinckley Salary up to £35,000 Depending on experience + excellent benefits packageAn exciting opportunity has arisen to join a National HR and Health & Safety Consultancy, Croner, as a Communications Content Writer. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a B2B focused marketing team.You will be responsible for writing content that resonates with SME Business owners and engages with our target market through a variety of channels. Your writing will also play a key role in building the brand through our media outlets.Key responsibilitiesDevelop engaging news stories and communications for external audiences.Write online content ensuring it is relevant, current and engaging.Help build content to educate and inspire our target audience; such as articles, ebooks, white papers, infographics. case studies, product collateral and bid library exerts.Work with the group marketing and sales team to plan a quarterly and annual content strategy.Create content for a variety of platforms, including, but not limited to, the external website, media publications and company newsletters.Monitor competitor activity, customer behaviour and the latest trends to improve the performance of your writing and content.Managing copy to align with company objectives, standards and brand guidelines.Writing assignments related to awards submissions, client communications, press releases and thought leadership.Develop a PR strategy in conjunction with the marketing team, to improve brand recognition and reputation.Skills & experience required3+ years of professional content writing experience.A real ability to understand your target audience and make content that engages them.An established track record of developing marketing content from conception to deliver to impact.Demonstrate a strong writing flair and a passion for generating new ideas.Fast pace communication skills to deal with news stories and campaigns.Bachelor's degree in communications, marketing or business preferred.Knowledge of HR/employment law is favourable but not essential.We offer a great benefits package, company pension, childcare vouchers, 25 days holiday, free breakfast every Monday, fantastic offices and lots more!If this sounds like a marketing challenge you would relish, apply today!


Contact: Croner Solutions
