Michael Page are proud to be partnering with Animalcare Ltd. to recruit 2x Product Managers to join their Marketing team based in York.Client DetailsFor over 25 years Animalcare has built its reputation on a wide range of quality products, including idENTICHIP microchips, POM-V medication, pet welfare and practice equipment. They sell and develop goods and services to veterinary professionals, principally for use in companion animals; operating through UK wholesalers and distribution and development partners in key markets in Western Europe.Animalcare is a sustainable growing business, is cash generative and is implementing a clear strategy to accelerate its growth over the next 3 to 5 years. With its roots based in York, they work closely with their suppliers to create and innovate within their existing portfolio, whilst delivering an extensive program of NPD.Animalcare is one of the fastest growing veterinary supply companies in the UK, consistently outperforming the market in recent years.DescriptionThe main purpose of the Product Manager will be to develop, implement and manage the product marketing plans. This person will also build the marketing strategy and communications which will fully support the sales and business goals for a comprehensive range of existing and new Animalcare products.You will be expected to work closely with the sales, technical, regulatory, NPD teams, customers, suppliers and external agenciesKey responsibilities will include:Research, preparation and implementation of product marketing plans and sales forecastsProviding technical support for product training and selling tools to the sales team and customer baseWithin the agreed budgets, manage the design and implementation of all marketing, communication and promotional plansManage the full life cycle of the product groupsBe responsible for setting annual product budgets and report on sales performance vs budgets and targets on a regular basisSetting the product selling prices in agreement with the senior management teamWorking closely with the Supply Chain team to manage product supply into UK wholesalersLiaising with Technical and Regulatory Affairs in support of legislative requirements for designated product rangesIdentifying new productsNew Product Launches - pre launch documentation, creation of marketing materials, technical training, post-launch managementBuild and maintain competitor and market intelligence databaseProfileThe successful Product Manager will ideally be someone who is currently operating in either the Healthcare or FMCG industries. You will already be an established product marketeer with experience of managing Products from concept to launch. Alternatively you maybe a veterinary surgeon or nurse, who wants to move to a more commercial role, but make full use of your veterinary education and in practice experience.Candidates should ideally have a science or business degree, familiarity with marcomms and at least 3 years sales and marketing or product management experience, preferably in life sciences or a related field. Experience in the veterinary industry would be advantageous.You must be able to work cross-functionally and communicate effectively with a wide range of key stakeholders across the business.Attention to detail is crucial, as you will be ensuring that the product information is communicated accurately and that the technical training is completed.Aside from this, you must be passionate about product management as the business will be looking to you as being the expert in your respective product group - knowing not only the ins and outs of your range but also that of your competitors.Job OfferOn offer for the Product Manager position is a competitive salary and package, in addition to an attractive performance related bonus, a company car (BMW 3 Series Equivalent), a share incentive scheme and a generous contributory pension.Aside from this is the opportunity to make your name as a Product Manager in a growing and innovative business, with lots of exposure to key stakeholders that will without doubt help to propel your career.


Contact: Gavin Wingfield
        

Reference: Totaljobs/13793810/001
        

Job ID: 74311162

title: Design and Brand Manager
description:
Our client a market leader in their sector are currently recruiting for a Design and Brand Manager to come on board and join their fun and friendly marketing team. The successful candidate will create and design all digital and print requirements. The ideal candidate for this versatile and demanding role will be a motivated individual who has an exceptional eye for detail and is experienced in driving a team. With a proven track record of delivery in design and brand the successful candidate will be confident and competent working independently and in cross-functional teams and bring a strong customer understanding to your work.Key Responsibilities:Create digital assets and media using Adobe/CS Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and In-DesignTo create dynamic assets using HTML 5Creation of all design requirements for the business (print and digital) inc brochures, flyers, eshots, enewslettersTo co-ordinate and liaise with each Department to establish their printing requirements and keep an auditing report on print stock.To liaise with the Head of Communications on the creation of the marketing materials for internal and external promotions (social events, special offers etc).To assist all areas of the Company in the creation of sales presentations.To assist the Head of Digital with all digital design requirements.Key Skills Required:Minimum of 3 years experience in a multifunctional company environment within a marketing role.Experience using Adobe, Illustrator, Photoshop, In-DesignExcellent communication skillsHighly organisedParkside Recruitment Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. Major Players seek a Head of Quantitative starting ASAP and paying up to £100k base with an excellent package. Please apply within or send your CV to jessica.buckley@majorplayers.co.uk The ClientOur client is an established full service qual/quant research and insights agency who boast conducting quality research through innovative methodologies alongside the traditional means. The agency was set up 7 years ago by peers, passionate about research and dedicated to the work they do, who wanted to push the boundaries on traditional research. They work across sectors on high profile clients, predominantly within the leisure, retail and telecom industries. The RoleThey seek a Head of Quantitative research to join their collaborative team working across all elements, end to end. The role will be split between delivering projects, business development and growing and managing a team. You will have a hands on approach as you will be heavily involved at all stages; you must have experience and be happy to work on the nitty gritty right to the senior director responsibilities. You will be working predominantly on ad hoc projects although there will be a few ongoing trackers to manage also, so experience across both is desirable. You will have a high level of responsibility, overseeing accounts up to the value of £6m. Your role will incorporate high levels of business development.The CandidateYour background will most likely be from a small-medium sized agency environment or recent experience managing your own company as it is imperative you have experience and the willingness to oversee all levels of projects from minor set up and admin tasks to the high responsibility tasks such as writing proposals, designing research and pitching and winning business. You will be entrepreneurial by nature and thrive in an environment where you have flexibility to make the job your own, constantly developing yourself and the agency. You will have managed juniors, and have experience setting up and growing a team would be desirable. You will have a strong track record of winning business and any business you can bring with you is beneficial. Experience in leisure, retail and telecoms is desirable but not essential.This role is starting ASAP and paying up to £100k base with an excellent package. If you are interested please apply within or send your CV to jessica.buckley@majorplayers.co.uk , or visit www.majorplayers.co.uk for other opportunities.

description:
We're looking for an Editor for to develop and deliver a new editorial vision for one of the UK's leading digital special interest brands.Our client is the leading website in its genre in the UK and, under its current Editor has recently reached the milestone of 1m monthly unique users for the first time. We are looking for an Editor to take the brand on the next stage of its journey as our client look to deepens their engagement with the community and embrace new content formats. With a background in lifestyle editorial or weddings, you'll be tasked with creating beautiful and inspiring content and user experiences. A key objective will be to compel users to interact and transact in the vendor marketplaces. As part of our clients specialist Network, you'll be expected to work collaboratively with the Editor of sister-titles. Responsibilities:StrategyDevelop a deep understanding of the target audience as well as trends in the marketCreate a new editorial strategy that caters for audience needs and supports our business growth objectives Leadership and ManagementEnsure everyone associated understands and delivers what is required from the editorial strategyLead, direct and motivate the editorial team and freelancers, setting clear goals and objectives and ensuring the smooth operation of the websiteContribute to a strong, positive culture within hitched which attracts, motivates, develops and retains talent across all departmentsResponsibility for overall traffic performance using agreed metrics ContentOverall responsibility for content on all platformsWork with your editorial team to generate creative and engaging content ideasPlay an active role in the creation of content and interaction with our audience on social and forum platformsDay to day management of website and social media channels including tasks such as writing, proofing, headline writing, post scheduling and corresponding with readers and partners as requiredMonitor and report on editorial output against targets, strive to raise editorial quality while maximising outputTake responsibility for delivering/commissioning content for key commercial partnerships. Brand & PromotionTo be an advocate for hitched internally and externallyPromote the brand through media and public appearances, through working with comms team and at events Qualifications:Experience of working as an Editor or Deputy Editor for a digital brandAn in-depth knowledge and enthusiasm for the wedding or general women's interest media marketsProven leadership skills at a senior level with the ability to manage, motivate and develop othersSharp writing skills with a well-developed voiceAttention to detail complemented by visual flairProven track record in audience development including traffic growth, advanced social media expertise and SEODemonstrable experience of using data and insight to drive editorial strategy, audience development and conversionsStrong planning and organisation skillsAbility to work independently as well as build upon the ideas of othersCreative instinct with an appetite for maximising opportunities to innovate and improvePositive, can-do attitudeWell-developed communication skills and the ability to represent the business at the highest levels both internally and externallyFor a full spec, please register your interest. We regret only successful applicants will be contacted.

title: Senior Production Artists - 6 month FTC
description:
At Schawk, we create brands, activate brands in the marketplace and help produce and protect them worldwide. We bring the right combination of creative and production services together to help make our clients brands more desirable and more profitable. The assets we produce ensure absolute accuracy, consistency and efficiency across media, regions and presses. We offer comprehensive pre-media services, rigorous print management and innovative packaging security and workflow solutions. We’re known worldwide for superior quality and innovation.We are looking for a Senior Production Artist to join us on a fixed term basis in our Newcastle offices. They will be responsible for developing accurate and high quality artwork for all Production assignments before they go to print.As a Senior Production Artist, you will:Attend all pre-production meetingsEnsure high quality standards in all client production briefs.Perform assigned tasks within overall Production workflowEnsure you are delivering work against budgets, briefs and timeframesCollaborate with multiple internal teams.Time manage effectively per projectYou MUST have:Strong understanding of pre-press within the packaging industryGood understanding of effective creative design practices, trends, techniques and processes, across various touch-points or mediums (e.g. packaging, in-store, point of sale, print, etc.)Knowledge of Adobe Creative SuiteAbility to follow guidelines and SOP’sThe ability to build relationships with a range of stakeholders/clients/teams and ensure a productive communication flowFlexibility with working hours to meet client demandsStrong communication skills

description:
NEW JOB - Swedish, Dutch OR Spanish speaking Online Digital Marketing Executive - fantastic opportunity to join a world class , international and highly successful brand and online retailer with excellent career challenge and future opportunities!LANGUAGES Swedish, Dutch OR Spanish LOCATION Harlow, Essex - north east of central London (20-30 minutes by direct train from London)COMPANY Our client is a successful, international designer, manufacturer and e-tailer of a huge range of brands and designs to the creative sector.JOB RESPONSIBILITIES In order to develop online business activity across the Swedish, Dutch OR Spanish speaking markets of Europe, they wish to recruit either a Swedish, Dutch OR Spanish speaking Online Marketing Executive. title: Senior Performance Marketing Manager
description:
Job Title Senior Performance Marketing ManagerReport to Marketing DirectorLocation HQ, Trafford Park, ManchesterWorking Hours Full Time Monday to Friday A bit about the company:Established in 1994, The Fragrance Shop is the UK’s leading independent fragrance retailer. Our aim is to make mainstream and luxury fragrances affordable and accessible to all. We showcase over 130 fragrance brands available in over 185 stores throughout the UK, online at www.thefragranceshop.co.uk, and via our app and mobile site, as well as over the phone. The Fragrance Shop is on a steep growth track with many exciting new development plans on the horizon that will see us expand into new categories starting with beauty in 2017, new customer demographic groups that will come with niche and more premium brands, and into new international markets.Role Snapshot:This is a fantastic opportunity to join TFS at a crucial time in their growth period. You will be responsible for driving their customer acquisition and play a pivotal role in their business with the view leading the Performance Marketing team. The scope of the Senior Performance Marketing Manager role covers all biddable media channels such as PPC, SEO, retargeting, paid social, display, programmatic as well as affiliates and partnerships (across the whole suite of online products – mobile, app, desktop, as well as driving footfall into store). Some of these channels are already opened out but are still early stage with many more opportunities to grow, and some are not yet established. Therefore, this role provides a unique and exciting opportunity for the candidate to make a real, value-adding difference. This role requires an in-depth understanding of the customer’s omnichannel journey and how to deploy each channel to best effect to successfully engage and acquire new customers. The successful candidate will bring proven experience and a successful track record in setting up and scaling these channels profitably, across international markets and multiple platforms, utilising a data-driven approach.Responsibilities:·Contribute to integrated campaign strategy and plans, outlining key marketing themes, messages and offers throughout the year·Support the Marketing Director in the development and execution of plans, forecasts and budgets that help achieve overall business objectives·Oversee and manage the Budget and ROI responsibility for all Acquisition channels on a day to day basis·Oversee and manage all the acquisition media to drive incremental footfall/traffic and profitable sales, and to monetise all opportunities whether online or in-store and put in place effective testing programmes to open out new channel opportunities to drive growth·Put in place the right cross channel attribution tool so we are a good understanding of the customer user journey and are using this to optimise our media·Drive and accelerate our digital media performance (through continual monitoring and optimising) against Traffic, CPA, ROAS and COS·Own the daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual digital media targets and KPIs ensuring there is a sense of pace and urgency to achieving them ·Work independently, or with Analysts as appropriate, on the interrogation of all available analytical data to identify clear opportunities for growth and development·Coach and mentor the team to deliver on day-to-day plans and activities at a granular level whilst keeping an eye on the bigger picture ·Manage and nurture day-to-day relationships with media owners, and other third party partners, ensuring that we get the appropriate support and access to enable us to achieve our objectives. Specifically, help to establish good relationships with key partners such as Google, Facebook etc.·Champion tech developments internally that support better digital media performance, and increased process and spend efficiency ·Constantly keep up-to-date with industry innovation to open out new opportunities ·Work closely with our Head of Online Experience and the Trading team to optimise conversion and personalisation on site depending on traffic source·Any other duties as reasonably requested What success will look like (non exhaustive list):·Buy-in of digital media plans from Marketing and Commercial Director·Priority KPIs showing an upward trajectory including, but not limited to,oTraffic / footfalloConversion ratesoSales and profit growth·A well developed and happy team, and third party suppliers who are adding value ·Effective member of marketing teamExperience/Skills:Bachelor Degree: Marketing or related (or equivalent experience)6+ years in ecommerce/acquisition role (agency and client side)Proven success as a senior digital level and exceptional knowledge of the digital marketplaceSignificant experience implementing digital strategies including PPC, SEO, Social and AffiliatesExceptional at using data to drive decision-making Very hands-on and execution focus but also able to see the bigger pictureStrong and dynamic manager who can inspire a team and coach/mentor them to achieve success To be passionate about innovation and customersExcellent organisational and time management skills, with the ability to work to tight deadlines in a fast-paced environmentAble to articulately communicate at all levels and successfully build productive working relationshipsWell-rounded leader of high-performing teamsBe able to confidently present at a senior level, and field questions posedExcellent persuading and influencing skills at all levelsExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsA passion for fragrance, retail and beautyProactive, self-starter and a team player

Passionate and knowledgeable about a variety of sports and incredibly well connected, you understand how the press works and what is important for sports fans. You know how to shape and deliver PR campaigns, events and run a press office function in a way that resonates with different segments of the media and how to best engage with them to tell our story and drive awareness, coverage, and subscriptions. You will have experience of working with agencies and will have run successful initiatives for a major brand or sports property either in-house or at an agency.Responsibilities;Evolve the global PR strategy in line with company growthDevelop and maintain relationships with national and trade media in the UKIdentify opportunities, generate ideas for media coverage and work with your local colleaguesResearch and write media releases, statements, press materials, press kits, presentations and briefing materials for spokespeopleWork with colleagues in local markets to plan and implement press conference, speaker opportunities, media hosting eventsManage PR agencies and other related agenciesMonitor, track and report on your own PR activities as well as the competitive landscape.Requirements;Excellent sports knowledge, news sense and editorial planning with strong creative content writing skillsProven ability in campaign planningExperience across full PR toolkitExperience in launching new or innovative products and services, ideally with an international environment balancing global strategy and local market trendsProven ability in measuring performance against audience targets and analysing competitors.Partnership management skillsDesirable;7+ years' experienceExperience working in an international/global organisationPrevious experience managing PR for a sport, digital, mobile, media, entertainment, lifestyle brandLine management experience

title: Product Manager GPS Watches (EMEA)
description:
Epson is a global imaging and innovation leader dedicated to exceeding the vision of customers worldwide through its compact, energy-saving, high-precision technologies. We offer an extensive array of award-winning products across the world ranging from printers and 3LCD projectors for business and the home, to electronic and crystal devices.We are searching for a Product Manager to be responsible for our GPS sports watches. Reporting to the Sport Watches Business Unit Manager, the successful candidate will be responsible for all pre-launch activity including product design and specification as well as identifying competitor activity and potential customers, agreeing pricing and being the product champion for this product group. The successful candidate will work closely with our Sales Teams and Head office in Japan in this high profile role to ensure the smooth launch of the products and the on-going success of the sales strategy.This role is based in our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead, Herts and will involve some travel across the EMEA region and Japan.Key responsibilities:Be the 'Product Champion', 'evangelist' and 'go-to' person for sales teams, partners and customers on all product related questions/queries regarding products and associated programmes / markets / technologiesLiaise closely with the Head office in Japan product team to assist in the development of Customer Value Propositions (CVP) that fully match local customer requirementsIdentify target segments and develop go to market strategies to address those targetsResponsible for all pre-launch activity including product design and specificationDevelop training materials to communicate the CVP for products for local purposes, and present these to Epson and Channel sales staffSupport local sales and marketing colleagues at customer events / Journalist presentations / exhibitions etc. to ensure that products are presented / demonstrated at their bestDevelop and maintain a strong understanding of the key competitors, complementary vendors, end users and channel partners who influence the marketGather information from sales teams and directly from customers / channel on market trends and competitor information (new products / price positioning / promotional offers etc)Provide feedback to the Head Office in Japan to ensure that local market situation is fully understoodEvaluate new products/software, identifying problems and potential solutions to the Central Business UnitKey skills and experience required to perform this role: Applications are welcomed from Product Managers currently operating in the GPS Sports watches industry or alternatively a related sports industry:Product management background preferably within a related industry ideally with experience of launching new productsEnthusiasm for technology and an inquisitive mindGood communication and presentation skills and the ability to networkUnderstanding of the market sector, and appreciation of major channel influencers and end usersAbility to assess and assimilate multiple information sourcesExperience operating in a matrix organisation with central functionsVery good Excel knowledge and general IT knowledge (PC and Mobile OS's, Network) If you are seeking an opportunity to work for a market leading vendor, shaping the future of our GPS Sports watches offering we would love to hear from you. Epson makes products for a wide range of customers and we are committed to having a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary and with an outstanding suite of benefits. Colleagues based in our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead work in an excellent waterside location with close proximity to Apsley train station, onsite parking and a subsidised restaurant.


Contact: Epson Europe BV

title: Visual Marketing Executive
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen with Furniture Village. We are currently looking for a Visual Marketing Executive to come and join our team based in Slough. You will join us on a full time, permanent basis and will receive a competitive salary of £30,000 per annum plus benefits.Our first ever Furniture Village store opened its doors in Abingdon in 1989 with a simple philosophy: to offer truly excellent products, prices and service to all our customers. Twenty-seven years and over 50 UK-wide stores later, this philosophy still holds true and we are the country’s number one, independently-owned furniture retailer and still growing.About the Visual Marketing Executive roleSitting within the Multichannel team, the Visual Marketing Executive will be responsible for developing and implementing all in store marketing communications, ensuring clarity of campaign messaging in line with multichannel activity and a customer focused shopping experience. From concepts to briefing and final delivery, this role includes the maintenance of all point of sale material and hardware in store and the management of cost effective print, procurement and distribution with our external agencies.The VM Executive will ensure effective communication internally and maintain high service levels to our stores – including the collation and editing of weekly bulletins from the multichannel team. The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate strong POS experience gained in a similar role. They will be used to working in a fast-paced environment, able to multi task and communicate effectively at all levels. Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar Marketing role.What you can expect in return our Visual Marketing Executive- An excellent salary and benefits package- Bonus arrangements depending on area- Store, Group, RDC, NDC etc.- Holiday – 28 days inc Bank Holidays standard, rising to 33 days after 5 years of service i.e. 1 day for each additional year- Company pension scheme – auto enrolled- Permanent Health Insurance and Death in Service benefit after 1 year of service- Staff purchases and Friends & Family discount – after 6 months’ service- Long service – 10 and 20 years of service currently recognised- Childcare Vouchers- Cycle to work scheme – help to buy a bikeKey responsibilities of our Visual Marketing Executive- Manage of the POS budget in excess of £600k in line with Commercial and Business objectives.- Work with the Multichannel team to ensure that all campaigns and longer-term requirements are considered as part of an integrated planning process.- Work closely with the Product Introduction Manager, internal Creative Team and external agencies to ensure the timely completion of all POS materials, including product cards, A3’s and price tickets, for all new lines prior to their arrival on the shop floor.- Provide clear and accurate communication of all POS activity via a weekly marketing bulletin.- Brief required assets to the in-house creative studio, giving commercial feedback on creative and gaining signoff as required.- Maintain the in-store POS storage system to minimise loss or damage and provide on-going monitoring of storage techniques.- Develop and maintain historical, easy reference ‘guard books’ for all POS material. Grow and nurture Furniture Village’s relationships with external partners/suppliers.- Explore, develop and implement new visual marketing aids to meet the needs of the business and ultimately enhance the customer experience.- Assist in the production and proofing of other advertising material as required. Have the ability to carry out ad-hoc marketing initiatives where necessary.What we’re looking for in our Visual Marketing Executive- Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar retail marketing role.- Good networking and influencing skills.- Enjoys working within a fast-paced environment.- Able to communicate with key stakeholders internally and externally at all levels.- Degree or Business Qualification desired but not essential.- Working knowledge of in-store POS and print processes and techniques.- Budget management experienceIf you would like to join our team as our new Visual Marketing Executive then please click ‘apply’ today – don’t miss out, we’d love to hear from you!


Contact: Furniture Village
        

Reference: Totaljobs/mzm10643VME
        

Job ID: 74319800

They specialise in a range of marketing services, including email marketing, B2B data and direct mail and they truly believe in working in partnership with their own clients, which is why they have a fantastic reputation within their sector. They develop their own products on site, sell and deliver support and management of their services all in house. They are looking to add hungry, passionate, sales individuals to their exciting sales team based in their Newcastle City Centre office. Head of Marketing Our client is an award-winning tech business based in cutting edge offices in Manchester City Centre. As part of their rapid expansion, they are looking to grow its marketing team with the appointment of a newly created Head of Marketing role. title: Content Marketing Executive
description:
I am working with a highly creative and customer focused digital marketing agency based in West Yorkshire. They are looking for a Content Marketing Executive, to support the existing team in the delivery of content on the websites they build and to creative digital campaigns.  Job Description:   You would be joining a highly passionate, social and fun bunch. As a Content Marketing Executive you'll work closely with your clients and the Content Manager to understand how their brand is brought to life online through content. You will be delivering content strategy on a daily basis to gain positive results. You'll work with the rest of the agency to publish content across owned platforms while working with external stakeholders to maximise off-site content opportunities.   What We're Looking For:  I am specifically looking to speak to candidates from a content background– preferably from an agency but I will look at client side too. You'll be very passionate and be a proper digital marketing buff! You will have outstanding of content and copywriting skills with a keen eye for detail and a ‘can do' attitude.   To Apply:  If you think this role would suit you, please apply via the link below or call Gen Larkin on 0113 246 9605 for a confidential discussion about the position. We respond to all CVs so you will hear back from us within the next couple of days.  About Us:  Network Marketing specialises in Marketing, Digital and Creative recruitment across the UK with offices in Leeds, London and Manchester. Network Marketing is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
    


Contact: Gen Larkin
        

Reference: Totaljobs/B12002526

title: PR & Communications Exec - Fast Growing Beauty Brand
description:
Own the PR, Comms & Social Media strategy.Work with a fantastic beauty brand.Fast growing business and team.A rare opportunity to work for a fast growing beauty brand in Trowbridge has arisen for an experienced and highly driven PR/Marketing comms professional to communicate the brands; gaining press coverage and increasing customer interaction and engagement. What you'll be doingAs the business grows through great brand performance, a strong new product development plan and an increase in customer interest there is now a need for a proactive and self starting PR and Communications Exec to create and deliver successful PR campaigns and Social Media content. With new products ready to launch, and others with a strong brand presence, your role will be to build strong relationships with key press, bloggers and social influencers to ensure the brands are always in the forefront of consumers' minds. Through strong and attractive press releases you will keep consumers up to date on brand activity, and deliver creative campaigns to gain the attention of the press, bloggers and end customers. Due to an increasing International customer base you will be required to support customers with local PR and Communication activity, keeping them on strategy, sharing assets and where required working with local PR agencies to implement plans. Occasional travel to London PR agencies will be required, and possibly the odd trip abroad. What experience you'll need to applyProven experience within a PR and Marketing Comms roleGood Social Media experience, especially across Instagram, Facebook and TwitterA strong verbal and written communicatorAbility to network and pick up the phone to journalistsSelf motivated and can work on your own initiativeA genuine team player who enjoys working within a small teamWhat you'll get in return for your experienceThis is such a great time to be joining this company. It is a small team, but a great one, with a strong culture, ambitious growth plans and the resources to support the ongoing growth, you can really make this role your own. As well as having a genuinely exciting role, you will have a competitive salary (circa £27k-£30k), 25 days holiday + BH, flexible working hours, early finish on a Friday, a new laptop and iPhone, what more can you ask for? What nextThere will be a lot of interest in this role so don't wait around and apply now, or contact Chris (01179 269530) for more information.
    
    

Contact: Chris Currey
        

Reference: Totaljobs/7381
        

Job ID: 74323553

Marketing Manager, Downham Market -A growing consumer brand are looking for an experienced Marketing Manager to join their team in Norfolk. As the company values the work-life balance of their employees, there is the option of flexible working and/or working from home with this position. Self-motivated and enthusiastic, the Marketing Manager will have previously managed a team, be business-minded and have outstanding communication skills. Passionate about the industry and striving to be the best, the Marketing Manager will be a strategic thinker and have excellent vision to drive the company into an exciting new era. Happy to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, the Marketing Manager will ideally be degree educated, and be driven, adaptable and highly organised, as well as comfortable liaising with a variety of stakeholders. Responsible for creating, implementing and running online and offline campaigns, you will develop an innovative marketing strategy and understand the importance of building brand equity, ensuring its presence in everything you do. Taking pride in representing the company, you will be commercially-minded owning a budget, and liaise with both colleagues and agencies to create exciting campaigns and engaging content. Digitally-minded, you will understand the importance of social media, and be the go-to for your team for guidance and inspiration. This is a varied and all-encompassing role that sees the experience Marketing Manager able to really make an impression with a fantastic company, that truly values its employees and is always looking forward. Due to the location of this office, this role is commutable from Ely, Peterborough, Kings Lynn, Cambridge, Norwich, Grantham, Boston, Bury St Edmunds, Huntingdon, March, Chatteris, Newmarket and Stamford. For registration purposes, please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.

description:
A leading Medical Communications agency has an opening for a Senior Account Executive within its growing team in London. This agency has an excellent reputation within the industry and boasts an exciting client portfolio featuring some of the biggest names in the pharmaceutical industry. You will play an integral role within this fast-paced team, helping to develop strategies and plan activity and supporting the day-to-day running of accounts. You will be involved in conducting research, developing timelines and monitoring budgets to help ensure accounts are running efficiently. You will also be responsible for liaising regularly with clients and handling their enquiries and requests. To be considered for this position you must have a strong science background coupled with solid med comms/med ed agency experience. title: Customer Loyalty Executive
description:
At Domestic and General we put customers at the heart of everything we do – by doing this it has enabled us to maintain our position as the UK’s leading warranty protection provider with a customer base in excess of 16 million!
 
As a key part of our new Customer Strategy function, this role will support the delivery of the operational plan for existing customer Renewals and Retention.
 
Key responsibilities will include:

Monitoring renewal performance and identifying trends
Support the delivery of key operational plans across our Retention campaigns
Ensure that key regulation is adhered to
Work collaboratively with other teams ensuring that they have the correct products available
Provide weekly updates to internal stakeholders highlighting trends and insights

 
The ideal candidate will have:

Drive to deliver on all targets, both customer and commercial
Be able to build effective relationships across all levels and business functions
Extremely high attention to detail
Good analytical and reporting skills
Strong MS Office skillset
Experience working in a fast-paced office environment
A degree (or equivalent level) qualification

 
In return, we are offering:

Salary up to £25,000 per annum
Life assurance
25 days holiday allowance, plus all bank holidays
50% employee discount on domestic appliance warranty protection
Great local employee discounts at shops, restaurants and gyms

Lead Brand & Marketing Manager - 1 year FTCLocation: GloucestershireSalary: £30,000 - £35,000 per annumKey Objectives & Job Scope:* To work collaboratively with brand, social media and account management colleagues along with relevantretailers and agencies to provide the marketing function across key brands both in the UK and InternationallyKey Accountabilities/Responsibilities:* Marketing Management: creation, development and execution of agreed marketing and brand plans on time and within budget for maximum impact, including...- helping to drive the yearly marketing calendar to meet commercial and creative brand objectives- daily management and development of the marketing team, encouraging continual improvement andimplementation of process for increased efficiency and transparency as the output is rapidly growing- oversight and execution of all marketing comms and retail driven promotional calendars (from digital, topress materials and POS), ensuring they accurately reflect the campaign direction and brand image- copywriting any required brand and press release material, maintaining accurate tone of voice- co-ordination of the social media function to ensure brand calendars are pulled together and scheduled in a timely fashion, guidelines are adhered to and budgets are effectively spent to meet brand objectives- maintenance and development of all brand websites and maximisation of opportunities availablethrough retailer platforms- working collaboratively and building strong relationships across departments, externally with brandstakeholders, agencies and retailers to ensure smooth running of comms and maximise all opportunities- compilation of engaging marketing presentations (from internal management reports to retailer decks),along with effective communication at key meetings to gain buy in on initiatives from key stakeholders- co-ordination and attendance at photo shoots as required to generate brand campaign assets- monthly reporting with comprehensive ROI analysis on both ongoing brand activity and key launches* PR & Events Management: co-ordination and management of brand and corporate launch events, PR events and trade shows to maximise return on investment, including...- timely event and PR plan creation and co-ordination for all brands- effective management of external agencies from pitch through to project fulfilment- identification and implementation of strategic media targets and brand partnerships- attendance at relevant events, ensuring smooth running and brand image portrayal- reporting with comprehensive ROI analysis on key activity* Brand Management: development of strategic and creative directions for new opportunities as well as existing brands including…- an excellent understanding of each brand, its key seasonal messages and tone of voice- maintaining broad and current awareness of relevant market and competitor trends to inform decisions- development of creative yet commercial new brand propositions (from gap analysis to customer profiling,product line-up and brand vision) brought to life through written and verbal presentations- management of internal and external stakeholders to deliver new brand propositions (including briefingproduct design, NPD development, packaging copywriting, proofing and sign off procedures…)* Budgetary Management: ongoing maintenance of marketing budgets and preparation of regular reports and evaluation of KPI's to demonstrate ROI on all marketing related activities and spendQualifications & Experience Requirements:* Marketing Related Degree or similar qualification/experience* Previous experience of brand marketing communications* Previous experience of corporate communications* Excellent project and event management skills* Excellent standard of English language and mathematically astute* Fully conversant with Microsoft Office, particularly Outlook, Word, Excel & Powerpoint* Working knowledge of website CMS, knowledge of Direct Mail comms beneficial* Experience within the beauty industry would be advantageousKey Competency Requirements:* Articulate* Creative & visionary* Methodical and analytical* Strong sense of commercial awareness* Capable of thriving in pressurised environments* Strong team player* Proven leadership skills* Excellent communication skills* Excellent understanding and passion for the beauty category and marketing trends* A creative, motivated individual with a self-start mentalityDue to the high volume of applications we receive it is not always possible to respond to unsuccessful applicants. Therefore if we have not responded to your application within five days please note that on this occasion your application has not been successfulAmbridge Harris is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Ambridge Harris will not discriminate on unlawful grounds.


Contact: Nicholas Wratten
        

Reference: Totaljobs/21579/002

Global Marketing ManagerThe position reports to the Group Managing Director. The role holds ultimate responsibility for the organisation’s marketing activities and oversees the development and delivery of a fully integrated marketing strategy for the business in order to drive sales revenue. The role will be a pivotal leadership role within the business steering the compass for the overall group strategy and brands.Strategic Marketing/Business Development· Design marketing plans for new products within relevant market sectors and ensure that this is communicated effectively to internal customers. Ensure that the implementation schedule is met and deadlines adhered to.· Direct involvement with new product launches to ensure that marketing aims are clear and implemented into the launch strategy. To take the same approach to product modifications, for particular market requirements· Develop OEM Marketing campaigns dealing directly with the OEM that have significant impact at a strategic level.· Develops and implements strategic and international marketing plans.· Responsibility for the distribution elements of the business and developing marketing strategies accordingly.· The role will be required to visit customers to inform marketing strategies and then communicate this to the wider team to implement.· Developing and imparting an understanding throughout the business, of the varying strategies required for each product and market sector.· Ensure maximum market impact and sales lead generation. Strategies to be co-ordinated with technical objectives, production objectives, sales aim and financial targets.· Required to coordinate and feed into the group business development strategy· Establish competitive positioning and market requirements for business growth.· Develop the company’s digital strategy taking overall responsibility for the management of the corporate website and social mediaEducation· Degree educated in a business (heavily marketing related) or marketing degreeExperience and skills· At least 7 years’ experience in marketing, preferably in a similar position· Demonstrate experience developing marketing strategies at a group and international level· Experience of managing and producing the roadmap for CRM· Exceptional copy writing skillsPersonal Competencies· An excellent multi tasker· An exceptional attention to detail· Highly developed leadership qualities· Highly creative· Strategic thinker· Strong communicator· Excellent planning and organisation skills· Confident presenter· Team player and ability to engage with all levels of personnel both internally and externally· Strong all round business sense and commercial awareness

title: Amazon - eCommerce Marketing and Content Manager
description:
About Exertis UnlimitedExertis Unlimited, part of the Exertis group of companies, is Europe's #1 brand-building distributor, developing and supplying best-in-class products and accessories across the Gadgets & Technology, Premium Audio and Creative Professional sectors.Exertis Unlimited also offers full-service E-commerce and Marketing agencies, able to provide a wide array of content marketing, demand generation and fulfilment services. From channel communications to PR services to an online advertising team with Google Partner status, we're able to offer more to our partners than any other distributor.About the roleThe eCommerce team is a new and exciting division of Exertis Unlimited and the wider group. The team is responsible for everything from logistics through to marketing for a wide portfolio of both 1st and 3rd party brands.Here, we are looking for a very strong candidate with hands on experience across as wide a range of channels as possible - with a slight bias towards the display and search network space. To be successful in this role you will require a high level of technical proficiency combined with knowledge of the limitations of the technology crossed with the ability to break down complex ideas and technologies to less technically minded contacts internally and externally. You will be acting as a digital ambassador to the company.As the eCommerce Marketing & Content Manager, you will be responsible for the strategy, planning and of various types of campaigns and channels - from Amazon Marketing Services through to SEO. Some of the things we'd like you to do:*Effectively execute and optimise campaigns as needed.*Proactively source new campaign ideas.*Report and analyse campaigns on a weekly and monthly basis.*Communicate both internally and externally as required around new campaigns/ideas/performance.*Keep abreast with all the latest industry trends.A bit about yourself:Required:*Likely to have 5+ years' of digital experience, gained either at an agency or client side or both.*Display:oGood working knowledge of and experience with running display and video campaigns via GDNoDetailed knowledge of ad serving solutions - e.g. DCM (DFA), MediaMind, etcoWorking knowledge of DSP platforms (e.g. DBM, TubeMogul, AppNexus).*Social:oGood knowledge of paid social on both Facebook and Twitter.oAdvanced techniques such as remarketing lists, similar audiences and split testing.oExtensive experience with planning and running paid social activity on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram either directly or via third party platforms.*Search - Experienced in running Adwords campaigns.*Good organisational skills and high attention to detail, with an understanding of optimisation levers & testing approaches across biddable platforms*Able to identify key opportunities to innovate, displaying inventiveness and willingness to challenge existing standards*Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, are particularly important in building & developing client and supplier relationships. The ability to think on your feet, present well, and to be creative and talk about a wide variety of complex issues.*Strong analytical skills and a natural affinity for numbers is key; You must be able to analyse raw data, draw insights and develop actionable recommendations as needed*A self-starter with lots of initiative, motivation and a drive to succeed; you will get plenty of support but the ability to manage your own workload and identify ways to improve this is crucial*Adaptability, able to flex working style with different situations*A passion for everything digital, with an active interest and understanding of online advertising industry trends.*Strong mind for the technical side of projects - able to trouble shoot and query technical issues such as problems with onsite pixels etc.*Fully Google partner qualified or as a minimum ready to sit the exams (we have Google partner status, so the successful candidate must be ready to sit the exam so we can maintain our status going forward.)Desirable*Line management experience.*Detailed knowledge of challenges for mobile & video in programmatic.*Experience with data integration projects - e.g. API, DMP, Analytics, etc*Experience with implementation of online attitudinal studies in programmatic/biddable - e.g. Dimestore, GCS, YouTube Brand Lift, etc.*Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookups, etc)*Experience with Google Analytics (plus certification)*Experience with Amazon Marketing Services*Experience with running campaigns across multiple countries / languagesIf you are interested in the position and think you are suitable, please apply directly to this job advert in the first instance. Consultant - Priya SachaniaContact no - 01782558165 Adecco is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. The Adecco Group UK & Ireland is an Equal Opportunities Employer.
    


Contact: Racheal Bailey
        

Reference: Totaljobs/EXAMAZON
        

Job ID: 74083706

        Marketing Project Manager - contract, Newmarket - This leading organisation based in the heart of Suffolk are looking to recruit a Marketing Project Manager initially on a 9 month contractual basis. Ideally educated to degree level you will have at least 4 years Project management experience and be used to working in a fast paced, friendly, yet energetic team. With strong management experience, this role requires someone who is highly organised and has a solid understanding of both on and offline marketing. Reporting to and working closely with the Head of Marketing, this role will see you working on a number of business critical projects. This role is crucial to ensuring that all department campaigns, through both digital and traditional methods are being produced on time and to the set budget. Similarly, you will be required to have significant involvement in the company's marketing strategy, analysing current marketing activity and response rates and recommending improvements. This is an exciting role for the business, as a growing organisation, the company is going through an exciting period although initially a 9 month contract there is every potential that this role could be extended. This company are dedicated to success, and they'll provide the same dedication to ensuring that you succeed in your new role! If it's sounding good so far, take the time to submit an application. This is a company that can really take you places!This role would be most applicable to candidates travelling from areas of Suffolk and the wider region, including Bury St Edmunds, Hawstead, Thurston, Langham, Mildenhall, Barningham, Elveden, Thetford, Elmswell, Lakenheath and Newmarket.For registration purposes, please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days, please assume that your application has not been successful.

title: Web Content Manager (Welsh Speaking)
description:
A highly respected organisation.Ability to lead projects.Excellent salary and benefits package.This is a rare opportunity for a talented, Welsh speaking Web Producer to join a prestigious and long-standing Cardiff based organisation. What you'll be doingThis is an extremely varied role that will have you being responsible for a wide range of tasks, such as the planning, creation and delivery of Welsh content to ensure a high user experience. You will review Welsh language content for accuracy, and therefore you will need to be a fluent Welsh speaker. You will look at the content design and web quality to ensure the consistency of the brand and tone of voice, suggesting and implementing changes where appropriate. You will also represent the department in liaisons with stakeholders and the wider marketing and comms community within the organisation. You will be on-hand to solve issues when called upon, and be confident in managing small-scale projects. What experience you'll need to applyBe a fluent Welsh speaker, with either a postgraduate or professional qualification, or equivalent experience in the languageDemonstrable experience in working within a Welsh speaking environment - ideally within digital commsExcellent writing abilityA background in the education sector would be desirable but not essentialWhat you'll get in return for your experienceYou'll have the opportunity to lead on the digital communications, and will be rewarded with a generous salary dependent on your previous experience alongside a highly competitive benefits package. All of this can be discussed on application. What's next?Please get in touch with Stacey together with a copy of your CV. Only fluent Welsh speakers will be considered for this role due to the requirements. The closing date for this role is Monday 22nd May, so if you're interested, you are encourged to apply ASAP.

description:
Product Manager - FMCG
	








, 






Competitive salary + pension










Permanent


Reposted 37 days ago


























Product Manager – FMCGCompetitive salary + pension Irvine, ScotlandFirmly established in Scotland, my client is a major force in the provision of contract filling, branded and own label aerosol products for the Health & Beauty sector, one of the fastest growing areas in the FMCG marketplace. Multi million pound investment has enabled them to develop a purpose built manufacturing facility and state of the art laboratories that are considered to be one of the finest in Europe. The investment in modern plant and equipment will continue to ensure that NPD is at the heart of the business to service the needs of existing and evolving markets. Expansion has resulted in a newly created role for a talented Product Manager. Reporting to the Managing Director, you will be based at the company head office in Irvine, Ayrshire. Working in a friendly, hardworking team of three Product/Senior Product Managers, your key responsibilities will see you: ·Implement marketing strategies and manage a specific product portfolio within agreed budgets to meet the Group’s strategic objectives·Aid development of key customers/agents through the effective planning and implementation of the marketing strategies·Drive and deliver cost effective programmes for the successful implementation of new product development·Identify the opportunities to launch new products or range extensions with existing and new customers/agents·Establish a rapport and build confidence within the Group through effective communication with colleaguesIdeally, you will be educated to degree level with a Business or Marketing degree, however candidates with a strong relevant marketing background will also be considered. Your experience will have been gained within the FMCG, Beauty, Toiletries Food & Drink or any other fast moving sector. It is essential that you have worked on multiple projects and that you are not fazed whilst working to tight, changing deadlines. You will also have had customer facing experience including the delivery of client presentations. First class IT, organisational and prioritisation skills are essential together with outstanding verbal and written communication skills. You should have a flexible attitude and although good team playing skills are required, you must be comfortable working autonomously. This exciting, varied and challenging role will enable you to further develop your career in the fast moving, friendly and hard working environment of this dynamic company.

title: Sales Agent - Direct Sales with RAC
description:
SELF EMPLOYED opportunity  80% Commission UNCAPPED EARNINGSExcellent earnings £50k ++ At RAC we are looking to recruit high calibre sales driven individuals.The truth is that every day is different. You`ll be meeting different people in different locations, in different types of weather - so, ultimately, it`s about your personality and perseverance, as well as our products and brand profile. We offer you range of market leading breakdown and insurance products to sell under, our trademark umbrella at high footfall venues, and the ability to earn market leading commissions per sale.You will be target and goal orientated with the ability to connect with the general public, close sales and have the drive and ambition to succeed.To maximise the potential of this opportunity, you will be resilient with a high work ethic and commit your time and minimal investment. title: Social Media Manager
description:

Experienced in both Organic and Paid Social Media strategies and campaigns whilst being commercially minded? Then this is the role for you!Forward Role have partnered with a retail business based in the heart of Lancashire, who are one of the fastest growing businesses in the North West and have continued aggressive expansion plans across their three luxury and premium travel brands. Due to rapid growth and success means they need a Social Media Manager to join their expanding marketing and digital team. You will be joining passionate and highly motivated teams, so will need to manage your time well and hit tough deadlines.Role and ResponsibilitiesDefine and implement the overall social media marketing strategy for each brand ensuring relevance to their audiences and alignment with each brand’s overall strategyBuild and execute calendar of activity covering social advertising, content development, remarketing and e-mail sign up to meet specific sign up and lead generation objectivesIdentify new opportunities in social media, test them effectively and build business cases for roll outWork with the offline and broader digital marketing teams to amplify marketing activity in the social arenaDevelop a social media KPI dashboard. Produce monthly KPI reports identifying areas of improvementDefine and effectively manage the social budget reporting ROI on a monthly basisReview competitor social marketing activity and identify opportunitiesManage and develop the Social Media Marketing ExecutiveSkills and Experience:Proven success in social media, especially Facebook, with strong delivery on ROIIn depth knowledge and understanding of social media platforms and how to exploit them to deliver different marketing objectivesExcellent communication skills - both written and verbalStrong organizational skills and ability to prioritise across multiple brands and projectsAbility to work as part of a broader teamCreative and innovative approachApply now to be considered for this role today!         PPC Executive, Borehamwood - An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced PPC Executive to join a leading consumer business. With at least 1-2 years' experience working on sizeable PPC accounts, you will be confident working across a number of paid media platforms and analytics programs. You will also have a strong working proficiency in SEO, affiliate marketing and database management. Ideally, you will be educated to degree level and a Google Certified digital marketer, with experience working in a consumer-facing environment. As PPC Executive, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management of all paid search campaigns, ensuring that all campaigns are effectively optimised against ROI. You will analyse and report on all PPC campaigns and activity, using Google Analytics to gain insight and including your personal recommendations for future improvements. Using your SEO experience, you will ensure all website content is optimised for search engine rankings and ensure the company ranks highly across a number of key search terms. This hands-on role is perfect for someone with experience in all aspects of digital marketing, experience of PPC, SEO, social media and affiliate marketing would be extremely beneficial in this role. A passionate digital marketer, you will be aware of all the latest innovations and trends within the industry and constantly suggesting new and innovative opportunities for the company. If you are an enthusiastic and motivated digital marketer looking to take the next step in your career within an industry-leading consumer business, then this could be the opportunity you've been looking for!Due to the location of their offices, this role is commutable from Borehamwood, Watford, Potters Bar, Welwyn Garden City, Hatfield, Edgware, Barnet, St Albans, Hemel Hempstead, Enfield, Rickmansworth, Cheshunt and Woodford.For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.

title: Product Manager - FMCG
description:
Product Manager - FMCG
	








, 






Competitive salary + pension










Permanent


Reposted 37 days ago


























Product Manager – FMCGCompetitive salary + pension Irvine, ScotlandFirmly established in Scotland, my client is a major force in the provision of contract filling, branded and own label aerosol products for the Health & Beauty sector, one of the fastest growing areas in the FMCG marketplace. Multi million pound investment has enabled them to develop a purpose built manufacturing facility and state of the art laboratories that are considered to be one of the finest in Europe. The investment in modern plant and equipment will continue to ensure that NPD is at the heart of the business to service the needs of existing and evolving markets. Expansion has resulted in a newly created role for a talented Product Manager. Reporting to the Managing Director, you will be based at the company head office in Irvine, Ayrshire. Working in a friendly, hardworking team of three Product/Senior Product Managers, your key responsibilities will see you: ·Implement marketing strategies and manage a specific product portfolio within agreed budgets to meet the Group’s strategic objectives·Aid development of key customers/agents through the effective planning and implementation of the marketing strategies·Drive and deliver cost effective programmes for the successful implementation of new product development·Identify the opportunities to launch new products or range extensions with existing and new customers/agents·Establish a rapport and build confidence within the Group through effective communication with colleaguesIdeally, you will be educated to degree level with a Business or Marketing degree, however candidates with a strong relevant marketing background will also be considered. Your experience will have been gained within the FMCG, Beauty, Toiletries Food & Drink or any other fast moving sector. It is essential that you have worked on multiple projects and that you are not fazed whilst working to tight, changing deadlines. You will also have had customer facing experience including the delivery of client presentations. First class IT, organisational and prioritisation skills are essential together with outstanding verbal and written communication skills. You should have a flexible attitude and although good team playing skills are required, you must be comfortable working autonomously. This exciting, varied and challenging role will enable you to further develop your career in the fast moving, friendly and hard working environment of this dynamic company.

title: Recruitment & Events Coordinator
description:
Here at Retail Profiling we have been specialising in providing field marketing support to Consumer Electronics Brands for 22 years. We manage sales and marketing activities through our field-based teams to increase the sales of our client’s products through promotion, demonstration and training of sales teams in Retailers such as PCWorld, Maplin and John Lewis.Due to the expansion of the Demonstration and in-store Promoter side of our business, we are seeking a Recruitment & Events Coordinator to take responsibility for co-ordinating our Clients demonstration campaign and event activities. This will involve recruiting, planning and project managing a UK-wide team of Promotor’s who will undertake activities such as providing in-store demonstrations directly to customers within large retail stores across the country at peak retail times, such as weekends and during holiday seasons. It will also involve analysing and reporting back to the Client the outcome of each campaign or event.The role will form part of the client management team and will report to the Senior Client Manager. As part of the client team, the role will involve working closely with the client manager’s, supporting with administrative duties as required.You will need to demonstrate exceptional organisational skills, be proactive, and capable of working independently as well as within a wider team. You must have excellent communication and presentation skills (both verbal and non-verbal) and have the ability and drive to make each campaign a success for our clients. You must be able to work to tight deadlines, manage busy workloads and have the ability to adapt to different ways of working as and when needed, showing versatility and adaptability to changing demands, sometimes on a daily basis. You will also be required to attend weekly Op’s team meetings to discuss workload and collaborate on team responsibilities and activities. An ability to use Microsoft office including, Outlook, Word, Excel and Powerpoint is also essential.This is a full-time role (40 hours/week) which will involve some travel across the UK, as well as working weekends and Bank Holidays particularly during peak times. This is a new role and therefore for the right candidate is an exciting opportunity to grow with the business and be involved in the growth of this area within our business.The package includes a basic salary of £19k - £20K, dependent upon experience.As well as a great basic salary we also offer a generous package including: ·33 days holiday (including bank holidays) ·Pension scheme ·Company profit and personal performance bonus schemesPlease note due to the high volume of applications for this position, if you do not here from us within 28 days, please assume that on this occasion your application has been unsuccessful.

Reference: Totaljobs/CEC

Indirect Marketing Procurement Manager - Global FMCG Firm - Career Progression - London Office - £50,000 - £60,000 + Package One of the largest organisations in the world, this leading FMCG firm is looking to hire a talented Indirect Marketing Manager to join their dynamic Procurement Function. Liaising directly with the Head of Procurement and managing spends of over £200Million, the successful candidate can look forward to excellent career progression opportunities in this industry-leading organisation.Indirect Marketing Procurement Manager Role:Creating innovative sourcing strategies to deliver outstanding cost savings and best value across the Marketing Procurement categoryInteracting with key stakeholders to understand the business needs and ensure Procurement best practice is delivered whilst meeting and exceeding stakeholder expectationsManaging key supplier relationships whilst continually reassessing the supplier contracts to ensure the most commercially successful terms are in placeEngaging on key procurement activities across the Indirect Categories, including but not limited to; strategic sourcing, contract negotiations and tender processesRequirements for Indirect Marketing Procurement Manager:Experience across the full Procurement process, ideally within a Blue Chip/FMCG environment, including contract negotiation and managementA CV demonstrating superior cost savings achieved across the Marketing Procurement Category through strategic Procurement activitiesExcellent Stakeholder Relationship Management skills; a strong negotiator able to interact across all seniority levels internally and externallyMinimum 2:1 degree (or equivalent) required, CIPS preferredThis incredible opportunity will launch the successful candidate into a fast-paced, global career, managing the full Marketing Procurement spend for this £Multi-Billion organisation. description:

title: Content & Social Media Manager
description:
THE COMPANY:Brewster Pratap are working in partnership with our client to recruit a Content and Social Media Manager to join a growing digital marketing team at one of the nation's best loved retailers. The role would suit a Content Manager, Social Media Manager, Content & Media Manager, Digital Content Manager or other content professional looking for a new challenge and able to commute to Central London, with frequent travel to the Nottinghamshire head office. THE JOBIt’s not often you get the chance to develop a new business within a business, that’s already over 20,000 people strong. And it’s even rarer to do so at the start of one of the most exciting digital transformations in retail. At this business, it’s all going on. They are growing their digital offering, digital team, and the skills and careers of ambitious digital professionals with the passion, initiative and drive to get stuff done. Lots of stuff.With a huge digital strategy already largely in place, it’s your chance to help shape what comes next and put your name to high profile work that will be seen by millions. As Content & Social Manager, you’ll love talking - and getting customers involved in the conversation. Managing content production across all digital channels, it’s your chance to be a voice for the brand in all sorts of ways. We’re looking for a Content & Social Manager who can manage the blog and content plan, co-ordinate the studio to produce digital content, make the most of existing content across digital channels and handle the production of digital marketing content and copy. You’ll even manage and report on the performance of the social media strategy, social output, social media agency and line manage a Social Media Executive.Areas of responsibility will include:·Managing the company blog·Co-ordinating design studio and above the line production with digital content·Managing the production of digital marketing content and copy·Managing the social media strategy, including co-ordinating social media with other marketing channels·Managing the social media agency relationship and high spend budget – ensuring the company receive maximum value from the budget and that activity is adequately reported·Working with the agency to plan and execute daily social media activity·Using content on social media to drive SEO·Re-address content marketing strategies·Aligning content to the trading plan across the business·Developing and executing a cross platform content plan, utilising content across all online channels·Measuring and reporting on the performance of social activity·Proactively identify new opportunities for social media marketingTHE PERSON:To join this well-known brand at such an exciting time as Content & Social Manager, you’ll need to be on top of social media platforms and reporting tools, able to spot opportunities for social marketing and experienced in managing content and social media programmes for an online business. You’ll also need to confidently commission and produce marketing content, and provide direction on design and copy as you make sure the exciting brand story is told, loud and clear. Familiarity with social media platforms and reporting tolls is essential, and the ability to commission and also produce engaging marketing content including design and copy direction.Please note this role will involve weekly travel to the company headquarters in Worksop, Nottinghamshire.THE BENEFITS:Competitive benefits package including 25 days holiday + 8 bank holidaysStaff discount schemeMobile phone and laptopDiscounted private healthcareContributory pension schemeCentral London locationBrewster Pratap Recruitment Group focuses on the recruitment of talent in South Yorkshire, West Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, East Yorkshire, Lincolnshire and Nottinghamshire. If you are interested in discussing this job in more detail or any other aspect of recruitment and talent identification we would really like to hear from you. Please visit our website at www.brewsterpratap.co.uk for more information on Jobs or Recruitment.


Contact: Lucy Wood
        

Reference: Totaljobs/LW/CONTSMWSP

title: Social Media Manager
description:
A fantastic leading digital agency based in the heart of Leeds with numerous awards under their belt are looking for an experienced Social Media Manager to join their growing team.The role is primarily to devise compelling insight led social media strategies and tactical plans for the agencies current and future clients. As a Senior member of the team you will be expected to lead on the generation of strategic pillars and audience insights that underpin all social media strategies and campaigns, contribute to campaign creative direction and have primary responsibility for the delivery and success of insight led strategies. The Role:·To be the social media specialist within the content and communications team.·Responsible for briefing and working closely with the data team, to ensure that insights are presented in a understandable way to clients.·Support Senior Campaign Managers to create social media strategies and have the ability to plan activity and campaigns.·Social media advertising reports.·Tracking and reporting: UTM tracking, behavioural retargeting, google analytics/analysis.·Attend pitches, support the strategists and seniors within the team as well as training and support for junior members of the team.The Person:·Knowledge of all major social media platforms and their application within a social media/digital marketing environment and responsibility for keeping individual and team knowledge up to date with the latest trends.·understand strategies and plan activity which works towards the defined KPIs.·To be passionate about the discipline of social media.·Working knowledge of major social media advertising platforms, including; Facebook business manager and Twitter ads dashboard.·Basic understanding (or willingness to learn) the technical application of major social media platforms: Facebook Opengraph, twitter card data, API capabilities/firehose permissions, competition rules ad regulations.·A strategic and analytical mindset.This job is commutable from Leeds, Bradford, Harrogate, York and Surrounding areas.MET Marketing is acting as an employment agency in relation to this Social Media Manager Marketing role.
