        Online Marketing Manager, Chelmsford - An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced affiliate marketer to join this leading consumer brand, based in their Essex offices. With at least 3 years' online marketing experience under your belt, you will have proven experience implementing affiliate programs and digital marketing campaigns. You will be a passionate, innovative and driven online marketer, looking for a new challenge within a hugely successful, fast-moving leisure business. This position would suit someone with a proven track record in online marketing, who has had experience in a consumer facing role and is commercially aware.As Online Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for evaluating the success of all affiliate and online marketing programs in order to drive and grow the business across all online channels. Using your excellent analytical skills, you will analyse the effectiveness of all online campaigns and recommend improvements for future development and growth. An effective and persuasive communicator, you will foster and develop relationships with key affiliate partners in order to maximise the affiliate program. You will be managing online marketing campaigns both in the UK and internationally, so will need to have a knowledge of online marketing in other territories.This is a fantastic opportunity for an ambitious online marketer looking to develop their career within a rapidly-expanding and booming consumer business. Due to the location of their offices, this role is commutable from Chelmsford, Colchester, Braintree, Sudbury, Ipswich, Clacton, Stowmarket, Bury St Edmunds, Bishop's Stortford, Harlow, Basildon and Southend-on-sea. For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.

title: Client Service Manager
description:
Here at Retail Profiling we have been specialising in providing field marketing support to Consumer Electronics Brands for 22 years. We manage sales and marketing activities through our field-based teams to increase the sales of our client’s products through promotion, demonstration and training of sales teams in Retailers such as PCWorld, Maplin and John Lewis, as well as in reseller environments and at large consumer electronic events.We are seeking a Client Service Manager, working as part of our client service team, to take responsibility for supporting our client accounts by working together with a variety of departments across the business to deliver an exceptional service to our clients first time, every time.The role involves supporting our client accounts through project managing our client’s field marketing campaigns, coordinating logistics and events, as well as analysing results and reporting back to our clients on our results. Dependant on client specific requirements, this role can vary on a daily basis with considerable opportunities and challenges along the way. You will be the first point of contact for your own client list and therefore you must quickly develop your understanding of our clients’ needs as well as being a capable relationship builder with an ability to work under pressure. You must have exceptional organisational skills, be proactive, driven and client focussed, with the ability to write commercially sound client reports that demonstrate the service we have delivered. You should also be able to understand the importance of client budgets and spend. You must also be proficient in the use of Microsoft office including, Outlook, Word, Excel and Power Point.This is a full-time role, primarily based at our HQ on the beautiful Aske Country estate near Richmond, but with fairly regular travel to client meetings and events across the UK, including some overnights. This is a fantastic opportunity for an ambitious individual looking to develop their career and join an established company at an exciting growth time.The basic salary range is £22,000-24,000 per annum, dependent upon experience.As well as a great basic salary we also offer a generous package including:·Company profit and personal performance bonus schemes·Smart phone and laptop·25 days holiday, plus bank holidays·Pension schemePlease note due to the high volume of applications for this position, if you do not here from us within 28 days, please assume that on this occasion your application has been unsuccessful.


Contact: HR Team
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CDM
        

Job ID: 74092000

title: Account Manager - Corporate Comms - Major Clients
description:
A global communications agency is looking for a self-starter with excellent corporate communications credentials for an Account Manager opportunity within its team in London. This agency has a fantastic reputation within the industry and boasts a truly impressive client portfolio featuring world-leading brands. You will be a day-to-day client contact on assigned accounts and will be responsible for coordinating and managing the delivery of campaign activity. You will be involved in devising strategies and developing ideas and will be responsible for establishing and managing relationships with key media contacts. You will help to manage and support junior colleagues and will be responsible for producing high quality press materials and reporting to clients on activity. You will also lead on executing digital campaigns in-line with the client objectives and will be expected to advise clients on digital learnings.To be considered for this position you must have a solid background in corporate comms with experience of working on high profile clients. In addition, you must have a sound understanding of how the media operates along with an eye for spotting opportunities and a knack for pitching into the media. Previous agency experience is essential. For this and similar vacancies, please contact Suzanna Hesketh on 020 7788 4343 Account Manager, PR Account Manager, Senior Account Executive, PR Senior Account Executive, Senior Account Manager, PR Senior Account Manager, Corporate Communications, Corporate Comms, Corp Comms, PR, Public Relations, London. description:
Account Manager
	









Cassington, Witney (OX29), OX29 4SX






Show my commute time






Enter your postcode

Reposted yesterday


























Account ManagerTorpedo is an established and award winning creative agency based near Oxford with an impressive list of clients. We’re looking for an experienced and highly capable Account Manager to join our team. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a talented, creative and friendly team working within a converted barn on a varied range of exciting marketing campaigns and digital projects. Account Manager Role & responsibilities Work closely with clients to develop an in-depth understanding of their business, products and marketing objectives. Recommend, plan and deliver dynamic integrated marketing programs across both online and off-line channels.Manage projects to ensure they are delivered on time and to budget. Be involved at all stages of the creative process. Take responsibility for day-to-day client relationships and support the Account Director in ensuring client satisfaction, retention and growth. Liaise closely with the internal design and digital teams plus external suppliers. Work to tight deadlines whilst providing clients with exceptional service at all times. Technical skills & experience A creative thinker, able to plan, manage and implement marketing initiatives and campaigns across print and digital channels. Proven experience of project managing multiple projects within tight timescales. A confident, can-do attitude with excellent communication and presentation skills. Good commercial acumen. An organised approach with excellent attention to detail. Personable, approachable and able to inspire confidence. Previous experience in a marketing, creative or digital agency, or other marketing role.Experience of working in the technology, software or pharmaceutical sectors preferred but not essential. Graphic designers seeking to move to an Account Management position are also encouraged to apply.Company descriptionTorpedo is a digitally integrated creative agency. We offer a competitive salary negotiable depending on experience and a wide range of benefits including:Modern agency environment with high-spec Macs / laptops and dual-screens.Excellent location with free parking.22 days holiday (increasing to 25 days after 2 years service) + public holidays.Pension scheme.Private healthcare (after successful completion of the probationary period).Dental insurance (after successful completion of the probationary period).Conferences and training.Breakout area with large TV and games.Sonos sound system with shared playlist.Use of on-site swimming pool and tennis court.Discounted gym membership.Free fruit in the office every week.Free tea and coffee.Free pick ’n’ mix sweets.Childcare vouchers.Cycle to work bike scheme.Free annual flu vaccination.Cakes on your birthday.Regular social events, meals out and a big summer party.


Contact: Rachael Webster
        

Reference: Totaljobs
        

Job ID: 67805114

title: Medical Writer
description:
Medical Writer
	









Cassington, Witney (OX29), OX29 4SX






Show my commute time






Enter your postcode




Go

Reposted yesterday


























Medical Writer Torpedo is an award winning creative agency based near Oxford with an impressive list of clients. We’re growing rapidly and looking for an experienced Medical Writer to work within our pharmaceutical / healthcare team. Take a look at our website and you’ll see we’re not your traditional medcoms agency. At Torpedo we work across many sectors, but our focus is on technology and healthcare. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly talented, creative and friendly team working within a converted barn on a varied range of exciting marketing campaigns, creative and digital projects. We already work with some big healthcare brands and have done for over 10 years. The opportunity is huge and we’re looking for a capable Medical Writer with agency experience of working across medical education, promotional and consumer awareness materials. You’ll have a proven track record in medical communications with the ability to co-ordinate the delivery of editorial projects and to provide scientific excellence across a number of accounts and therapy areas. Medical Writer Role & responsibilities Work closely with our account management team and healthcare / pharmaceutical clients to develop an in-depth understanding of our clients’ businesses, products and marketing objectives. Lead healthcare and pharmaceutical projects from a scientific and content perspective. Undertake research, appraise, interpret and cite published information to develop credible and accurate marketing collateral. Write, edit and proof high quality content for medical education, promotional and awareness materials, including sales aids, leave pieces, websites, direct mail, adverts, posters, monographs, videos and events. Undertake editorial reviews and QC checks on healthcare and pharmaceutical projects. Assist with managing projects from brief to delivery. Be actively involved at all stages of the project and liaise closely with the internal design and digital teams to set the standard and maintain consistency. Work to tight deadlines whilst providing clients with exceptional service at all times. Technical skills & experience Excellent English language written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to write content for online and offline medical education, promotional and consumer awareness projects. A relevant life science degree. Ability to adapt editorial style, tone-of-voice and content for different types of collateral and audiences. Competent in understanding, interpreting and citing scientific papers. A creative thinker, able to interpret data and develop an engaging story. An excellent understanding of ABPI and EFPIA Codes. Proven experience of working on multiple projects within tight timescales. Previous experience in a medcomms or medical writing agency. Personable and confident in front of clients. Experience with Zinc or other similar approval system. A positive, can-do attitude. An organised approach with excellent attention to detail. Company descriptionTorpedo is a digitally integrated creative agency. We offer a competitive salary negotiable depending on experience and a wide range of benefits including:Modern agency environment with high-spec Macs / laptops and dual-screens.Excellent location with free parking.25 days holiday + public holidays (Increasing to 28 days after 5 years).Pension scheme.Private healthcare (after successful completion of the probationary period).Dental insurance (after successful completion of the probationary period).Conferences and training.Breakout area with large TV and games.Sonos sound system with shared playlist.Use of on-site swimming pool and tennis court.Discounted gym membership.Free fruit in the office every week.Free tea and coffee.Free pick ’n’ mix sweets.Childcare vouchers.Cycle to work bike scheme.Free annual flu vaccination.Cakes on your birthday.Regular social events, meals out and a big summer party.

title: Apprentice Website / Multi Media / Marketing Assistant
description:
This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to kick-start their career as an Apprentice in a growing business  Apply Now!  
Work, Earn and Learn!  
If you can’t wait to get started in your chosen career, and don’t want to choose between gaining qualifications and earning a salary, an Apprenticeship with Lancaster and Morecambe College offers you the best of both worlds! Apprenticeships give you all the experience you need to move your career forward, and better prospects for the future.
The Role:  
Apprentice Website / Multi Media / Marketing Assistant
We are looking for a new individual to join our team to focus on maintaining our company websites and set up social media such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram etc. to show product launches and promotional items.
We are looking for the team member to improve the appearance of our websites and also add to and maintain the sites.
Facebook and Twitter are a large part of our market however we have not yet got involved in this type of marketing until now.  We are excited to get our company involved.
Being an Apprentice means you will be employed and earn a salary whilst working towards a nationally recognised NVQ qualification at Level 2 or Level 3 and a technical certificate.
Your assessor will visit you in the workplace to observe you in your job role and to help you build a portfolio of evidence to prove your competence against industry standards.
You might attend College one day a week or on block release depending on your course. Your time in College will be to complete your assignments and study functional skills such as English, Maths and IT – which you will need for all jobs. As all our tutors are professionals in the fields they teach, they will be able to give you all the support and advice that you need.
Remember, it only takes a minute to apply for an Apprenticeship with Lancaster and Morecambe College and begin your future career with great prospects today!

title: Senior Account Executive – Entertainment and Lifestyle brands
description:
Hungry for a new challenge? Awesome Senior Account Executive required to work with instantly recognisable attractions brand portfolio & on lifestyle PR campaigns. Great scope with this new role as basically an in-house press office role within an agency environment!
Our client is an award winning PR agency that is going from strength to strength, with offices in London and elsewhere in the UK. Delivering integrated PR, social media and digital marketing services to an enviable roster of high profile FMCG, entertainment, video gaming, food & drink and lifestyle clients.  They are currently looking to add to their talented London based team at Senior Account Executive level.

A multitasker; able to juggle several activities at any one time in a busy PR environment
A great communicator; able to develop strong relationships with clients and media
Able to proactively create solutions for clients and know when to escalate up
A team player able to work collaborative with team members as well as independently
Keen to contribute to new business projects as part of a team
Experienced in press office & PR campaigns, ideally within a PR agency environment
Positive and passionate about your work and progressing your PR career

Successful candidates should have a real passion for PR; supporting their clients with excellence. Candidates will be smart and organised, with the ability to confidently manage several activities at any one time. First class interpersonal and communication skills will be essential to build effective relationships with clients, the media and internally.
This firm offer a great chance to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic agency working with some of the UK’s most exciting brands and initiatives. Plus they offer a competitive salary + benefits. If you feel you demonstrate the required skills and experience, please send your CV for consideration.

						Freelance Media & Comms Officer - charity - 6 weeks - ASAP start - £150 per day!

A dedicated and well-known children's charity is urgently searching for a Media & Communications Officer on a FREELANCE/TEMPORARY basis to join their vibrant London office. 

The charity: 
Based in Central London this well-known children's charity is based around providing children with independence and are all about positive thinking in their lives. The charity are all about providing life skills, equipment and support to children to enable them to fulfil their true potential in life. 

With that in mind the charity are searching for candidates that are truly passionate about the third sector and can join in in creating a defined and beautiful vision for the future of these children. 

The role: 
Based in London, this communications team are dedicated and cover all elements from media and communications. The role is about building support for the charity as well as raising awareness of what they do both for children's lives and in the community. Working closely with the Head of Communications you will support the development of the charity's PR and national marketing strategies and lead its implementation. 

Key Responsibilities: 
- Working closely with the fundraising team on all fundraising communications 
- Writing all press releases and news items promoting the charity 
- Liaising with corporate partners, trusts and Lotteries 
- Securing national and local press coverage 
- Provide media support to Events - identifying PR opportunities around key sports events 
- Working closely with the digital team to make a clear and defined integrated strategy


The candidate: 
- 2+ years in a PR or Communications role 
- Agency OR Clientside experience 
- Consumer or Third Sector Experience
- Experience dealing with proactive media relations work 
- Experience with fundraising 
- Very autonomous and happy to work on their own 

The client will pay £150 per day for this role so if you're keen and available to interview immediately and start on Monday 12th June let me know! Apply to this advert or send me your CV to michael.willman@majorplayers.co.uk

title: Global Communications Executive
description:
A leading, sector-focused law firm is looking for a Global Communication Executive to help implement a global PR and external communications strategy fit for a world class law firm. This is a new and exciting role that reports into the Global Communications Manager (External) suitable for an ambitious PR/communications professional who is looking for a broad global role that offers plenty of scope for growth and development.
Responsibilities

Support the senior global communications manager (external) and the team on the implementation of a global communications strategy and the metrics to evidence it.
Focus on building the firm's profile through the media, especially the business press.
Manage and schedule content for the firm's core corporate social media channels and drive the implementation of the firm's global social media strategy 
Maintain calendars of communications activity across the team
Work closely with other members of the communications team worldwide to ensure a joined up approach to external and internal communications and provide support on internal communications when needed 
The role is to broadly support the global communications team. The role-holder will draft and develop messaging for the firm; produce and share best practice materials; work with sector and practice groups to develop profile raising campaigns; and get involved in other projects as directed by the Global Communications Manager, Global Head of Communications or other Senior Communications leaders. This could include thought leadership, public affairs and marketing projects.

Key Competencies

Excellent communication skills: ability to write clearly, concisely and convey key messages is a must.
Strong organisational and project management skills and the ability to handle multiple priorities within tight timescales while maintaining high standards.
Team-spirited and collaborative, while being able to take the initiative and work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with all levels with confidence, positivity, diplomacy.
Able to work to very tight deadlines under pressure and to assimilate information quickly.
Positive, energetic and robust with the ability to pro-actively drive initiatives forward.
Demonstrates attention to detail with a high level of accuracy.

Requirements

Educated to degree level (2:1 or above) or possesses equivalent experience.
Experience in PR/social media; preferably in a professional services/business to business environment.
Demonstrable interest in current affairs, business, PR, the media and digital media.
Strong interest in and understanding of social media platforms and how to best utilise them for corporate purposes 
This is an external facing role, which requires a high degree of professionalism.

VMA Group is the global recruitment and training specialist for corporate and marketing communications.

VMA Group is committed to equal opportunities and is a Diversity Pledged Recruiter.

Digital Account Manager - Consumer
£35-40k + COM +Benefits
If you love lifestyle, fashion, music and entertainment brands then read on as this is the markets you will be selling within………
This role will be responsible for driving digital revenues across an agency group (Group M).  You will need to be creative and digital Savvy for this role!
You will be responsible for the day-to-day contact with the digital teams within the agency and evangelising around our clients digital proposition, delivering and exceeding on digital revenues.
The role will drive the digital revenues across all formats and platforms regardless of whether that is programmatic, standard display, mobile, instream or creative/content.
You will need to work collaboratively with the agency hubs and have regular 1:1 meetings to ensure we do not create confusion in the market.
Responsibilities 

Deliver and exceed digital revenue targets from that agency, taking full responsibility for the digital revenues.
Develop key relationships from Client Director level to Account Executive. Working with the digital AGD & Commercial Director where necessary to drive senior relationships.
Maintain and communicate an up to date plan for agency engagement.
Proactively pitch and maintain awareness of the companies digital portfolio.
Regularly meet and entertain agency contacts
Respond to all agency proposals in a comprehensive and timely/thorough manner. 
Accurately maintain weekly detail on revenue forecast of business & pipeline forecasts
Create and maintain sales collateral when necessary.

Other ad-hoc duties as required

Keep the digital team aware of developments in the digital market with competitor, advertiser and technology developments
Maintain a comprehensive knowledge of the entire digital advertising landscape.

Key Skills & Experience

Proven track record in digital sales predominately across display advertising.
Strong negotiation skills
Excellent communicator, experienced at delivering presentations to groups and 1:1
Self-motivated and proactive attitude
Competent at MS Office  - PowerPoint, Word and Excel
Attention to detail when putting proposals together
Flexible approach to working hours, to getting the job done

Our Client:
Cover multiple consumer sites that are well known for their cutting edge content and cool brands!  They offer excellent reward incentives and help create a bespoke training programme to help you advice in your career!
Great company, great role and a great chance to have a great summer!
Apply now:

Head of Marketing - Online & Offline Acquisition, Peteborough - A well-known consumer brand in the retail and ecommerce sector that has an instantly recognisable name is seeking a candidate to take on the role of Head of Marketing for Online & Offline Acquisition. The ideal candidate will ideally have extensive top level offline and online strategy experience for a large consumer focused retail organisation though non retail focused consumer brands may also be considered. Extensive team management exposure is a must as this role could have a team of 10+ direct reports, as is extensive top level stakeholder management skills. Candidates without 4/5 years' top level online & offline marketing strategy experience, and proven ability managing multi million pound budgets need not apply.The purpose of the role is to guide the effective acquisition of customers through both online and offline channels, the role will be top level strategic and not require any real hands on involvement in the day to day marketing, the real success will be the successful candidates ability to guide and empower the team to deliver. Team members will include brand, marketing, SEO, PPC, content, social and instore, and as such it's really key that applicants have experience of guiding team members across both digital and offline, candidates that cannot demonstrate considerable top level experience across both channels will not be considered.This is an excellent opportunity to work for a globally recognised organisation that is a market leader in its field and has an outstanding reputation. Due to the location of the office, this role could be of interest to those living in Peterborough, Huntingdon, St Neots, Wisbech, Stamford, Spalding, Northampton, Wellingborough and Cambridge. Although candidates could be based in London 2 days per week.For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online at http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.

This role would suit a confident person looking to make this role their own. You have a passion for marketing and data, and have a track record of delivering successful campaigns.  You also have initiative, think out of the box, and are not afraid to challenge the norm.

• As the only CRM professional within the business, you will have a fantastic opportunity to grow, develop and implement amazing strategies

• Maintain the database - ensuring marketing communications adhere to data protection laws.
• Produce reporting on all campaign activity.
• Manage a digital analyst
CRM  Manager - experience required
• Educated to degree level - a Marketing qualification would be preferable
• Strong experience in CRM role
• Solid email skills
• Passion for data
• Experience using a campaign management system / CRM platform
• Excellent communication skills, confident and result driven
• They type to make the role their own and that would enjoy working in an entrepreneurial environment

title: Account Director - Healthcare Advertising
description:
A highly reputable Healthcare Advertising agency is looking for an Account Director to join its team in West London. This is an exciting role with the opportunity to work on an interesting range of campaigns and projects for major pharmaceutical companies.  Key responsibilities of this position include: •	Planning and managing the delivery of client campaigns and projects•	Overseeing day-to-day activity and resourcing•	Managing budgets•	Managing client relationships and advising clients when necessary•	New business development To be considered for this position you must be a creatively-minded individual with solid healthcare advertising/comms agency experience. In addition, you must have excellent client handling skills and have the experience and skills to manage and support a team.  This role will involve some international travel.  For this and similar vacancies, please contact Gary Hoult on 020 7788 4343 or email gary@fresh-connect.co.uk   Account Director, Senior Account Manager, Senior Account Director, Healthcare Advertising, Healthcare Communications, Healthcare Comms, Pharmaceuticals, Pharma, London. title: Account Manager - Corporate Comms - Major Clients
description:
A global communications agency is looking for a self-starter with excellent corporate communications credentials for an Account Manager opportunity within its team in London. This agency has a fantastic reputation within the industry and boasts a truly impressive client portfolio featuring world-leading brands.  You will be a day-to-day client contact on assigned accounts and will be responsible for coordinating and managing the delivery of campaign activity. You will be involved in devising strategies and developing ideas and will be responsible for establishing and managing relationships with key media contacts. You will help to manage and support junior colleagues and will be responsible for producing high quality press materials and reporting to clients on activity. You will also lead on executing digital campaigns in-line with the client objectives and will be expected to advise clients on digital learnings. To be considered for this position you must have a solid background in corporate comms with experience of working on high profile clients. In addition, you must have a sound understanding of how the media operates along with an eye for spotting opportunities and a knack for pitching into the media. Previous agency experience is essential.  For this and similar vacancies, please contact Suzanna Hesketh on 020 7788 4343 or email suzanna@fresh-connect.co.uk  Account Manager, PR Account Manager, Senior Account Executive, PR Senior Account Executive, Senior Account Manager, PR Senior Account Manager, Corporate Communications, Corporate Comms, Corp Comms, PR, Public Relations, London. title: Principal Medical Writer - Medical Communications
description:
An independent Medical Communications agency has an opening for a Principal Medical Writer within its team based in London. You will play a key role in the development and delivery of a range of projects.  You will oversee the research and writing of complex written materials and will be responsible reviewing materials for quality and scientific accuracy. You will support the editorial team across projects whilst keeping a firm handle on timelines to ensure deadlines are adhered to. You will also be responsible for liaising directly with clients on assigned projects.  To be considered for this position you must have the following skills and experience: •	Solid medical writing experience gained from working in an agency•	Educated to degree level in a science-related subject•	Strong project management skills•	Excellent attention to detail For this and similar vacancies, please contact Gary Hoult on 020 7788 4343 or email gary@fresh-connect.co.uk  Principal Medical Writer, Senior Medical Writer, Medical Writer, Medical Editor, Medical Communications, Med Comms, Pharmaceuticals, Pharma, London. title: Project Officer – Environmental Charity
description:
This is an exciting new role for a Project Officer to support the development of the second-stage HLF application with the Programme Manager. You will engage with community groups, schools and local businesses to inform the final Activity Plan for the Delivery Phase of the project.
ROLE: Project Officer (Hidden Hastings Heritage) 
REF: SS07
LOCATION: Homebased with travel around Hastings
SALARY: £18,341 - £21,577 per annum
CONTRACT TYPE: Fixed term for 6 months with possible extension
OPERATIONAL AREA: Sussex & Surrey
Hidden Hastings Heritage is a new heritage project, funded by Heritage Lottery Fund and led by this charity, that will uncover and showcase the rich natural, archaeological and historical heritage within Hastings Country Park. The first phase of the project is the Development Phase, starting in May 2017 and due for completion in December 2017.

They are looking for a candidate with knowledge of and an interest in engaging local communities, schools and businesses with natural and social heritage through site visits, presentations, workshops, questionnaires and social media campaigns. You will have knowledge of using innovative tools and techniques to engage hard-to-reach groups.

The successful candidate will utilise their excellent communication skills and experience of designing and leading community engagement events and programmes to engage and excite local people with the project. Experience of working on HLF/ European funding bids and knowledge of compliance and reporting requirements is desirable.
This charity is committed to transforming people’s lives and places through social, economic and environmental action. In terms of development and delivery of these projects we work across three business themes, Parks & Open Spaces, Youth & Employment and Greener Living & Working.
In return they offer:

Life Assurance at four times annual salary*
25 days annual holiday, rising to 28 days after 2 years service and reaching 30 days after 4 years service
Payroll Giving*, Cycle to Work* and Childcare Voucher schemes are available on a salary sacrifice basis
A contributory pension scheme
Health Cash Plan*
Scope to continuing development of your professional skills

*Available after 6 months continuous service and successful completion of your probationary period.
Closing Date: 14 June 2017
Interview Date: 21 June 2017
Start Date: July 2017
APPLICATION PROCESS:
To find out more information and apply for this position, please click the apply button. You will be taken to a simple CHM Recruit form and then redirected to the employer’s website.
CVs will not be accepted. No agencies please. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Please note that we reserve the right to close applications early in the event of a large response.
This charity is committed to the employment and career development of disabled people. To demonstrate their commitment they have been awarded the Disability Confident Scheme Symbol, which is awarded by the Employment Service. They guarantee an interview to anyone with a disability whose application meets the essential criteria for the post. If you consider yourself to have a disability and would like to apply under the Guaranteed Interview Scheme please complete the Guaranteed Interview Scheme form (at the top of their current vacancies page) and submit this with your application. They shall ensure fairness and equal opportunities throughout their workforce and in service delivery.
They welcome applications from suitably skilled candidates regardless of ethnicity, gender, disability, sexuality, religion or age.

title: Head of Marketing and Communications
description:
Job description
Job title:                 Head of Marketing & Communications
Reporting to:          Director of Brand & Innovation
Department:            Marcomms
Our charity:
The Mix is an exciting new Brand that has had huge success with campaigns, media and events over the last 12 months. We are one of the eight charities forming the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harry’s Heads Together campaign to end stigma around mental health and will continue to work with them on raising awareness and providing vital help for people with mental health challenges. Some of our other partners include Dixons Carphone, River Island, Lloyds Banking Group, National Lottery, CHI & M/Six agencies.
We are a free, confidential information and support service for under 25s, making a massive difference to over 2 million young people’s lives in the UK each year.
Whatever issue a young person is facing, The Mix is always there for them - online, over the phone or via social media. It connects young people to experts and their peers to talk about everything from money to mental health, from homelessness to jobs, from break-ups to drugs.
Today’s young people face an unprecedented range of challenges. They are possibly the first generation worse off in physical and emotional terms than their parents. The Mix’s mission is to ensure that every young person can make informed choices about their wellbeing – wherever and whenever they are: 
With a fantastic team who are passionate about supporting young people, The Mix is an excellent environment to work in.
Our Values:
Empowering – we lead, we train & support, we respect, we give space to grow, we give power to chose
Brave – we innovate, we pioneer, we take risks, we tell it how it is
Supportive – we listen, we encourage, we care, we’re understanding, we are empathetic
Collaborative – we are open & transparent, we co-create, we respect experience & expertise
Proactive – we create situations, we make things happen, we get things done
Non-judgemental – we do not judge, we do not criticise, we do not blame
Overall purpose of the job
Extend the reach of and interaction with The Mix’s services across digital platforms amongst 25 year olds and under in the UK through SEO, social and widgets. To lead and manage the reputation of the Charity and its services with key target audiences, building positive awareness, managing potential risk and supporting the Charity’s strategic aims. Work with the Research and Insights Team to deliver sector-leading, innovative research, marketing and PR functions.
Work with the Content Team to ensure The Mix’s website and content is on brand and suitable for all digital channels including: creating, managing and monitoring content; editing; commissioning and producing content; driving and monitoring traffic.
Key responsibilities:
•           Work with the Director of Brand & Innovation to build a clear, trusted and recognisable new  brand for the Charity and its services, implementing brand values for each and embedding the Charity’s story across the organisation.
•           Oversee research activity and statistical analysis through digital and software products to ensure that the insights we have play a leading role in informing the direction of the Charity.
•           Devise and deliver an SEO and PPC strategy, managing the SEO Consultant.
•           Manage the tracking of audience behaviour and develop key insights to inform marketing strategy.
•           Support the digital and helpline service teams with volunteer recruitment campaigns
•           Integration of marketing and PR activity to key stakeholder groups.
•           Lead on integration of digital marketing activity and integrated campaigns in conjunction with digital, helpline and content teams.
•           Work with the Events Manager to design and promote fundraising events,
•           Work with the Director of Brand & Innovation to implement the Marcomms and Research annual plans, delivering to The Charity’s vision and mission.
•           Establish the collaborations and partnerships with sector organisations and media that will enable us to develop our position as a thought leader for priority themes.
•           Lead on management of any reputational issues affecting the Charity, ensuring an effective crisis management system is in place.
•           Ensure consistent and appropriate communication of the Charity’s key messages though social media, including the generation of video, graphical and written content.
•           Anticipating opportunities or reacting to wider issues/media stories based around the young person calendar to engage key audiences through relevant stories on The Charity.
•           Provide excellent management of staff, volunteers and external freelancers or consultants.
•           Oversee and ensure effective management of the MarComms budget. Reporting to SMT and funders.
Responsible for:
Digital Marketing Officer, Marketing and Outreach Officer, Data Analyst, SEO Manager (freelance). Volunteers /freelancers / consultants / agencies as and when necessary
Main tasks and responsibilities:
Marketing

Development and facilitation of annual marketing plans in line with strategy agreed with Director of Brand & Innovation.
Devise and deliver SEO & PPC strategy.
Devise and deliver multichannel marketing strategy through social media and digital tools.


Monitor of performance across digital and media channels against targets
Manage the integrity of the Charity’s brands.
With the content team, manage and champion The Mix brand guidelines, including the training of staff.


Manage agencies and outside suppliers in the delivery of design, collateral and activity.
Work with the Event manager to promote events and fundraising activities though on and offline channels.
Lead on the design, production and distribution of marketing collateral.
Preparation of copy for newsletters and social media communications.
Manage marketing budgets.

Communications

Lead on the annual plans for the Media activities, integrated with Marketing Plans and clearly supporting the organisation’s strategic aims.
Establish the key messages for all activity to deliver to these plans and translate these into effective messaging across the year for all our services.
Develop and maintain a broad network of contacts in digital, sector and traditional media.
Ensure that the Charity team uses a variety of PR tools - news releases, digital news releases, features, briefings, social media, letters for publication, photo opportunities - to ensure the Charity’s key messages are communicated in a consistent and appropriate way.
Build relationships with opinion formers, bloggers and stakeholders; to support service and fundraising projects and initiatives; to seek out media stories and evaluate coverage against objectives.
Stay abreast of current events to anticipate opportunities or react to wider issues & media stories in order to engage the media through relevant and related stories on the Charity.
Ensure that the Charity has an appropriate and approved crisis communications approach. 
To effectively plan activity to deliver to strategic plans to deliver results, on time and to budget.
Ensure the Charity Media team responds to enquiries from journalists and prepare verbal or written statements or provide spokespeople as appropriate.


Support the Charity’s key spokespeople and case studies through the interview process to ensure on message media coverage.  Providing appropriate training where necessary.
Lead the adoption of new digital techniques and opportunities to impact effectively, keeping up on sector, technology and communications innovations and changes.


Ensure effective management of out of hours press function.
Oversee the strategic and reporting systems of the press office.

Research

Support analysis of audience with Research to derive marketing insight.
Support the integration of website and helpline data.
Analyse complex material and prepare clear, accessible statements and briefings to staff and supporters.
Manage the part time Research Manager

Ad hoc

Any other duties consistent with the above as requested by the Director of Brand & Innovation.
Represent the Charity externally and attend conferences and events as and when appropriate, creating positive networks for the Charity.
Effective and creative activity planning and leadership to deliver results

Person Specification:
We are looking for a dynamic individual with a real passion and enthusiasm for helping young people to improve their lives.
Essential

Deep understanding of digital marketing and advertising.
Solid marketing background, with proven experience in a senior marketing role, and experience of delivering on and offline activity.
In depth understanding of marketing strategy, marketing techniques and audience research.
To contextualise marketing activity to user engagement.
Experience of building and maintaining effective agency relationships with strong creative brief writing skills and able to provide clear, constructive and appropriate feedback to ensure effective activity.
Excellent planning and project management skills, with experience of balancing creative inspirations with limited financial and other resources, ability to handle sensitive issues and deliver to tight deadlines.
Good understanding of online and communications innovations, comfortable dealing with operational teams.
Substantial and demonstrable experience of planning and implementing successful UK-wide media and PR campaigns within an appropriate environment.
A proven track record in news management and in pro-active and reactive media work.
Superb communications skills both written and verbal.
Able to take complex information and ensure accurate and effective dissemination to media and stakeholder audiences.
Considerable experience of building and maintaining relationships with journalists

Desirable

Knowledge of the charity, voluntary and government sectors.
Knowledge of youth interest, culture and use of technology.
Use of analytic software for digital and social tools to design key performance measures.
A good understating of how metadata is used to differentiate campaigns
Demonstrate understanding of email design at a coding level.
Understanding of Adwords software and how it integrates with Google analytics and other analytics software. 
Understanding of appropriate targeting and keyword selection
Demonstrable understating of key and new marketing concepts such as programmatic advertising. 
Solid understanding of website and helpline users and research techniques

Attributes

A creative, self-starter with initiative and drive proactive approach, comfortable making decisions.
Strategic thinker able to see bigger picture and plan activity to meet the opportunity identified.
Leads creativity - fostering imagination and experimentation, takes and promotes considered risks, celebrates creative successes and learns from failure, shows openness to alternative ways of doing things.
Natural communicator with excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills, able to engage and influence those at all levels, particularly those who are not direct reports.
Flexible team player with can-do attitude who enjoys working collaboratively with others and in multi-discipline teams, able to build and maintain effective relationship at all levels.
Strong manager with an ability to motivate a team and ensure excellent results.
Strategic thinker able to see bigger picture and how Media & PR team and activities deliver into these.
Ability to develop and maintain both internal and external relationships at all levels.
Skilled negotiator and influencer and able to lobby and/or influence public opinion.
Able to work under pressure, to prioritise effectively and meet deadlines.
Confident, easy going telephone manner.
Self-servicing in administration, highly computer literate.

Terms and conditions
Salary: £30,000-£40,000 per annum dependent on experience
Contract: This is a Permanent contract
Pension: 1% employee contribution secures employers contribution to stakeholder pension scheme.
Hours: This post is full-time. Normal working hours are 9.30– 5.30, Monday to Friday.  Some unsocial hours may be required including out of hours, evenings & weekend work for which time off in lieu may be given.
Annual leave: You will be entitled to 35 days of holiday pro rata, which          includes the 8 Statutory Bank Holidays during each year.
Location: Across 2 offices near to Bond Street and Baker Street stations.
Closing Date: Friday 16th June - Subject to change if we receive a good number of applicants.

title: SEO Apprentice in Liverpool Street
description:
As Semetrical have been awarded the title of Best Small SEO Agency in Europe, you’ll be working closely with experienced and talented colleagues at all times, helping them to develop within their field very quickly. Semetrical has a very strong track record in terms of talent acquisition and development. During the last 18 months alone, 5 graduates and 2 apprentices have been recruited with no previous experience, and all have now become key members of the team. Become part of their success story as their SEO apprentice!
About the company: 
Semetrical is a highly successful award-winning digital marketing agency. We are based in Central London, and we deliver unique and high-quality services to a range of very well-known clients.  These include OnTheMarket.com, Ticketmaster and the Independent Newspaper.
What you’ll be doing:

You’ll be analysing keyword ranking reports
You’ll be analysing website crawl reports and competitor analysis
You’ll be communicating findings to senior SEO account managers.
You’ll learn the art and science of search engine optimisation while providing support for several different marketing channels

[URL removed]You’ll be great for this role if:

You’re highly enthusiastic about digital marketing.
You have very good Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills (particularly Excel).
Strong time-management and communication skills.
You have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills – being able to analyse data and provide logical solutions.

Role location:
1 Primrose Street, London, EC2A 2EX

title: Digital Marketing Sales Manager
description:
A hugely respected and award winning business are about to embark on an exciting period in their marketing team and as such have created a new role for a Digital Marketing Sales Manager to join them on a permanent basis. The primary function of the Digital Marketing Sales Manager role is to be responsible for leading the team to deliver the onsite activity schedule, sales forecasting, product launches, website development, analytics analysis and overall digital team focus to drive delivery of targets. Working with appropriate internal and external partners to deliver the trading plan to include personalisation, navigation & search. Digital Marketing Sales Manager duties:Develop the trading/promotional plan to drive and increase the value and sales frequency of our customers through customer journeys, testing & competitor analysis.Manage and implement the plan.Create quarterly and monthly granular campaigns, liaising closely with marketing members of the team to ensure plans are achievable and on track at all timesPlan and deliver suitable trading campaigns from brief through to post campaign analysis as well as working with design team and agency to deliver excellent customer experiences.Work with Google analytics to review trading results ensure that KPI targets are met or exceeded at all times. Provide accurate and timely management information as required.Manage the relationships with any relevant external agencies and suppliers to agree and develop the website continuous improvement roadmapWork with analytical team members (internal and agency) to identify distinct segments within the customer profile and deliver a personalised experience to those segmentsTeam Lead - To ensure that the team is delivering the digital marketing plan, traffic targets, key KPI's and are aligned to one strategy.Digital Marketing Sales Manager person specification:Significant trading and team management experience in a commercial environment ideally with multiple brands and product offeringsExperience of owning sales targets and stock forecastingExperience of customer journeys and personalisationExperience of working with and managing external agenciesExperience or understanding of digital marketing channelsAbility to work under pressure and to tight deadlinesRelevant qualifications e.g. relevant degree or recognised marketing qualificationThis is a unique role that would suit a suitably experienced Digital Marketing Sales Manager who is ambitious to achieve objectives and continually drive business onwards. As well as astute business awareness applicants will have strong technical digital marketing skills to add value to the team. 


Contact: David Bowen
        

Reference: Totaljobs
        

Job ID: 74080783

description:

Brand Manager – Multiple positionsPermanent£Competitive plus excellent benefitsBased in Northampton with travel (including occasional travel within Europe)Do you have the experience of the full commercial marketing mix it takes to build a successful brand management career with one of the UK's largest beer and beverage companies? Are you thirsty for the opportunity to champion some of the biggest and best loved brands in the business? Congratulations, you're in the right place.Right now, we are looking for degree-educated individuals who are experienced in owning and delivering commercial/brand marketing plans, to champion Carlsberg and its portfolio brands across the business and beyond. Responsible for developing and executing leading edge marketing strategies, your expertise will ensure we deliver both our commercial and brand objectives. It's a tough, high profile challenge in an extremely competitive market but, with some of the biggest sponsorship properties around and a reputation for delivering great marketing campaigns, we're well placed to continue to win the hearts and minds of the consumer and our customers. All we need is you to drive our plans and brands forward.Success here is all about having the vision, drive and tenacity to make things happen. That means we need someone who can build strong relationships at all levels with suppliers and colleagues alike and is a natural influencer with a clear strategic vision. Comfortable contributing to, as well as leading, key aspects of the Carlsberg brand plan, you're also able to play the role of consumer champion, i.e. identify and work with the killer insights that will get consumers to love us. Just as important though is your ability to get things done in a fast paced, demanding but rewarding environment where delivering on time and in full is critical.The right candidate will have high level influencing and stakeholder management skills, strong consumer intuition and creative judgement. A problem solver with personal drive, excellent story-telling and presentation skills and the ability to engage all in our brand propositions. On top of the culture and career development opportunities that make working with us so rewarding, you'll also receive a product allowance, a flexible benefits scheme, defined contribution pension, private medical cover and generous holidays. So, what are you waiting for? The broader opportunities you crave with a world leader could be yours for the taking.Please note that due to the high volume of applications we receive we are unable to contact all applicants directly. If you haven`t heard from us within 28 days, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful.


Contact: Louise Jones
        

Reference: Totaljobs/LJCARBMMay17
        

Job ID: 74082671

title: Work from Home Business Opportunity p/t or f/t
description:
Are you looking to work from home, either full time or part time?Are you looking for something different?Looking for a way to improve your life and be your own boss?We need key people who want to work from home and are: Ambitious, friendly, ethical, enthusiastic, self motivated, determined to succeed and goal orientated.Your background could be in finance, hospitality, banking, insurance, HR, sales & marketing, teaching, health care, management, recruitment.You may be returning to the work place. You may have reached the level of Manager or above.Maybe you are a stay at home mum, looking for something for yourself but still want to be there for the children? Maybe you are struggling in the current economic climate and would like help making ends meet? Maybe you have just been made redundant and want income security that can’t be taken away from you in the future?We are a global company working in the health and wellbeing market.You will work under the umbrella of a world brand leading company established for over 30 years and with an unbroken record of growth throughout that period now with worldwide sales in excess of $2.6 billiion. You will receive full training and support from established leaders within the company to enable you to grow your own business. You will be:Self-employed, working from home.Your role:With the help of a business mentor you will develop and maintain, a regular customer base of 20 regular clients. You will be trained to coach and support other small to medium sized business owners. Assist their development enabling them to become successful and independent and in turn become business mentors themselves.You will expect an OTE up to £1500 per month working part-time and £4000 per month working full time with uncapped potential earnings. Opportunities to enter Profit share, international travel and incentive programmes.This is a business opportunity allowing you to be your own boss, work from home and enjoy the freedom to establish your own work life balance without the risk of redundancy. You need to have a current UK driving licence and be over 18 years of age.www.tttgroup.co.uk for more information


Contact: Peter Kemble
        

Reference: Totaljobs/PK OL7/4/15

title: Door to Door sales
description:
Job Title: Fundraising Agent Salary: £20K-£25k (inc Basic plus OTE) + Uncapped Bonuses Location: Yorkshire and Lancashire Job Role:We are currently looking for enthusiastic and ambitious individuals with good communication skills. You must have a passion for customer care and service with a drive to succeed. Expect to initially start in a field based face-to-face (Door to Door Fundraiser) marketing role with the opportunity to progress within the company at a rapid rate. This opportunity is available to individuals who show a strong work ethic and willingness to learn new skills. Your area of work will be Yorkshire, Lancashire The key attributes for this role are: • Excellent communication skills • Drive and determination • Customer service • Ambition to succeed • Leadership • Ability to work as part of team *Whilst previous sales experience is desirable, your character, drive and determination to succeed are equally important. Full product training is provided. £20K-£25k (inc Basic plus OTE) + Uncapped Bonuses The successful candidate will be Highly Self Motivated Looking for the opportunity to progress Achieve daily, weekly and monthly sales targets Manage own workload and use of time Handle rejection Understand customer service Be able to cold call on a door to door basis MUST HAVE Mobile phone and land lineOwn Transport Permission to work in the UK Effective communication skills A friendly outgoing manner This is an exciting opportunity for the right applicant to join a company which promotes a fantastic earning potential, future promotion opportunities and job satisfaction! You will be expected to promote the Community Scheme to help raise funds for local children's football teams within the local area. We offer A hourly retainer Commission and bonus structure Competitions

title: Pricing and Data Analyst/ Manager/Marketing insight
description:
Job Title Pricing and Data Analyst/ Marketing InsightDepartment MarketingReports to Multi-Channel ManagerSalary range £27-28000 plus great benefits/bonus and career prospects!Direct Reports 0Job PurposeA vital key role within this dynamic and growing company within a large Group. The company has had a large amount of investment in the last year or two and is doing very well indeed, leading to internal promotions within their Marketing Department, hence the need to recruit againData and information enables pro-active decision making within the business across multiple channels.Managing multiple pricing structures, as well as monitoring competitor’s activity and price comparisons is essential to the groups positioning within the market place.Reporting on marketing activity and market trends defines future decision making. The role includes the maintenance of the ERP system with the ability to identify and execute best practice.We seek someone dynamic, a clear thinker and excellent report writer to be able to provide first class data for devising new strategies to this is a really critical role. Being able to think outside the box and look for openings or inconsistencies within the market, thus enabling new products to be developed to fill any gaps. is something that you will be able to provide.In return, you will be promoted and your career will grow, as whilst the growth rate in the group is manageable, it is also fast and departments are evolving, specialising and segmenting, leading to new career opportunities and management roles. This is a company where you can stay long term and enjoy ongoing work,where your ideas and creativity and desire to make things even better are actively sought, questioning the current methods and suggesting improvements that could be rolled out across the company!Honesty integrity, clarity of thought and ingenuity are traits that are appreciated as is an eye for detail and high levels of accuracyKey Working RelationshipsWorking with fellow colleagues and all levels of management, providing insights and reports in a clear, informative manner is a key to the role.Key Responsibilities• Marketing activity reports• Website reports • Manage multiple pricing structures• Sales reports across channels• Competitors activity & price comparison• Analyse conversation rate against activity• Manage & Maintain ERP system Qualifications / Skills & Experience• Transact SQL (desirable)• Google Analytics• MS Office Suite: Excel – Advanced level (Ability to do Macros) PowerPoint etc• Excellent organisation and communication skills• Able to work independently with limited supervisionFRS strives to be an equal opportunities employer, and is committed to treating all applicants alike. FRS does not treat any individual on grounds of sex, age, colour, marital status, race, nationality or ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability or membership or non-membership of a trade union, less favourably than others. All vacancies advertised are open to all ages.

Reference: Totaljobs/46876

description:
An established B2C PR agency in Oxfordshire is expanding and looking to bring on board a public relations agency Account Executive or Senior Account Executive with 1-2 years' commercial public relations experience either in an agency or in-house. The experience we need.- A minimum of one year's commercial PR experience.- Recent, preferably current, experience as a PR Account Executive or Senior Account Executive in a public relations agency. You will need broad public relations experience to help deliver campaigns in this close-knit team. This is a highly sought after place to work because they're one of the leading marketing and PR agencies in their field and they work in an extremely desirable and glamorous industry, delivering a broad range of PR campaigns for a host of luxury B2C clients. Beyond the great work they deliver, it's a really fun and friendly team so it's a fantastic place to work.What you'll get in returnYou can earn a salary of £24-27k (dependant on experience) as well as a host of benefits. title: Senior Marketing Manager
description:
New opportunity not to be missed! Ordnance Survey has a unique opportunity available for a Senior Marketing Manager (Consumer) to join the team in Southampton. The role is a full time, permanent position offering a competitive salary of £50,000 DOE and excellent benefits – this is a fantastic opportunity to develop a rewarding career.As Britain’s National Mapping Agency, we have over 225 years of heritage. We are probably best known for our definite leisure mapping ranges used by explorers and adventurers throughout Great Britain. Today OS produce a range of digital map data, online route planning and sharing services and mobile apps, plus many other location-based or outdoor products so you know exactly where you are and where you are heading.Imagine a job where…You will discover passion, innovation and a community of dedicated professionals. From developing new map-related software and applications, to creating ground-breaking outdoor kit, Ordnance Survey knows where it is and where it is going.So, if you are a Senior Marketing Manager with a passion for the outdoors, have a strategic marketing background within a consumer goods or retail market, this is a fantastic opportunity to play a key role in the future success of an amazing organisation.What are the responsibilities of the Senior Marketing Manager?This is a broad role where you will be responsible for leading the team on all marketing and communications activities as well as creating and delivering the marketing strategy to support the delivery of the Consumer Vision; to make outdoor activity enjoyable, accessible and safe.You will be tasked with planning, developing and managing activity that supports our growth ambitions. Experienced in producing rolling plans that deliver optimised marketing campaigns or events, you will relish new challenges and opportunities.Accountable for a team of marketing professionals, a seven-figure budget and the consumer marketing strategy, you will clearly measure all marketing activity through a range of KPI’s ensuring ROI targets are set and met and that activity is continuously moving the business forward. In addition, you will also be responsible for managing all aspects of the marketing for new product launches and initiatives as well as representing OS at industry events.What skills do I need to have to become a Senior Marketing Manager?- Financial and commercial awareness and experience managing large budgets is key- In depth knowledge of outdoor consumer products and market- Expert Marketing knowledge across a wide range of consumer media including ecommerce and retail- Expert knowledge of and proven track-record of data driven decision making- Excellent data interpretation and analytical skills- Strong communication and influencing skills- Experience of managing and growing teams- Proven track-record of delivering marketing performance and strong growth targets- Highly effective in key stakeholder management- A passion for adventure in the great outdoorsWe offer a fantastic benefits package for our Senior Marketing Manager!Within OS you will have the opportunity to develop and progress within the company. We want you to love what you do, that’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:- A great pension scheme- Salary circa £50k depending on experience- Performance related bonus- 25 days annual leave (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 days over Christmas- Flexible working- A range of other flexible benefits and an active sport and social scene.Closing date: 31st May 2017Why not click ‘apply’ today? Don’t miss out on this opportunity to join the world’s market-leading digital mapping and big data organisation as our Senior Marketing Manager.

title: Marketing Manager - starting ASAP
description:
We are recruiting for an exciting Marketing Manager job opportunity based in Hemel Hempstead working for a prestigious client that operates within the healthcare sector for an initial 6 month contract (with the possibility of extension/permanent role). Taking ownership for the marketing function of the company, the role will include overseeing all areas of brand development, PR and communications, events, clinic marketing literature and all associated tasks. We are ideally looking for candidates with previous experience within the healthcare sector (beauty, leisure, hospitality, high end/luxury product/service sectors or similar can be considered).Duties to include:Developing and planning of new services and service package development (targeted at patients and local business), interfacing with appropriate clinical staff, regularly monitoring and analysing success and making recommendations for improvementRegularly monitoring the market, healthcare trends and new services to ensure the business maintains its progressive positioningOngoing planning and development of all brand, company and services communications (both on and offline)Support the development or CSR strategy and day to day PR management, working closely with our appointed PR agencyEvent organisation and management of all required materials e.g., invite emails, goody bags, food etc., (run specifically for patients, local business, allied health professionals, PR, recruitment), including management of our Marketing AgencyWork closely with the Assistant Marketing Manager to plan, develop and execute an engaging PR and promotional activity calendar, creating compelling campaigns with our appointed Marketing AgencyConduct research on market, service, healthcare trends - recommending new services/packages/directions that support key marketing/business objectives with the potential to deliver a high return on investmentIn conjunction with the Head of Marketing support the development and implementation of the Brand, Communications and PR strategiesDevelop and manage website content, constantly refreshing and updating to reflect business changes while helping to develop long term SEO (e.g., news service, blogs, articles and backlinks)Responsible for the delivery and stock management of all branded literature (from business cards to service leaflets & plans, registration forms and brand brochures)Support the development and delivery of internal and external marcomms plans, e.g. newsletters/intranetSupport the PR agency in the development and implementation of an annual PR calendar/s to support key disciplines throughout the businessWork closely with senior management team to deliver key PR projects, to include implementation and delivery of CSR projects and eventsPlanning and implementation of all Marketing led company eventsPreparation & delivery of key materials for meetings, such as, documents, reports, presentations, creativeEnsure effective copy writing and proof reading of all communications materialsTake responsibility for planning, developing and implementing key projectsCandidate requirements:Previous experience at Marketing Manager level, responsible for overall marketing mixIdeally some healthcare industry experience (luxury products/services, beauty, hospitality or leisure will be considered)Available to start ASAP and take ownership of the company's marketing functionArticulate with strong communication skillsAbility manage projects and a small teamLooking for the next step in your career? Think Specialist Recruitment.Think Specialist Recruitment is an independent support staff recruitment agency based in Hemel Hempstead and working across the Herts, Beds and Bucks area. We specialise in permanent and contract recruitment with areas of expertise including: administration, customer service/call centre, PA/secretarial, human resources, accountancy and finance, sales admin/sales support, marketing and IT Helpdesk/IT support.

title: Product Manager - AV solutions (EMEAR)
description:
Epson is a global imaging and innovation leader that operates at the cutting edge of technology development. We are dedicated to exceeding our customers' expectations worldwide through the creation of ground-breaking, high-precision and energy-saving technologies. From inkjet printers, 3LCD interactive projectors, to augmented reality smart glasses and robots, Epson offers an extensive array of award-winning products to customers across the world. As a result of significant business growth, Epson are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Product Manager who will have an opportunity to share expertise and insight across Epson's Display Hardware and associated software solutions. Reporting into the Manager, Product Management - VI (Visual Instrument) Business Unit, you will manage product planning, preparation and launch stages of our VI product life-cycle across the EMEAR region, working closely with Global HQ (Seiko Epson Company) in Japan. You will also be responsible for building a comprehensive understanding of key market information and customer values for both existing and new products in order to drive future product planning in order to grow our business. This role is based out of offices in Hemel Hempstead, Herts with some travel across EMEAR. Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement launch plans, including product phase-out/phase-in for new products. Create comprehensive briefing documents and launch schedules to ensure all areas of the business and our Technical Partners are prepared for a new product launchTrain local Product Managers to ensure effective and consistent demonstration of a new product by focusing on UX and ValueWork closely as the 'gel' with the h/w Product Managers looking after Corporate and Education Vertical of the VI portfolioWork closely with Marketing to manage the creation and delivery of all marketing collateral, ensuring accuracy, localisation and consistency of informationWork with the Central Legal and Environmental departments to ensure that all risks related to product lifecycle management are considered and planned accordinglyThrough hands-on Epson/competitor testing and market specific research covering customer, competitor and channel partner information, assess product competitiveness in meeting customer needs, and identify areas of potential improvement to customer value propositionFully understand the customer requirements, use case, UX, workflow -with software, content and hardware integrated solutions and, where relevant, media. Provide advice to SEC regarding market needs and influence product road mapTrack the price/features/value propositions of key competitors with a segmented approach working with other stakeholders and customers as required. Use this information to support Epson Sales companies (GTM) Go to Market Plans & commercial/channel strategy implementationsProvide input to the Manager Product Management on product positioning against market segments, that would maximise market share and market sizing in the EMEAR region while optimising profitability, and support them in the development of the Mid-Term Planning and quarterly update cyclesAssess new competitor launches and pricing issues in order to provide quick feedback to the Manager Product Management on the impact of Epson positioning, and recommend actions to ensure that the correct competitive position is maintained Knowledge, Skills & Experience: Product management experience gained across the AV market with knowledge of AV software solutions to include NPI, NPD, Cradle to Crave, End to End Solution delivery, pricing strategy, demand forecasting, product life cycle, EOL management, Portfolio Positioning, Completive Analysis, Product Development influence, Product Roadmap ownershipApplications are welcomed from product marketing, solution architect , software solutions specialists with proven experience in this sector (AV & IT)Experienced in building value proposition, running user story mapping, designing Usability and User Acceptance TestVery good Excel knowledge and general IT knowledge (Networking)Stakeholder influence and ISV Vendor ManagementNumerate with attention to detail and process drivenAnalytic and questioning manner with the ability to make sense of dataGraduate level education in computer science, or marketing backgroundSpeaking more than one European language will be valued Especially German or French Epson makes products for a wide range of customers and we are committed to having a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary and with an outstanding suite of benefits. Colleagues based in our offices at Westside, Hemel Hempstead work in an excellent waterside location with close proximity to Apsley train station, onsite parking and a subsidised restaurant.


Contact: Epson Europe BV

They have grown from a department to a company in its own right.They currently have an exciting opportunity for a Marketing Coordinator to join their great team based at their head office and factory in Grimethorpe, Barnsley reporting directly to the Sales Director.Within the role you will project manage, implement and monitor dynamic marketing activity in line with corporate objectives and a defined sales strategy supporting sales and margin aspirations whilst managing the annual marketing budget.
