title: Digital Marketing Executive
description:
We are looking for a talented, creative, intelligent and ambitious Digital Marketing Co-ordinator to work for one of the biggest and most successful companies in Devon. The successful Digital Marketing Co-ordinator will be in a role where they can learn lots and really get their career in digital marketing going.The experience we need.The successful Digital Marketing Co-ordinator will have a genuine passion for digital marketing. You will be personable, a good communicator and willing to learn. This is a role for someone who wants to really make their mark in a big company. If you can use adobe creative suite then that is a big plus.The role.A major part of this role is the email marketing. My client send out millions of emails to their customers every single year so it is a vital part of their marketing strategy. This is where you will need to have a creative streak as the successful Digital Marketing Co-ordinator will be designing the visuals of the emails. This is a role where you will be able to learn, grow and have a brilliant long-term career. You would be working under their Head of Ecommerce and learning lots from him.The company.My client are one of the biggest and most successful companies in all of Devon. They have been in existence for over 50 year and are becoming more successful year on year. They provide an excellent service to their customers and are the market leaders in their field. What you’ll get in return.In return, the successful Digital Marketing Co-ordinator will be working for a brilliant company in a talented team in a good location.How to apply.If this sounds of interest, then please click the apply button right away!For more info on this or similar roles please give Owen Harris a call.

        PR Manager, Luton - A well established and innovative company are currently looking for a PR Manager to be a part of the communications department to ensure effective functionality of its press office and play an integral role in the overall communications strategy. You will have proven experience in media and corporate communications with excellent written skills and the ability to approach tasks strategically.Reporting to the Head of PR, you will be responsible for managing the organisations reputation both in a proactive and reactive manner. Working closely with the Head of PR, you will be responsible for the development, and implementation of the company's communications strategy and ensure that the company's brand identity is actively promoted. This role requires a hands on individual who is open to actively answering any key press enquires. Alongside this the development and delivery of press releases that maximise the company's exposure in national and international press as well as trade publications and aim to consolidate relationships with broadcast media. The relationships you will build will span the globe, so the ability to align stories with local demand will serve you well.This is a great opportunity for a true PR and communications professional to join a leading internationally renowned company that offers a fantastic working environment and great benefits. Due to the location of their offices, this role is commutable from Bedford, Luton, Royston, St Albans, Hemel Hempstead, Milton Keynes and Harpenden.For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Search Brand Recruitment on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs. Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online http://www.brandrecruitment.co.uk/ to apply for other key marketing jobs in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.

title: Digital Marketing Trainer Assessor
description:
Are you a Marketing Professional with a degree in a Marketing related discipline or equivalent and have a minimum of 3 years’ industry experience with emphasis on Digital Marketing and Social Media? If so, we are keen to hear from you.The successful candidate will have overall responsibility for the in-house and workplace delivery and assessment of the qualification.3aaa Apprenticeships will offer free training to the successful candidate in getting the relevant qualifications.Duties will include but not limited to:Inspire, motivate and assess the competence of apprentices in the workplaceDeliver classroom-based sessions to Apprentices associated with the Digital Marketing programIdentify opportunities to enhance the work with our key stakeholdersCarry out regular reviews with the employer and the apprentice to ensure timely completion of the apprentice programme Plan and monitor the progress of case load meeting awarding organisations requirements.Essential RequirementsStrong sector skill knowledge of the workplace and subjects (Digital Marketing and Social Media)Minimum of three years’ industry experience in marketingAbility to manage own time and workload efficiently and effectively. Marketing or business related qualificationsDesirableExperience of delivering to 16-18 year oldsPTLLS or CTLLS qualified, or willing to work towardsMCSA/MCSE qualifiedKnowledge of the FE sector and funded programsA1 qualified, or willing to work towardsThis role requires regional travel therefore you will be a car owner/driver with a clean driving licence.There is a requirement to pass an enhanced DBS check - the cost of the DBS check is covered by the company.About us at 3aaa3aaa Apprenticeships is an Ofsted Grade 1 Outstanding training provider specialising in the delivery of apprenticeship programmes across the country. We aim to provide the next generation of high quality IT employees, Digital Marketing executives, Financial Services staff, Managers and Accountants to feed the demand for qualified professionals through the exceptional delivery of Level 3 & 4 training and professional qualifications. We also have a significant number of Levy paying clients from Blue Chip companies and many education and sporting organisations. Our wider offer to clients continues to expand and grow to meet new demands.3aaa Apprenticeships is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a highly ambitious Marketing Assistant to join one of the UK's foremost business support organisations.Working across multiple brand areas, you will be encouraged to bring new innovative ideas to support the marketing strategy. You'll be joining a multifaceted marketing department, where you'll receive the support you need to achieve your future career ambitions.You'll be responsible for conducting integrated marketing campaigns to support the marketing strategy. The role includes:- Managing the day-to-day implementation of an online marketing strategy including social media channels- Direct marketing campaign support- Introducing creative input as appropriate- Assisting in the delivery of online and offline marketing materials- Support with event preparation- Support with the implementation of offline campaigns including advertising and telemarketing- Curating news and content to be shared through multiple agreed marketing channels- Supporting the Marketing Executive by identifying PR opportunities- Managing the day-to-day updates to the Content Management System to ensure websites are kept up-to-date and displaying correct and relevant information -Managing the key performance indicator and metrics reportsThey are looking for someone who wants a career in marketing who has the following skills & experience:- Either studying for or has a relevant marketing qualification- A keen interest and understanding of business and marketing- A digital marketing enthusiast- Passion for and able to demonstrate a good knowledge and use of social media- Initiative, creativity and a can-do attitude- A fast learner who's keen to get stuck in, try new things and keep up-to-date- Good organisation, time-management and forward planning- Excellent communication skills, both written and in-person- Excellent attention to detailYou will have access to 10.5% non-contributory pension; 26 days holiday plus 8 Bank Holidays, life assurance and income protection, voluntary benefit options including child care vouchers, flexi pension and ability to buy holiday.If this vacancy interests you they would be delighted to hear from you. title: Senior Marketing Manager, Adtech, Martech, Fintech
description:
Digital Marketing Manager, AdTech, Martech, Fintech, LondonDigital Marketing Manager required to work for a fast growing Digital Technology (Adtech) business based in Central London. Ideally we want a professional Marketing Leader from 'modern technology' such as Adtech, Martech or Fintech. Reporting to and working closely with the Director of Marketing you will manage the marketing team and day-to-day operations at the EMEA region across PR, communications, events, data stories, content and sales tools. Our client takes their brand and marketing really seriously and this new role comes at an exciting exciting time as they continue to grow and expand their global marketing and design teams. As one of the primary brand guardians you will manage activity across all of the business’s marketing streams (Sales, Materials, PR, events, reactive, analytical and internal) supported by their PR and Creative agencies. Creativity, their Search Insights and commercial awareness is at heart of everything they do.Role includes day-to-day management of 1 x marketing executive and 3 x designers. Further team expansion planned for the rest of the year. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES ·Project manage the marketing team to lead projects from conception to execution·Build stand-out and thought provoking marketing collateral (both online and offline) to drive new product awareness, new targeting capabilities, creation of insights infographics or audience profiles·Work closely with the the analytics department to deliver marketing trends, insights and white papers to power lead-generation and brand awareness activity·Assist the Head of Marketing with managing PR activity and agency. This includes steering insight-led stories, thought leadership and speaking opportunities. ·Lead the company’s event and social activity across Mobile World Congress, Cannes and Dmexco and IAB events and ATS London & Paris·Work on paid media strategy to support brand awareness and content activity·With the sales team and Trade marketing executive, manage a calendar of agency workshops, sessions and branding activations across the media agency landscape ·Support global offices with internal marketing initiatives including Christmas trips abroad /internal awards ·Create a monthly report of how the effectiveness of marketing activity has helped drive new business, opportunities and awareness – evidence of adding to the bottom line.ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:·At least 3 years experience in a marketing role in media or advertising (a must)·Strong communication and grammar skills·Strong knowledge of PR and media trade journalists ·Experience in project management ·Strong commercial awareness and knowledge of how marketing drives sales ·Desire to do marketing differently, building and maintaining a brand that stands out·Great at planning and obsessive with detail ·Analytical mind and a passion for building stories through data ·Passionate about social media and content ·Proficiency in Excel, Word, Outlook and other MS Office programmes ·Self- starter with the ability to work independently and prioritize with little oversightDESIRABLE·Background in working with a creative agency·Social media and blog experience ·Enjoys working in an exciting, busy and dynamic environment ·Interest in working in an entrepreneurial environment. ·Self- starter with the ability to work independently and prioritize with little oversightThis is an excellent role and salary is dependent upon experience. Apply now for more details.

title: Assistant Brand Manager McVitie's Seasonal and Commercial brands
description:
ABOUT THE ROLEDo you love biscuits? Who doesn’t I hear you say! Are you inquisitive and driven by consumer understanding? Do you want a marketing role where you are responsible end to end, a role where you can really touch all elements of the marketing mix – advertising, packaging, innovation, price, promotion, agency relationships ? – We could keep going. Here at pladis we are recruiting for an Assistant Brand Manager to work in the McVitie’s Seasonal and Commercial team.Seasonal and Commercial portfolios are exciting areas for us at pladis with significant projected growth plans, to be achieved through significant marketing investment and also strong innovation plans in 2018 and beyond. The main objective when working on the Seasonal and Commercial brand is to contribute towards delivery of share, revenue, and profit for this group of brands. It is an interesting and exciting portfolio allowing you to develop key marketing skills by working across the full marketing mix along with working closely with Market Strategy and Planning, Shopper Marketing and Sales teams. If you an inquisitive marketer that wants to understand brand performance drivers and how consumer behaviour can shape marketing plans then maybe pladis is the business for you. If you are driven, determined and ambitious, and want to work for a company that will enable you to build and grow a career in Marketing then please read on.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES- Supporting implementation of existing Marketing Brand Plans and in the planning process for the coming year- Reporting - responsible for producing/presenting standard financial & performance reporting decks (as well as ad-hoc analysis).- Updating product packaging in accordance with ingredient, global design amendments and promotional requirements. -- Managing the process from brief and supporting the brand managers to ensure timely and effective execution.- Liaising with external agencies regarding pack designs amends.- Internal PR: To ensure that internal PR activity to raise the profile of various marketing events within PLADIS is effectively implemented (eg. Launch of new advertising, brand launches etc)- Act as brand and consumer champion both internally within PLADIS and externally with field sales team. Potential to take ownership of the management of some brands within the core and/or assortments portfolio- Assist the senior brand Manager on key projects, with the potential to work with external agencies on social, advertising and PR.ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONSSuccessful candidates will have the following Skills and Experience:FMCG Marketing experience (operational or development)Project Management experience (Great organisation and collaboration skills )Must have an understanding of how to drive revenue and profitFrom a Personal Attributes standpoint, the following criteria will be required:Drive for results: someone who takes action to meet goals and objectives. Takes pride in consistently delivering high quality work on time. Demonstrates a desire to improve own performance. Gets things done. Resilience: someone who stays with the task even when it gets tedious, difficult or inconvenient. Recognises own feelings and emotions when under pressure.Inter-personal relationships: Knows how to build and maintain relationships needed for the role. Shows respect for and seeks to understand the views and opinions of others. Communicates own views clearly and succinctly.Problem solving and decision making: knows how to apply simple rules or past experience to identify problems and select the best option from a range of solutions. Knows how to prioritise tasks and activities in order of importance. Takes time to ‘go see’ for themselves.To be successful in this role you need to be able to show determination, ambition and leadership. You can’t accept mediocre results but always target excellence. There is real scope for success with this portfolio and a real focus for business growth over three years. COMPANY OVERVIEWYildiz Holding, CEEMEA’s largest food company, has brought together its core biscuit, chocolate, and confectionery businesses Godiva Chocolatier, United Biscuits, Ulker and DeMet’s Candy Company, to form a new global company, “pladis”.The new entity unites internationally recognised brands Godiva, a leading premium chocolate brand worldwide, McVitie’s, a leading biscuit brand with a heritage in the UK and Europe, and Ulker, the leading biscuits and confectionery brand in Turkey and Middle East; a love mark in its category. Together they form a $US5.2 billion business, positioning pladis as a global leader in the category.pladis is a global biscuit and confectionery company with operations in 120 countries across Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Asia and the Americas. With annual revenues of US$5.2 billion, pladis has 36 factories in 13 countries and employs 26,000.The company is owned by Yildiz Holding, the largest food company in CEEMEA, and combines three centuries of baking and confectionery expertise by bringing together its iconic Godiva, McVitie’s and Ulker brands.With a commitment to “promise happiness to the world with every bite”, the company delights consumers with products in sweet and savory biscuits, wafer, cake, chocolate, gum and candy categories.


Contact: Annalisa Pucciarelli
        

Reference: Totaljobs/MAS02850
        

Job ID: 74090924

title: PPC Manager
description:
I’m currently working with an international financial services business to recruit a PPC Manager into their well-established digital marketing team. As the PPC Manager you will work as part of a wider digital marketing team, taking responsibility for managing paid search campaigns – ensuring that ongoing optimisation is delivered whilst continually looking for opportunities to improve on performance. You will also take on responsibility across forecasting, analytics and campaign monitoring – this will be with a focus on ensuring that a ‘best in class’ campaign is being delivered upon every time. Although your main focus in this role will be PPC, you will also get the opportunity to working across paid social and display.As an integral part of the marketing team, part of your role will be to drive internal digital capabilities, with the expectation that you will contribute to best practice across the team. description:

Your new role   You will be reporting into the Head of Communications and work within a close nit team. You will be fundamental in implementing and delivering the internal communications strategy to ensure staff are aware of the latest company news and visions. The role will involve working with wider teams including HR and IT to support communication. The role involves creating content across all internal channels including intranet, newsletters and staff briefings. title: Communications Manager
description:
Your new company  An excellent retail organisation based in the North Staffordshire area.   Your new role  As Communications Manager you will take overall responsibility for the delivery of all internal and external communications and events within organisation. This role is key to ensuring all communication channels are up to date, and relevant for customers, franchisees and all brands, products and services. As Communications Manager you will be responsible for fit for purpose daily & weekly communication for the business; stores/field/people/central support teams both internal and external and with Franchisees. You will also be responsible to develop and build strong relationships with central support departments and brands, alongside ensuring all communication is sent in a timely manner to deadline. Other key accountabilities as Communications Manager include: Supports communication tool development and drives innovative ideas to continually improve publications; Ensures single tone of voice and values context in all communications issued; Support the creation and implementation of the communications strategy through technology platforms and be accountable for ensuring that the internal communications tool is managed effectively and kept up to date at all times i.e. internet and Fuse for Franchisees.  What you'll need to succeed  To be successful as Communications Manager you will have previous experience in employee, internal or external communications with excellent project management and IT skills. You will have previous experience of working within a Retail organisation with experience working within a store environment. As Communications Manager you will be confident writing engaging and compelling content, alongside excellent commercial acumen. You must be self-motivated with brilliant presentation, influencing and organisational skills. A degree or CIPR membership is desired.  What you'll get in return  As Communications Manager you will receive a salary of £40,000 whilst working for a well-established retail company.   What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk


Contact: Alyson Hawkins

title: Account Executive - Financial PR Top Ranked Agency
description:
Job Title: Account Executive - Financial PRLocation: LondonSalary: £22,000 to £25,000 dependent on experience  About The Financial PR CompanyMy client has an excellent opportunity for a successful Account Executive to join their rapidly expanding team within a PR Week top 20 Ranked Agency in the very heart of London.This agency is a multi-disciplined agency specialising in, amongst other sectors, Financial PR, Corporate PR and Healthcare. The Financial PR Agency have many of the leading figures in the industry spearheading the team and there are no barriers to interaction with Senior Directors as well as more junior team members as the offices are open plan and highly collaborative. The culture is one of inclusion, openness and progression. The clients worked on in the Financial PR team are varied and cover a broad range of sectors including, retail, food and drink, financial institutions and well-known brands. As an Account Executive you will be working for a modern, forward thinking business; that believe trust and strong relationships as well as extensive industry knowledge and consistently high levels of delivery are the key to their success. The team have a wealth of experience in the Financial PR space and work on high level IPO's, M&A's and AIM listed companies as well as work on clients in the FTSE-250. The Financial PR Agency have an international footprint and are growing rapidly so now is a great time to come in and make an impact. The benefits on offer are fantastic and include, superb pension contribution, free breakfast and gym discounts.About The Account Executive RoleAs an Account Executive, you will have an exciting opportunity to develop both your technical skills and Financial PR knowledge in an established Financial PR environment.Key Responsibilities for the Account Executive:* Providing day-to-day support on client accounts, assisting account leader with successfuldelivery of market communications activity* Executing agreed communications strategies for clients founded on a good understanding offinancial market operations and regulations, and relevant key stakeholder groups* Being a key member of the team with ability to utilise main social media platforms* Drafting and processing of regulatory announcementsAbout YouIf you are currently an Account Executive with the skills to match now is the chance to apply and make a difference for this well regarded and exciting Financial PR AgencyEssential Skills and Competencies of the Account Executive: * Agency side experience in Financial PR preferable- Working with UK listed Companies as well as financial journalists* Be able to work across different sectors as well as Financial PR * The ability to think creatively and have exceptional written skills as well as the ability to work autonomously and in a team.* Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to work to tight deadlinesThe Account Executive receives a highly competitive salary paying from £22,000 to £25,000 depending on experience.For more information about the Account Executive role or to apply send your CV now to Reuben Sinclair are a multi award winning recruitment company including: UK's Best Recruitment Consultant, UK's Best Specialist Recruitment Agency, UK's Best Agency Side Recruiter, One of only 30 UK Hyper Growth companies, UK's Most Innovative Recruitment Company, UK's Most Innovative Recruiter, UK's Best Agency Side Recruiter, UK's Best Agency Side RecruiterWe specialise in delivering recruitment solutions for complete brand engagement: Sales, Marketing, PR & Digital and work with some of the most innovative, entrepreneurial and award winning companies across industry.

title: Senior Marketing Projects Manager
description:
New opportunity not to be missed! Ordnance Survey has a unique opportunity available for a Senior Marketing Projects Manager to join the team in Southampton. The role is a full time, permanent position offering a competitive salary of circa £52,000 and excellent benefits – this is a fantastic opportunity to develop a rewarding career.OS produce digital map data, online route planning and sharing services and mobile apps, plus many other location-based products so you know exactly where you are. Through the success of our mapping data we’ve also attracted the attention of governments across the world who want what we have in Great Britain; so we help other countries to build the same capabilities in quality data accumulation and management.Imagine a job where…You will discover passion, innovation and a community of dedicated professionals. Now one of the world’s most modern, tech-driven organisations around, Ordnance Survey provides market-leading mapping, data and consultancy solutions that help customers to understand the world.So, if you are a Senior Marketing Projects Manager with a strategic, brand marketing background, this is a fantastic opportunity to play a key role in the future success of an amazing organisation.What are the responsibilities of the Senior Marketing Projects Manager?As the Senior Marketing Projects Manager, you will be tasked with the development and implementation of marketing strategies to help shape and deliver brand awareness campaigns that drive new revenue for Ordnance Survey.Supporting the Head of Brand Marketing, you will help lead, advise and provide direction to the Brand Marketing team and marketing managers embedded within the business units, to deliver our customer requirements and help plan, monitor and track marketing projects.Working with key stakeholders across the business, you’ll help lead, guide and work with them to define their marketing strategies and organise their marketing activities to ensure maximum cost effectiveness and business benefit. You’ll also be looking after these stakeholders, making sure they have excellent service from our brand marketing team and projects are on time, delivered successfully. The Senior Marketing Projects Manager will constantly be reviewing our processes and systems to ensure we operate effectively now and as the business evolves.You’ll be responsible for our supplier relationships, supplier roster and working with procurement to manage these.Accountable for monitoring the marketing budget, you’ll also be responsible for ensuring expenditure is in line with the business plan and marketing strategy providing advice and challenging where necessary to ensure requirements are met against budgeted spend.What skills do I need to have to become a Senior Marketing Projects Manager?You will be a strategic thinker with the ability to fully understand business demands and translate this into campaign deliverables. Highly customer focused and operationally proficient, you will demonstrate team management and leadership capabilities. In addition, we’re also looking for:- A good record of achievement at senior level within marketing in a complex organisation- Proven project management experience - proven ability to take ownership of all aspects of a campaign from concept to completion- Expert marketing knowledge- Brand management experience- Highly effective in key stakeholder management- Possess the gravitas to influence and challenge at a senior level- Financial and commercial awareness and experience managing budgets is essential- Strong analytical and decision making skillsWe offer a fantastic benefits package!Within OS you will have the opportunity to develop and progress within the company. We want you to love what you do, that’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:- A great pension scheme- Salary circa £52k- Performance related bonus- 25 days annual leave (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 days over Christmas- Flexible working- Retail, leisure, sports, health and technology discounts- Paid volunteer day- Training and development opportunities to keep your skills current- Access to social clubs including running, volleyball, yoga, photography and our choir- Support for your health and wellbeing from eye care vouchers, child care vouchers and health checksClosing date: 20th June 2017Why not click ‘apply’ today? Don’t miss out on this opportunity to join the world’s leading digital mapping and big data organisation as our Senior Marketing Projects Manager.


Contact: Ordnance Survey
        

Reference: Totaljobs/DWSOUSMPM0706
        

Job ID: 74400394

description:
Business Development Executive
        








Bury St. Edmunds (IP28), 






£22000 - £25000 per annum + Excellent Benefits












Permanent


Expires in 3 days



























Business Development ExecutiveBased in Bury St Edmunds, SuffolkSalary: £22,000 - £25,000 + OTE & Excellent BenefitsAs one of the UK's leading independent professional services companies we are currently looking to recruit a Business Development Executive at our Bury St Edmunds office. Offering a competitive starting salary plus benefits including uncapped OTE potential, this is a fantastic opportunity for an intelligent and enthusiastic individual with B2B sales / client care experience to develop their skills within a dynamic market leading business. As part of our Business Development Team tasked with generating interest in the company's outsourced back office solutions, you would be expected to provide a high standard of support and advice to potential and existing clients, helping generate new business revenue through effective relationship management.Responsibilities will include generating leads, building relationships, handling client enquiries, liaising with the delivery team regarding client requirements, pricing and lead times, recording all opportunities on the CRM and maintaining record of activities, figures and forecasting, plus managing the compliance process for on-boarding new clients.The ideal candidate will be an ambitious, intelligent, and flexible individual with experience providing client care in a proactive, fast paced B2B office environment. The role is client-facing so you will have excellent communication skills, able to interact professionally and confidently at Director level by telephone, letter, email and face to face. You will have demonstrable organisational, project and time management skills, with the ability to multi-task, prioritise a workload and work under pressure and to deadline. With almost 3500 partners and staff across 35 offices generating a fee income of over £300 million, you would be joining one of the 3 principal mid-market accountancy firms at a particularly exciting time. The job will be suitable for candidates who have experience as the following: Sales Administrator, Business Development Executive, Client Service Administrator, Sales Executive, Account Manager, Business Development Manager, Sales Coordinator.This job would be suitable for candidates based in the following locations: Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, Ipswich, Stowmarket, Thetford, Diss, Newmarket, Cambridge, Ely, Sudbury.We are acting as a Recruitment Consultancy for this role.

title: Product Manager - games
description:
This leading games company is looking for a talented Product Manager to work on marketing and media plans that bring illustrious games titles to the UK and Ireland marketsKey ResponsibilitiesThe development and day-to-day management of media and marketing plans for games titlesLeading product marketing activity throughout the product lifecycle - market & audience insight, creative brief, marketing plan, ATL BTL marketing activities, post-campaign analysis Working with external agencies, the community team and the events team on the schedule, creative requirements and implementation of product-based communications Creation and management of sales forecasts, sales curves and reporting on games releasesClose collaboration with stakeholders to ensure consumer engagement across events, social media and community initiatives Management of budgets for allocated titles to ensure maximum valueWork closely with Digital Marketing to support digital product goalsLiaise with teams to ensure the management and timely generation of marketing asset Continual competitor analysis to monitor activity across marketing, sales and PR to maintain best in class campaignsWorking closely with third party publishers to deliver mutually beneficial campaignsCandidate RequirementsExperience of product, platform or service marketing including briefing media and creative campaigns Passionate about video games and interactive entertainment Proven track record of delivering multi-channel marketing campaigns incorporating incisive, innovative digital creative across desktop and mobile through digital display, search and social activationExcellent communicator capable of building the trust and respect of multiple stakeholders whilst able to build strong working relationships with external agencies and suppliersNumerate, incisive with data and the ability to interpret sales performance metrics, market trends and campaign performance metrics and then react appropriately to maximise impactThe ability to act independently with self-motivation whilst maintaining a strong sense of team identity, collaboration and coordinationEducated to ‘A’ Level or degree standard in a marketing / sales related qualificationfor more jobs like this follow @WayForward_ on Twitter


Contact: Gavin Sanders

title: Product Manager - Networked Video Solutions
description:
The OpportunityOur client is a world leading innovator in computer graphics, video capture and digital display technology. They currently have an exciting opportunity for a commercially minded and strategic Product Manager to join their team. Working in this marketing role you will be interacting directly with Customers, the engineering team, distributors and partners, and the operations team on a daily basis.As the Product Manager for Networked Video Solutions youll be responsible for aggregation and structuring of market requirements for products, structuring, organising, and helping prioritise product requirements for different products and working with the management team to develop the overall product roadmap.The Product Manager is also responsible for the articulation of the Unique Selling Points, competitive analysis, development of application notes, and case studies for products, and in general supporting the sales and marketing effort with product knowledge, as well as working with RD and the engineering Team.Your role will be to understand customer needs and translate this into objectives for the engineering teams to produce effective solutions. This is an exciting opportunity for an outgoing individual with excellent communications skills to develop their marketing career in a profitable growing business within a dynamic organisation.Key responsibilities:Developing details of required Product and software feature specificationsCompetitive analysis, and competitive positioning of productsSupporting Sales in pre-sales effortsDevelop application notes and user case studies for productsWorking with partner companies to enable sales of products in specific application areas.Provide general support in sales and marketingEast Midlands based salary is negotiable circa £50k-£60k + benefits.Your Skills, Qualities and AchievementsThe ideal candidate for the position will have experience of product management in a technology setting. Ideally with a background in software, hardware, Audio Visual or computer engineering. Good communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to confidently build relationships with colleagues and customers are important in the role.You will need a good understanding of PC Hardware and Audio Visual technologies. A good organiser who pays attention to detail you will be rich in initiative and energy whilst still being a good team player. You should have at least 3 years in a Product Marketing role within IT or AV technology products. The successful candidate will should have the potential to move into a Marketing Manager role within this growing company.The OrganisationOur client is a world leading innovator in computer graphics and high end display technology video walls etc., their expertise is in both hardware and software (driver) design and development. They have customers worldwide and offer excellent career opportunities for the successful candidate. An extremely profitable and expanding organisation the company invests in RD and in their staff to ensure they continue as leaders in their niche and ever-growing worldwide marketplace.The RecruitersAV Jobs are the UK's No. 1 specialist Audio Visual recruiters working with clients and candidates to ensure a perfect job fit every time.


Contact: Pat Deeley
        

Reference: Totaljobs/AV16417
        

Job ID: 74402762

title: Website and SEO Assistant
description:
Website and SEO Assistant
        








, 






Negotiable, DOE












Permanent


Yesterday



























Website and SEO AssistantLocation: Amersham, BuckinghamshireSalary: Negotiable, DOEContract: Permanent, Full TimeHours: Monday-Friday 8.30-5.30The Company: IQ Glass UK are the UK's leaders in specialist architectural glazing, specialising in the high end and exclusive property market. IQ Glass and the Texo Group are a forward thinking, modern design company; you would be supported by our web manager and marketing team and will receive every resource required to make your job enjoyable and successful. The following are a selection of Companies within the Texo Group that you would be working with: IQgates, IQ Glass, Hedgehog Aluminium systems, SkyHouse Design centre, Umbris, Minimal windows, IQ Metal, IQ Furniture.Website and SEO Assistant - The Role: We are looking for an enthusiastic website & SEO assistant to work in-house alongside our website manager and marketing team.  As a company servicing the architectural and design community our websites are at the forefront of our business and a lot of time and energy goes into creating a well-designed and easy to use website. Our in house website and marketing team are a fast moving, busy sector of the company and are advertising for an entry level website assistant to help update and manage our websites as well as optimise our websites for search engines using chosen keywords; other duties to include: • Adding web pages to existing company websites, either in WordPress or a similar CMS platform.• Updating or changing existing web pages as required, including images, text and layout.• Optimising website content to drive traffic in from search engines in accordance with agreed keywords.• Research and implementation of routes to improve our websites inbound traffic.• Troubleshooting any aesthetic or functional issue on our websites on request.• SEO On-Page/Off-Page optimisation. • Internal and external link optimisation. • Link building, earning and purification• Keyword and content research. • Competitor analysis • Adding, updating and changing our pre designed websites on request.• Working with the Marketing Team to research, develop and implement fully integrated marketing strategies.• Liaising with web designers to create new websites for new company ventures to ensure their compatibility with SEO activities and company requirements. Website and SEO Assistant – Candidate specification:This role would suit someone with an interest in web management and SEO looking to gain valuable knowledge and experience in the field. You will be fully supported by our web manager and marketing team. Successful candidates should have an interest in digital marketing. You must also have an interest in SEO practices and website management. Skills and Experience:The ability to multitask, work to deadlines and attention to detail are all important attributes and above all you should be keen to learn and progress, with a “can do” attitude.Desirable Technical skills:• Have knowledge of WordPress CMS .• Coding knowledge html 5, CSS, Java Script and J-Query would all be a bonus.• Be experienced in working with schema and structured website data, such as Microdata. • Have a good understanding of domain names, DNS administration and Cloudfare.• Have an understanding of AdWords and PPC campaigns. • Have knowledge of SEO tools such as Moz and Screaming Frog SEO Spider.• Have an understanding of Google and Bing Analytics and Webmaster tools.• In addition, a successful candidate must demonstrate an ability to learn quickly and take initiative.Other attributes:• Have good organisational skills• Be computer literate• Be proficient in the use of Microsoft Word and Excel.• Have a basic understanding of HTML and CSS.• Have a general understanding of content management systems (CMS) • Have an interest of understanding of how search engines work. This will be an excellent opportunity for a less experienced candidate to gain valuable knowledge and experience in a fast growing discipline, working full time in an exciting and fast moving company. A good attitude and desire to learn are quality's we are looking for in potential candidates, as they will be very beneficial for the role.Location Amersham is conveniently located outside of the M25 with excellent travel routes via the A40 and M25. Amersham also is easily accessible via train or the metropolitan tube with our offices a short walk from the station.Office hours are Monday-Friday 8.30-5.30 but successful candidates will have the opportunity to discuss alternative working hours if required. Website and SEO Assistant – What to do next?If you are interested in the above opportunity please apply online with your CV and covering letter explaining why you think you are suited to IQ Glass.Please check your email for confirmation that your application for this role has been received and to follow further instructions, if you are invited for an interview.No agencies please


Contact: IQ Glass Solutions
        

Reference: Totaljobs/IQGLASSSEO617

title: Email Campaign Developer
description:
I am currently looking for an experienced Email Campaign Developer who will be responsible for the upload of data, content and assets within the Marketing Automation and Social Media publishing platforms. You will be involved with the build, test and reporting on both one-off sends and simple automated campaigns, experience within email marketing is a must have.Some core responsibilities will include:*Implementing content and assets within Eloqua to support emails and landing pages*Build and activate a high volume of one-off sends and simple automated campaigns*Set up and distribute post-campaign reporting using Eloqua Insight*Optimise performance through A/B testing and segmentation using lists*Create and manage basic forms hosted in Eloqua landing pages*Upload marketing data to Eloqua as and when required*Pro-actively raise any platform issues or requirements to the aligned MA Specialist*Social publishing through Spredfast*May be some requirement to manage some small paid media campaigns as part of developmentRequired Skills/Experience *1+ years' experience in Oracle Eloqua or an alternative email marketing tool*1+ years' experience of executing paid social media campaigns*Demonstrated ability to manage concurrent projects*High degree of accuracy and ability to work at a detailed level on a daily basis*Highly organized, with good time management skills*Ability to work both independently and as a team member as necessary*Strong communication skills*Proficiency with Microsoft Office SuiteQualifications*Bachelor degree from an accredited university is required, preferably Business or Marketing related. *Salesforce.com certification is a major plus*Working knowledge of HTML, CSS and Salesforce

description:
Graduate Marketing Business Development Trainee
	









Barras Bridge, Newcastle Upon Tyne (NE1), NE1 7JG






Show my commute time






Enter your postcode




Go























£18,000-28,000 (average first year o.t.e.)










Permanent


Yesterday


























Graduate Marketing Business Development Trainee Wanted in NewcastleConcilio Solutions are hiring NOW!We currently have multiple full time, permanent or temp-permanent openings that are ideal for graduates looking learn, gain experience, and get their foot in the door of the business industry.*** Get ahead of the competition and apply with us today! ***Contact us if you have interest and are looking to gain experience in:Business, Leadership, Trainee ManagementSales and New Customer AcquisitionCustomer Service and Client RelationsMarketing and Brand ManagementAdministration and RecruitingInitially you’ll be working as part of an energetic team at pop-up events in places with heavy footfall such as retail shops, shopping centres, train stations, and trade shows. You’ll be interacting with customers face-to-face to promote products, explain offers, answer questions and receive feedback.You will developing and enhancing your sales and marketing strategies and approaches based on your personality and your territory. Every day is different ,and theres loads of room to develop and expand your comfort zone as build your confidence. *** Advancement and travel opportunities available for top performers looking to grow! ***For those that master the customer side of our business, we can offer additional training, development and career opportunities on the client side.Additional responsibility and opportunities would involve:Team Leadership, Account ManagementPublic Speaking, Sales ImpactsCampaign and Account ManagementRecruitment and DevelopmentOffice Management, Market ManagementClient Relations, CRMPublic Relations, Advertising *** This is a unique opportunity for graduates that want to be in control of their futures! ***We encourage you to apply now so we can meet you straight away during our recruitment rush!*** For consideration, send your CV or LinkedIn profile through the online application process today! ***We're looking to hold interviews in stages to ensure we find the right fit. We offer flexible working relationships in this self employed opening so we're happy to offer an unpaid shadowing day so both sides can make a mutual decision. Initially we will contact you over the phone if you are selected for a meeting with our Managers. Please check your inbox, spam, voicemail and messages as if we're not able to reach you we might need to move on with another applicant.


Contact: Paul T
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CS GM 0706PM
        

Job ID: 74401882

title: Midweight Digital Designer
description:
This is a lovely agency based in East Lancashire with a growing team and a lovely client list, looking for a strong Midweight Designer. They are keen to find a creative who can grow their strong creative reputation even further, you should be able to work from initial brief through to completion. Experience in using UX design practices to influence your design solutions would be beneficial, you should be an advocate of mobile first and responsive design. You’ll need a minimum of 3 years’ experience in either an agency or in-house role, you should be comfortable taking the lead on complex, multi-channel projects. It’s important you are comfortable in client facing situations, presenting and pitching work, and able to clearly outline your vision and ideas both internally and externally. Ideally you’ll have a good understanding of Front End technologies but you will be working alongside a talented Development team.

description:
Senior Account Manager - Food and Drinks Brands
        








South West London (SW1A), 






£35000 - £37000 per annum












Permanent


Expires in 3 days



























Senior Account Manager (Food & Drinks Brands) Central London £35,000 to £37,000 per annum Career Moves are working with a leading PR & Communications agency to source a Senior Account Manager to work with their food and drinks portfolio of clients.As a Senior Account Manager, you will be working on a portfolio of existing clients, nurturing key media and influencer relationships whilst supporting the team to deliver the agreed client programmes and desired results.Role Description:- Meet regularly with a broad spectrum of media to build new contacts and deliver media coverage - Proactively pitch to media coverage generating ideas that will include and support agency clients - Be responsible for the day to day running of client programmes with guidance and support from an Account Director. - Organise the mail-outs of clients merchandise promptly and correctly in response to requests - Contribute to media initiatives - Conduct research as appropriate to support the development of client plans and new business responses - Handle press enquiries quickly and effectively. - Work collaboratively with your colleagues toward the success of the wiser team and clients. - Facilitate the smooth running of the day to day function of each account team, providing support as requested and required. - Draft meeting minutes, agenda, progress reports etc. as necessary for your accounts The ideal candidate will be a talented Senior Account Manager with exceptionally strong food & drinks experience. You will be creative and strategic, with a strong passion for food & drinks brands and be a great team player.

title: Head of Acquisition
description:
One of the UK's fastest growing luxury ecommerce businesses is now looking for a Head of Acquisition based in Central London to join its expanding team to advise on a best practice customer acquisition strategy. This is a huge chance to play a pivotal role in the shaping of a great digital product, with a rebrand due in the next six months, you will have a vital role in the digital marketing strategy with core channels in mind, to ensure successful campaigns in the future and to make your mark on the future of the business so what are you waiting for?The Head of Acquisition will manage agency relationships and take the paid search activity to the next level, whilst working in an entrepreneurial team. The role will be reporting to the CMO and leading a small digital marketing team. This will be a career defining role for a successful candidate with the opportunity to grow as the company scales.As the Head of Acquisition your duties will include:Leading a performance marketing team of currently 2 executives.Monitoring budget and identifying opportunities to improve and scale performance.Owning and driving your channel effectively to hit stretching KPI targets.Strategic lead on additional marketing channels e.g. SEO, Facebook, Pinterest, Retargeting.Managing and optimising the AdWords accounts as well as Identifying opportunities to improve performance outside of the AdWords account via imagery, promotions, product descriptions and product landing pages.Helping refine our attribution methodology and recommend alternative attribution methodologies where relevant.To be a successful Head of Acquisition you will have the following skills and experience:Significant experience in paid search advertising.Experience in mentoring / line management.Advanced knowledge of bidding platforms, AdWords, Bing Ads, GA.Advanced MS Excel experience.Client side experience in an ecommerce company as well as agency would be ideal.In return, the Head of Acquisition will receive a salary of £70,000 - £80,000 per annum. The first stage of the application process is to apply online.Candidate Source Ltd is an Advertising Agency working on behalf of an Employment Agency. title: Marketing Executive - 12 month FTC
description:
Our Brand, Marketing and Communications (BMC) team helps EY to win in the marketplace through deep client relationships, exploring major opportunities for revenue growth and consistent reputation building.The Opportunity: We are looking for an enthusiastic Marketing Executive to support key marketing campaigns and help to build engagement with key influencers/decision makers to join us on a 12 month maternity cover basis.Your Key Responsibilities:Building and managing strong relationships with the business, campaign managers and wider support teamsProviding full marketing executional support for key campaigns and relationship development programmes across the whole marketing mixContributing creative ideas to develop campaigns and create the most effective internal and external client engagementManaging the production and delivery of agreed deliverables within timelines and budgetMeasuring the campaign activities and support the Campaign Manager with updating project plans and reporting on activitiesWorking closely with external agencies, in house studios, the wider BMC team and regional teams Skills and Attributes for Success:Stakeholder management and engagementConfident communicator, excellent written skillsAbility to multi-task and manage competing deadlinesCommercially minded and results-drivenCreative thinkerStrong team player/collaboratorTo Qualify for the Role you must have:A marketing or business degree (or equivalent) and experience of:Building and managing relationships with senior stakeholders and key stakeholder groupsIntegrated marketing campaign support and marcomms activitiesHigh attention to detail and proof reading capabilitiesEvent support - planning, delivery and control, preferably targeting c-suite/senior stakeholdersMarketing event delivery and managementA solid understanding of marketing principles, coupled with a strong commercial drive and the ability to deliver high-value marketing activities that deliver ROI.Ideally, you'll also have:Experience of working in large/matrix organisations, balancing multiple stakeholder requirementsA professional services background, however strong candidates from other sectors will also be considered.What we look for:With clients at the heart of everything we do, our marketing is focused on building influential client relationships with key buyers over their lifecycle and positioning our offerings to best win business. We are building high performing teams and recruiting the highest calibre marketing talent who will play a key role in helping EY deliver on its customer promise. You will be joining a dynamic team that is determined to deliver a world-class service to our clients, internally and externally. What working at EY offers We offer a competitive remuneration package where you'll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues aroundOpportunities to develop new skills and progress your careerThe freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that's right for youEY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

title: Bid Manager
description:
A global law firm is looking to recruit a Client Relationship Manager for their London office, this is a maternity contract that can be full time or part time, 3-4 days a week. You will be working in their dedicated banking client team and have responsibility for around four of their key clients. Reporting into the Senior Client Relationship Manager you will the go to for their clients as well as being responsible for the strategic direction This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking firm who have always been advances when it comes to client relationship initiatives.Working with the client teams you will be identifying cross selling opportunity’s, managing communication flow and attending important business meetings with the clients. You will be looking at ways to maximise the value of secondments as well as feeding into the firm wide client relationship plan.The successful candidate will have worked within professional services in a dedicated client relationship role and have first class communications. To apply, please click on the ‘apply’ button and send your Cover Note & CV with your contact details to Scarlette Bagan quoting reference SB/908383.It is Career Legal’s policy, as a matter of courtesy to respond to all applications within three working days. However because of the volume of applications, we are sometimes unable to respond to individual candidates. If we have not contacted you within three working days your application has been unsuccessful and your details have not been retained. Please apply for any other position that you may see in the future. Career Legal is a Recruitment Agency and is advertising this permanent vacancy on behalf of one of its Clients. Thank you


Contact: Scarlette Bagan
        

Reference: Totaljobs/SB/908383
